reviews.text: Fran received a gift card to cheesecake factory for her birthday. We both ordered the chop salad. I informed the waitress that it was my friends birthday. They brought the cheesecake, that had been decorated with chocolate on the plate, but we were still charged for it. I would think that the least they could do was serve a small Sundae or something as a complementary birthday dessert.

I never venture to this side of town buttttt when the girls wanna do brunch I&#39;ll make an exception. Got here around 10:30am and it was pretty dead which was nice and immediately ordered an expresso martini. It was really good and not too sweet. I ordered the Thai chicken lettuce wraps... and I was blown away by not only how good they were but the presentation of them as well! I would order these again in a heartbeat! Yummmmmm

YES. All of the yes. Came for my birthday with my dad today. Our server was Matthew T (Mattie!). We got the Ahi Tartare appetizer to start, YUM. Topped with sesame seeds and ginger with a sauce  then for entrees my dad got the stuffed cheddar burger (no picture, sorry folks) and I got the Mac and Cheese ball burger  lord help me so crispy and cheesy and then with sweet potato fries that were PERFECT! The ending dessert was the peters caramel rippled cheesecake which was SO GOOD but rich I could only do half. It&#39;s a cheesecake rippled with caramel, fudge and butterfinger and Reese&#39;s HOLY COWS! Then my dad got the pineapple upside down cheesecake which was FARRRRRR BEYOND GOOD. 10/10 recommend, not at all disappointed. Would definitely recommend. Thanks Mattie and your kind team member who finished out the meal when you took your break. Also, I&#39;m sitting at the table while writing this!

So COVID must have done away the customer service aspect of this restaurant. I visited for take out yesterday and I had several issues during my visit. <br>1. I had a promo code for 2 free slices of cheesecake with a $30 purchase. I attempted to order using the website and continued to receive an error message whenever I tried to apply the promo code. So I opted to order online but pay at the restaurant and show the cashier my email offer. The cashier and manager Henry refused to help me with this. They told me that they could not apply the discount regardless of my online technical difficulties. They told me I had to pay for the desserts or leave them. I opted to leave them. I know the manager could have worked with us and honored our offer but he refused. I even took a screenshot of the difficulties I was having online applying the code. They didn&#39;t care. <br>2. My order was 10 minutes late even though I ordered 1.5hrs before the pickup time. <br>3. My burger was made incorrectly. It did not come with tomatoes even though it said tomatoes on the receipt. It also contained mayonnaise when that was not advertised on the item description. <br>This whole visit was very disappointing. I didn&#39;t eat out much during COVID time but when I do, I try to support my favorite restaurants. The staff during this visit was not helpful at all.
Just got my cheesecake and this is what was delivered, sizes are ridiculously smaller than I remember. At least give a decent sized slice. Smh.
Favorite place to have lunch or dinner.  You can never go wrong with the Steak Diane &amp; a Georgia peach!

I can say I love the cheesecake factory. I think the food is consistently good, the menu is so large you could never get bored of the options and variety. Some of my favorites are crab cakes, the boston house salad, the chicken tortilla soup, the tacos are good, the thai lettuce wraps. Pretty much you can&#39;t go wrong with whatever you fancy. Typically it is a  busy spot during lunch and dinner (not during covid) but it is a really big restaurant and has a great outdoor space as well.

I&#39;ve always had a positive experience at Cheesecake Factory. In fact, I have frequented it often as many of my family members have worked there. Last night&#39;s dinner was extremely disappointing. I ordered my usual, the Tuscan Chicken. Not only did it not look appealing but the chicken was extremely over cooked, dry and sitting in a pool of liquid. The bread was not up to the usual standards either. It was squished and flat. My complaint to the manager fell on deaf ears. He did not care enough to rectify the situation to my satisfaction. Not exactly what one would expect during such difficult times!

Pretty great experience! Great bar! Really nice low key place! That had really great music playing! The bartender was very nice, welcoming and easy to talk to. Asked what the most popular skinnylicous item was and was told the Mexican chicken salad was. Ordered it. Started off with Pinot Nior. Showed two options and picked Mark West. It was really good! Smooth! <br><br>The salad came shortly after! It was Huge! Tasted ridiculously good! Very refreshing! All fresh ingredients! Amazing! All that can be said is WoW! And their wheat bread! Very delicious too! <br><br>Just an outstanding lunch! So much of it too!  2 meals! <br><br>My only complaint is I wish it had a little more chicken. <br><br>You definitely get your money&#39;s worth! <br><br>Really great service and delicious food! A lot to try on their Skinny menu! Highly recommended!

I tried the Verry Cherry Ghirardelli Chocolate Cheesecake ! It was really good. It wasn&#39;t overwhelming sweet like I expected, and there are real black cherries layered on too lf the chocolate cake part. I recommend it! Our server was very nice and attentive also. Great experience.

Stopped here for lunch.<br>Two of us shared the Lettuce Wraps... huge and yummy!<br>and the order of mini sliders.  I will always order the lettuce wraps, but Likely not the mini sliders.  The lettuce wraps is plentiful... seems to be healthy :)... and has delicious sauces.!!!

Tonight&#39;s order was an online order that was ready to be picked up at 7:00.  We received our order around 7:50. because it wasn&#39;t ready yet. We waited and it took us an hour to receive our food. When we got our food it was cold like it was sitting in the freezer. The mac and cheese balls appetizer was frozen cold when we took a bite into it it wasn&#39;t very appetizing at all. Not only that but we didn&#39;t get any utensils so we had to get utensils from another place near by. Cheesecake is usually our go to spot for a restaurant but sadly we won&#39;t be coming back anytime soon. The food and service did not live up to the price that you pay for these dishes. We paid 60$ Just for food to be given to us very cold.

It&#39;s hit or miss here.. First time I ordered online, went to pick it up and it was about 5-10mins later then my scheduled time which is pretty normal and I&#39;m completely fine with since the food was correct and tasted great. Second time I ordered online, waited in the lobby for about 40-45 mins AFTER my scheduled pick up time which surprisingly I&#39;m ok with, I&#39;m in no rush.. Finally get our order and the food was cold and my Buffalo chicken appetizer was only about half of the food that I received the first time I ordered it. Figured portion sizes should be pretty similar and as much as I hate being food back, I brought it back. They heated up a couple new tenders and threw them in the box for me. Just seems very unlike Cheesecake Factory.

rder food for staff for birthday but what do you know they forgot to put cake in them bags. Asked the waitress if all was in the bags and she replied &#34;YES.&#34; Their response when we called them and asked if they could get the cake delivered, manager said &#34;IT CAN&#39;T BE DELIVERED SINCE IT WAS ALREADY PAID FOR.&#34; Okay then. We asked for the money back and the funds to be returned to the same card we paid them with and manager said &#34;UNFORTUNATELY, WE CAN&#39;T DO THAT. WE COULD ONLY GIVE STORE CREDIT.&#34; I could go on and on about the conversation. Moral of the story: Money was out of the card, we were out of cake and the Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t seem to care about correcting their mistake.

This Beautiful large restaurant with tall windows was kind of a cross between Jules Vern and art deco. As usual arriving at an off hour or slightly before rush pays generous benefits. It wasn&#39;t as noisy and the service was attentive. The menu here is extensive with hundreds of items and so you could eat through it over a year and it would seem like a different place each time. You certainly wouldn&#39;t get tired of the menu too quickly.<br><br>The booth was a little tight and is probably made for people who don&#39;t eat here very often, or anywhere else for that matter. It was tight. I don&#39;t know if the bread is made on site or not but it&#39;s a nice variety, very fresh and nicely warmed. They also serve it with a nice slab of butter unlike a lot of places where there are some skimpy little and not enough. The appetizers were delicious looking and we got an order of the avocado eggrolls. These were huge, rich, and the perfect amount for three people. The sauce that came with it was a nice contrast.<br><br>For my entrée, I ordered the chicken and biscuits with gravy. I enjoyed those dishes it came with mashed red potatoes which were quite yummy. I did not eat the biscuits which is not uncommon. Besides they were hard. The chicken was pretty basic and it had some vegetables like carrots and peas. The portion did not disappoint.<br><br>I was quite happy to skip the cheesecake and opted for their tiny little complementary birthday dessert which was basically five spoonfuls of some kind of fudge and whip cream. It was more than enough. I asked them not to sing happy birthday to me as I totally hate being fussed over. Besides my birthday was several days ago!<br><br>My parents really enjoyed this restaurant and it was very nice for them in particular. It was palatial, elegant, and offered them all sorts of really nice choices. Best yet the meal for three of us was only like $78 with the tip. I had treated them to Flemings next-door a couple months back and I think it was over $300. And the meal wasn&#39;t that great. So in this regard the cheesecake factory was a bargain and it was just nicer. Mind you none of us drink. And we never order anything other than water when we&#39;re out. Sugar drinks just seem totally unnecessary to me so I never spend money on them.<br><br>All in all it was a wonderful night spending time with my dear parents. I&#39;m grateful for that meal that we got to share together and that they were having a good day. Thank you cheesecake factory for a nice elegant meal. I&#39;ve overlooked you for years but you know what they say, better late than never!<br><br>-G
Delicious food, great experience overall, good atmosphere, delicious dessert options, &amp; affordable prices.
Menu was greasy feeling, Eggs Benedict was dry. They need to up their game. Breakfast was horrible.<br>I&#39;ll try elsewhere next.

Always a delight dining at The Cheesecake Factory. I have eaten at this chain likely over 100 times (Fresno, San Francisco, Walnut Creek, Sacramento, Pleasanton, Roseville, San Jose, Las Vegas, Anaheim). We make it a requirement to dine here every time we are in the Fresno area. <br><br>5 stars because of the obvious magnifying, grand, and luxurious ambiance. From the moment you walk in, you feel transported to an upscale, rich, and classy Las Vegas casino because of how extravagant it is. <br><br>As for the food, also 5 stars, I have ordered practically almost everything from the menu and really never have any issues. An added bonus is the free bread to sustain you while waiting for your food (don&#39;t forget to ask for olive oil and vinaigrette as you only get butter). At times it can be very busy with a wait but it is definitely worth it (we always ask for a booth). There also is a nice bar with large tvs so this makes it a good choice to catch a game as well despite not being a sports bar. Furthermore, their bakery is mouthwatering. <br><br>Customer service and parking have never been an issue for us even when they&#39;re busy. I highly recommend eating here if you never have. You haven&#39;t lived until you&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake Factory.
I gave 2 stars instead of 1 only because the curbside waitress was so nice. For how pricey it is, it shouldn&#39;t look this way or mess up a bread order.

I&#39;m usually a fan of Cheesecake Factory dining in, however recently placed an order for curbside pick up and was rather disappointed. I ordered a slice of red velvet cheesecake and the tiramisu cake. I understand that things aren&#39;t going to be perfect as they would be for dining in, however I feel like there could have been a little more effort/thought when packaging up the food to go. Service for pick up wasn&#39;t an issue, in fact when I parked I was quickly helped by an employee who went in and came out with my bag of dessert. However, to my disappointment I looked in my bag and the tiramisu was sideways, the cheesecake was falling over/getting smooshed, and there was tiramisu sauce all over the inside of the bag. Again, I understand it can&#39;t be perfect but kind of hope in the future there could be a little more care when packaging the food as I was hoping to plate these for a surprise birthday treat at home but honestly they looked too beat up. I don&#39;t feel it was worth the $20 I paid nor the trip I made to pick it up. Hope in the future it&#39;s better quality and a better experience.

We had a birthday dinner tonight at the Cheesecake Factory. The menu is so large it&#39;s difficult to make up your mind. In the end we all got ribeye steaks and salads and a macaroni and cheese to boot. Our steaks were cooked as ordered and everything was delicious. We all had to have cheesecake of course. Their cheesecake is the best ever and you can&#39;t leave without having any in fact I think it&#39;s the law. The service and food were all good so I recommend eating here.

95% of this time I can always rely on good food. I&#39;ve gone here countless times but I&#39;m almost always happy. There&#39;s been very very few times I&#39;ve left unhappy but they are always very professional and keep everything clean and good so it&#39;s a safe place for any first date or fun night out. Good prices and great food 10/10

Dont go here. The patio is hot. I called in a reservation for 6 for my sons birthday they said come early then when I got there they said there&#39;s no table for 6. The manager was utterly unhelpful. I&#39;ll never spend my money here again. They place is poorly run. What I heard yesterday was wrong today.

One of the worse experience ever. I order curbside on 8/5/20 @8:15PM  for a fettuccine Alfredo. I basically paid for boiled pasta and had to make my own sauce at home. On top of that there was random mushrooms and bell peppers in my food. First photo is what I got second 2 is after I added my own Alfredo sauce. Never been so disappointed. After biting into random mushrooms and bell peppers I had to toss it. I came from a long day of work and was looking forward to this. I am not the type of person to complain but this was just horrible.

Everytime we go there, their seating from the hostesses are horrible. They always try to cram you in a little table surrounded by other people when theres plenty of other tables and booths available without having to sit so close to others where you literally you listen to the conversation as if your a part of the group. We always have to say, no we are not sitting there. And I&#39;m not apologizing for wanting my god damn space when eating. Hostesses need an attitude check when a customer doesnt want to sit where they try to seat you. It&#39;s ridiculous. Now, if it was busy, I would understand but we never go when its rush hour. We either go really early or really late.<br><br> However, the food has never disappointed us and the servers are always wonderful. And we never waited to long for our food and bread. I love the bread. But sometimes the bread is to hard, as if it was over baked. And it cools off very quickly. It would be much better if they served it in a warm dish that will keep it warmer longer.
Despite how busy they are, the staff was professional, courteous, kind, and quick! Not only is the staff amazing, but the food is great too! Definitely a business worth supporting.

The reception was very rude ! Confused and stupid! I asked her how long is the wait ? And she says for what ? Omg why else would I be in a restaurant? I said to dine in and eat ! She says you have to be on the list ! I said were do I get on the list ? She says here ! Omg this air head !!!! <br>30 min wait out in the sun !!! I talked to her manager about her bad attitude, and he seemed to be even ,more stupider then her !!! All I got was a sorry and that don&#39;t sound like his staff !!!!
Another update. STILL did not get word back from customer service situation was handled very poorly.

Horrible . Place an order for pick up got my food I asked the girl that was attending me if everything was inside there and she assure me it was ! Drove back home 35 minutes to find out that I was missing wings, cheese cake slices and few other things , I called back to let them know I wasn&#39;t even upset  because I should of checked either way before I left . But anyways called spoked to the manger he sent me a gift card for the amount that I was missing took about a whole week I was missing about 50$ of food.... dude sends me a gift card for 20$ lmfao lol never again... oh an the steak I order was burnt lol

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here. Finally caught the happy hour and it was worth it. $6.50 appetizers instead of the usual $12-13 price. Came on a Friday before 6pm and seated quickly. We beat the dinner crowd obviously lol. Happy hour is only offered around the bar area. The seating is great outside, too bad we couldn&#39;t be seated out there for happy hour.<br><br>The food is good for what it is. A chain restaurant where meals cost about $11+ for dinner. It&#39;s not my usual pick anymore since I was 20, but I&#39;d have to say, the happy hour prices are legit. I&#39;d return again for the happy hour food.

This chain is consistent.  Delicious tasting food, huge variety, and great services. Portions sizes are huge,  you will be taking some leftovers home for sure. I have been to The Cheesecake Factory multiple times in various locations and you can definitely trust that you will enjoy each one. My only gripe is that some of the plates are a but pricey. If you are going to dine here, plan accordingly.
A 15.00 meal and they give me a school cafeteria spork. Can&#39;t even pick up the food. I&#39;m eating out of the tray like a pig eating out of a trough. Shocking for the Cheesecake Factory

Besides the fact that managers didn&#39;t spend time to train their staff on how to answer the phone, their staff can&#39;t even use their common sense to help a customer. I placed an online order using the link on the website for a $10 promo, but somehow it didn&#39;t go through &amp; I called &amp; explained to her I have the email too. She said, I know a few other customers today had the same issue let me put you on hold first time for 15 min, then I knew they forgot, I called &amp; explained &amp; she said let me get a manager, I told her how long I was on hold, I was on hold for another 15 min then some one else picked up &amp; said thnx for holding what did you want to order? I explained how long I was on hold, she said we&#39;re too busy, hard to find a manager around &amp; let me find him. At that point, I knew they&#39;re just putting me on hold hoping that I will get tired &amp; hang up myself. After almost an hour of hold it was fee min left to 9pm closing time, I called again they knew my number &amp; didn&#39;t answer, after that they kept picking up &amp; hanging up right away very RUDE, shame on them I wonder if they hired bunch of kids that think ignorance is the best customer service, instead of training staff to take customer&#39;s info &amp; have manager call them later or telling customer call back tomorrow to speak to a manager, which I would of been fine if they&#39;re crazy busy. Right now all dine-ins are closed, so they&#39;re open for take out only, So it shouldn&#39;t be that crazy when there is no customers inside, most orders are through app &amp; curbside pick up. Besides that I ordered for scheduled advance pick up, but looked like they didn&#39;t pay attention to the time &amp; made it way in advance food was not even warm, it was really cold. I was on time &amp; obviously don&#39;t expect to see a steaming hot food like dine in, but the food was really cold.  Worst experience ever!!!

I love coming to the cheesecake factory! They have many different food options and think that everyone can find something they like. I usually get a burger with bacon. I have tried the huevos rancheros and it was very good. I have also tried a few pastas that were also good. I usually stick with the chicken alfredo type pastas. And my favorite dessert was the short cake with ice cream!! It is delicious. Honestly, I am not the biggest cheesecake lover but I have tried a few different kinds and they are very good. I go for the chocolate or oreo ones.
There&#39;s something for everyone here. The food and service are always consistent. Calamari and any chicken with angle hair like pasta and creamy sauce are my go-to&#39;s
This is my fave!! Get it every time! so soft and full of flavor! You can ask for extra lemon sauce on the side too  I typically have enough left over for lunch the next day!

So I gave the Fresno Cheesecake Factory another tru for last week when they dropped my door dash orders without explanation, and 20 minutes into waiting.   Big mistake.  The food was not even close to TCF standards. The taquitos has unraveled as they fried and burned.  And they tasted unsalted.  The potstickers were ok but not great either.

Wow this unbelievable from the cheesecake factory staff I ordered a carrot cake cheesecake and 2 tiramisus. The carrot cake was not even in tact and the tiramisus came in containers that were too small so it squished them down. Overall unacceptable.

Love the food but they are not setup for pick up. Made the huge mistake of picking up my own Door Dash order on Mother&#39;s Day. The line was at least 50 cars long. They prioritized Door Dash drivers versus regular people. Everyone is dealing with COVID-19 challenges but no indication was given when ordering. Poor service. It&#39;ll be a while before we ever eat at Cheesecake Factory again, if ever again.

I recently did a takeout order today and the food was amazing. I only wished the staffs would double check that all my items were there. I only had 4 items on my order. I didn&#39;t realized I was missing my cheesecake until I arrived home and then have to drive back to have trouble finding parking for curbside take out. Overall, food is great only issue here was the inconvenience.

I love cheesecake, my boyfriend and I come here often. This time was a little weird, I order the factory chef salad and as I was eating it something blue was in it. I was really not sure what it was and it turned me off a little, I didn&#39;t want to finish my food. I never said anything because I&#39;m not the kind of person to make a scene or anything but just thought it was really odd and hope they see this and maybe double check their food.

Well where shall I begin <br>I wouldn&#39;t give it any stars but had to for my review...<br>Cleanliness was horrible from table to silverware to bathrooms <br>My table was so sticky would have thought they wiped it down with soda<br>Bench was full of food and sticky as well top of the booths had dirt not dust that&#39;s how long it&#39;s been up there!<br>Silverware was dirty <br>Bathrooms were disgusting couldn&#39;t believe what I was seeing asked myself I wonder what the kitchen looks like? <br>Had to wait over 20 minutes for a glass of water and another 15 for a straw<br>Food I&#39;m sorry it was awful everyone in our party got sick except 1 person that had a sandwich and only ate 2 bites because it was cold and disgusting <br>Over priced and food and service sucked<br>would have rather went to <br>Chick a fila <br><br>I can&#39;t believe how our experience was I will never return or recommend this place<br><br>So all in all I give them a F<br>They need to retrain there staff all the way to the top they honestly have forgotten why they have jobs because of We The Customers!!!<br>Customer service is everything <br>Great food means a lot <br>Cleanliness is most definitely important <br><br>Sorry not sorry  just being 100 real!

I&#39;m sorry but the Cheesecake Factory has went down. I said I wasn&#39;t eating there anymore bc the food isn&#39;t good any more. I decided to get the chicken picatti to go ... my noodles were undercooked. It wasn&#39;t all that good.. no flavor at all This is a dish that used to have a rich flavor.. but not today. I didn&#39;t care too much for the mushrooms appetizer..they were ok.. I think I&#39;m just going stick with the cheesecake.. that&#39;s the  only thing I think they can do no wrong with.. they taste soo good!

Ordered takeout last night and came today at 5 to pick up my order. line is WRAPPED around fashion fair!!! went to try and pick up my food inside and they just said &#34;you&#39;ll have to wait in line&#34; no apology nothing. asked about our food being ready at 5:30 and if we can pick it up and he said it&#39;s probably not even ready. doordash people were waiting an hour plus. HORRIBLE service for their &#34;busiest day of the year&#34; maybe let&#39;s find better service and a better way of getting people their food. ABSOLUTELY ridiculous!!!!

First time eating out since March. Let&#39;s just say Fresno has it down, wearing those mask. Way to go!  The Cheesecake Factory really has it down! Felt safe to take my kids and enjoy a birthday early dinner. Food was great! My kids really enjoyed them self&#39;s, we were all satisfied.
I used doordash. Usual TCCF food. Kids loved the pizza and the cake. 4 ppl shared one slice of cake. <br>It good.

I am amazed that the meal I got at Cheesecake was so awful.  Wednesday is mushroom soup day which I love their Mushroom soup. We ordered for curbside pickup and that was great.  The lady was there when we pulled up.  We got our order and headed home.  My husband ordered Chicken and Biscuits and I had a Renee Special because of the soup. One taste of the soup and I almost threw up.  I was eating dirt.  Needless to say they did not clean the mushrooms before making the soup.  There was so much grit in the soup it was nauseating.  Please, please tell your cooks to clean the mushrooms.  Shame on Cheesecake for serving this to their customers.

The staff was ok the food was ok  , however they should have fans with misters , it would make the experience 100% better since we are having to dine outside , the other restaurants next to them have misters with fans , the tables are placed in the sun , had to ask for water fours times , my last trip to cheesecake until things are back to normal

I wanted to give an update on the review. I wanted to be a bit more fair with this location. The service coming this time was much much better! The lady that helped us was very attentive and she checked on us thoroughly throughout the night.. (say that 5 times fast lol)<br><br>The food list is so enticing! They have pasta&#39;s and pizza&#39;s, sandwiches, burgers, fish, steak, and of course their legendary cheesecake! It&#39;s the best out there and so many flavors to choose from makes my mouth water just thinking about it!! <br><br>I have a bunch of these free cheesecake coupons that are good until April so I have been going every so often to get some after my meal. If anybody wants to go you know who to message! hahah.. I love the pasta dishes, they really add a lot of extra flavor to it and make it unique to them. This place specifically isn&#39;t so busy anymore because I guess the hype has died down.. Fine with me, me and my friends get right in! ; ) <br><br>5 stars for a good quality establishment and great service. I am a new fan of this place!

My experience is going to be from overall. I&#39;ve come here a few time over the years, for a dinner date, for my birthday, for my friend&#39;s birthday and just for dinner and my favorite dish is the seafood jambalaya. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience. The service is good and they cater very well to large parties. Their drinks are too expensive for the amount they serve though. I do appreciate that they allow you to bring your own cake though!

This place has gone way down hill. I visited this past Easter Sunday at around 12pm. They were not busy and it took over an hour to get our food. When we sat down, the first thing we noticed was a dirty fork on our table. The photos speak for themselves... dirty fork, over cooked potatoes (rocks), steak Dianne with some Dijon mustard (???). If this was my first time here I would never come here again. <br>I ordered the steak Dianne combo with salmon. They got my order wrong and platted my steak and mashed potatoes separately and told me that the salmon would be coming. The steak then had mustard on it for some reason. I sent it back and waited for my plate and it came back by the time my table was already done eating.

We had the best experience eating here. Martin was an excellent server. He was very attentive and kept checking in on us. Coming in at a dinner rush and having a thirty minute wait was worth it. The grilled salmon was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Can&#39;t forget the amazing cheesecake!!!

So before posting this review a little suggestion popped up asking that we take this covid time into consideration before posting because &#34;things didn&#39;t go as planned&#34;.  So i&#39;m glad they brought it up because at this crucial time in our country when we are all trying to support the businesses NOW more than EVER we should be choosing our employees and paying attention to how the clients are being treated because after my experience tonight ( just the phone call ) i will not be returning. I was hung up on by a very rude young girl by simply asking if they took reservations (a very valid question as most restaurants have gone to that since they reopened) and her tone with me was nasty and disrespectful then if that wasn&#39;t bad enough she hung up on me. I called back just to be treated rudely by a young boy. I have to say that i wouldn&#39;t want this attitude and behavior working for me. A suggestion to the manager, pay attention to who you hire and if you need a dishwasher or someone to mop the floors after closing they are probably ok if they&#39;re kept behind the scenes but a person or persons such as this should never be dealing with the clients. They&#39;re bad attitudes was a reflection on the entire restaurant. I certainly will not be returning.

First time back in a restaurant since the Pandemic and what made this experience a full 5 stars was the customer service from Martin. The food was as expected. My boyfriend and I had nothing but fantastic, friendly, customer service from martin. Our glasses were always full, he attended to our needs! This gentleman was patient, full of jokes and had us laughing the whole time! If all servers were like Martin everyone would had an amazing experience!!!
I was already called in for my table I was set aside and other people were aloud to go in and given a table over me and the other customers arrived after me. Really bad experience.

My family took me there for Father&#39;s Day. We ordered Steak Diane. It was the worst meal I&#39;ve ever had. It has no taste to it and it was really chewy. The bathroom was filthy, the dining room floor was dirty, and the service was slow. Don&#39;t waste your money over there. Worst dinner experience I&#39;ve had in a long time.

Went for dinner last night, I&#39;m from Reno and have always had a pleasant experience but last night was terrible.... the place closed at 9 and me and my bf got there around 8:15... got seated at a table and wait for a good 15-20 for someone to come get our drink order.... then wanted another 15-30 for the bread to come.. then that&#39;s when they decided to take out order... we waited another 20 mins for our food to be served.... never have I ever had to wait that long to eat dinner somewhere before and then when I asked one of the managers how much longer it would be till we would get our food he turns and just says I&#39;ll have to see with attitude and I&#39;m like okay...... smh over terrible experience but I will say my waitress was very nice

The Cheesecake Factory is always a solid option. Menu is incredibly predictable. Food is pretty &#34;safe.&#34; Service seems to be the only thing that varies from place to place. <br><br>I was in Fresno and needed a &#34;nice&#34; place to eat. Something a bit more casual than, say, Chili&#39;s but not enough to break the bank. Cheesecake Factory popped up on Yelp, and I didn&#39;t have enough mental energy to commit to spending anymore time trying to find anything else.<br><br>The menu here is huge. Almost too huge. It makes you wonder if they everything on the menu is even that great. I can tell you that for the most part, the menu is &#34;safe.&#34; You have pasta dishes, meat dishes, sandwiches, burgers, so on and so forth. They even have low carb cheesecake. You could bring a random assortment of people here, and you&#39;d be hard-pressed to have a guest who has no idea what to here.<br><br>Oddly enough I can&#39;t tell you what to get other than from the dessert section. But I can tell you what to avoid. Don&#39;t get the steak dishes. The steaks are pathetic. I&#39;ve had better steaks from a frozen TV dinner heated in my oven. Avoid the salmon. It&#39;s usually super dry. The salads here are weak. Almost like someone opened a $2 salad mix from Vons, dumped it on a plate, and plopped cooked meat on top. But in terms of dessert, I&#39;m a massive fan of their plain cheesecake and the chocolate tower truffle cake. I swear that chocolate cake could give an entire township diabetes from a single.<br><br>Overall, if you are in Fresno, have no idea where to eat, and don&#39;t want to expend any energy trying to find what the locals like, check out Cheesecake Factory.

I&#39;ll be the first  one to say they have great  cheesecake,  what got me upset was their 15 dollar drinks that were all ice to the top ,when I told the bartender he said nothing he could do about it , hes following protocol, and then the manager couldn&#39;t  care less , when I  called corporate it was the same negative attitude,  If I wanted as glass of ice 7 11 has a large cup for a buck, if I   want to get ripped off , I can go to Vegas at least the odds are better, If I spend 15 dollars for a drink I expect 15 dollars worth of alcohol not ice, long story short I never went back, BJs is across the parking lot. Cya...

3 mix ups in one sitting on a first date is overwhelming lol great food though! <br>First they got my name wrong for my reservation, so they were calling and calling a wrong name and I went up and told the host, &#34;I think that might be me&#34; since our reservation time had passed. She guaranteed that I was wrong, turns out I was right lol. Then they sat us down at a table, then asked us to move after we already had our drinks... And last but not least, the wrong server came up to us to take our order, noticed after, then I had to re order through another server. I&#39;ll be back, the food is great, just train your staff better or maybe hire people with more experience.

Service was great at the cake counter.<br>Just ran in to grab a couple of slices. How the heck can one choose? So many kinds. All looked good, fresh.<br>Finally purchased the lemon meringue cheesecake and the dulce de leche cheesecake. WOW! So amazing. Even the whipped cream made it a few hours until home. One even kept well in the fridge until the next day. I could not pick a fave between the 2. Both good and not too sweet. Great choices. Almost $18 for 2 slices...<br>I am not sure how I could come in here and not order a meal. I love it here. I did not grow up with a Cheesecake Factory nor do I get to visit it often enough (usually just 1-2 times a year in Vegas). I love the menu and if I could only have 1 dessert ever, it would be this restaurant&#39;s cheesecake. I cannot imagine with all the varieties, making a bad choice. A real treat.

4.5 stars<br><br>My wife got the pineapple mango chicken with brown rice and spicy green curry. She was very pleased with her meal and the service here (and that is actually all that matters for a husband!)<br><br>The kids shared 2 dishes:<br><br>1. Kids spaghetti with one big meatball - (my wife and I love the way that meatball tasted and it&#39;s texture was soft and delectable.) the spaghetti sauce was not sour at all like some other restaurants serve their sauces.<br><br>2. Kids chicken Fingers with fries - the kids loved it and ate it all with the ketchup, ranch and barbecue sauces that came with the meal.<br><br>We received hot, fresh bread from a server-hopper before our actual server came to our table. That was nice. Our server came just a minute or 2 after we started eating our bread. She got our drinks first and came back instantly to take our order.<br><br>Overall, our experience was good here. We came to celebrate my daughter&#39;s 4th bday. We got her a birthday (free) ice cream Sunday and some of the staff sang happy birthday to her. <br><br>The only problem I had was with my meal which wasn&#39;t really a problem; it was more of a preference. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan in a  &#34;Pizza style.&#34;<br><br>My chicken Parmesan pizza was a little too dry for my liking. The creamy pasta on top with the melted mozzarella and tomato sauce helped out with the dryness; however, my wife and kids loved it and ate most of it. Again, it was my personal preference that the chicken was &#34;dry.&#34; My family loved it.<br>My wife was completely happy and so were my kids so that means we shall return for another celebration, God willing!

5 Stars because i am a BIG cheesecake lover and the salted Caramel cheesecake was so delicious!!! The gumbo was not as spicy as I expected but it was good. The steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi were great, just wish I had more then 3 pieces of steak and shrimp. Overall we had a great experience as first timers of the Cheesecake Factory in Fresno, Ca. Our waitress was great, she answered every question we had to ask and she was very polite.

Okay, yes I know it&#39;s a chain restaurant, but it&#39;s also delicious. I&#39;ve been coming here since it opened up and I can&#39;t recall a bad visit to this particular location. Service has always been up to par and the food is always freshly made. My BBQ chicken salad makes me smile and say &#34;mmmm&#34; every time!<br>I do appreciate that they offer lunch portions of my favorite salad and other dishes. It makes trying new things a lot easier. Place is clean and also conveniently located outside of the Fashion Fair Mall so walking off your lunch/dinner is a cinch. <br>Oh let&#39;s quickly talk about the cheesecake. It&#39;s sweet, it&#39;s savory, it&#39;s beautiful and it makes both my heart and belly happy in ways people can&#39;t even. Lol jk but seriously it&#39;s goood. Whether it&#39;s the plainest of all cheesecake or a fancy shmancy one, you won&#39;t be let down.

First time at this Cheesecake Factory. The ambiance was beautiful and very nice but it was slightly dark and antiquated. The place was very clean, we were greeted and seated right away. <br><br>After being spotted the server was nice, she took our order. We waited 30 minutes to get out food, my children were falling asleep waiting for their food. The odd part was the restaurant was almost empty there many servers walking around but we had to wait a long for our food. <br><br>When our food finally arrived at the same time. The adult came first then the children&#39;s food came 15-20 min after. We as parents should not be expected to eat our food before our children we had to wait about 45 min all together go dine at the same time. The first experience we, not a good one at the cheesecake factory and I don&#39;t think we will be back. Considering the prices there&#39;s nothing special about the restaurant, the service and the quality of food.

Today we celebrated my older sisters birthday at The Cheesecake Factory with a party of 16 people.<br>I was running behind (as usual) and received a call that we were going to have to be seated outside due to the whole party not being there.<br>I wasn&#39;t too happy about it until my nephew Felix who works as a chef called me and told me to relax that they would make it as  comfortable as possible for us.<br>We went and had a great time...<br>We had 2 margaritas, mama had blended strawberry and I had a regular on the rocks with 2 cherries...yummy!<br>They had outdoor heaters at both sides of our table and we were nice and toasty.<br>After a little while it got really hot and the staff ran out to lower it down.<br>The food was amazing as usual...I almost forgot to take a picture of my Chicken Bellagio (soooo delicious)<br>Mama got the grilled Salmon and couldn&#39;t stop sharing so everyone could savor the fish.<br>My daughter had the 4 cheese pasta and shared as well...amazing!<br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for always making our visit awesome!

I love Cheesecake Factory because the service is always spot on, but tonight it was not. <br>Viviana was our server and we did not have our drinks refilled until we were all out and asked, Same with the bread. No Parmesan cheese offered on the pasta. <br>Not a huge deal for any night, but I felt bad that we got such bad service on my friends 21st birthday dinner.

You&#39;ve been to one Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve been to them all. Cheesecake factory is a chain, they are a brand, so consistency is key with a big chain like them. I&#39;m from the bay area and regularly go to 3 Cheesecake factory locations regularly over there. My recent trip here to the Fresno location, allows me to confirm my original statement above. Nice location just outside of Fashion Fair mall, the exterior and interior of this CF is as nice in it&#39;s own unique way, but still provides that similar CF vibe you get familiar with if you go to several different locations. Actually, this Fresno location I can even say has a better restaurant because it has it&#39;s own detached building. For those familiar in the bay area, the Valley Fair and Oakridge locations are attached to the main mall. So being detached and separate gives this a more fancier feel. <br><br>Inside restaurant is full of the usual CF classy design and has high airy ceilings. I&#39;ve ate at this location 3 times and it&#39;s always been clean. Staff has always been great too. <br><br>Food here is on par with other CF locations in terms of quality and portion. For those new to CF, its higher quality than Applebees and Chilli&#39;s. Provides a better dining experience and ambiance. When comparing it to CHAIN restaurants, when you want one of the better ones, you can&#39;t go wrong with CF. And thus the reason for my perfect score as compared to other chain restaurants, I feel CF is still the most superior, and this location has provided me with the quality and familiarity of what CF represents. <br><br>P.S. shout out to the Alyssa C, who helped me with a tedious task of Gift Cards on 12/22/2018. She was professional and genuinely nice during the entire process.

One of the dumbest restaurants I&#39;ve experienced. I call them to make a reservation but the say they can&#39;t reserve over the phone which is fine. I said I&#39;m driving 30 minutes to get there so can you give me an idea of the wait time which again she said they can&#39;t do. <br>After driving 30 minutes in the rain I get here to find out it&#39;s at least a one hour wait. Why won&#39;t you just tell the customers so they don&#39;t waste their time driving there if you know the wait is that long. <br>Unreal

Went for lunch today around 2pm food was very great ! But service not so good ! We got put at the edge of the restaurant by a car almost , outdoor experience was horrible we didn&#39;t get the severs name we almost even left . As a server myself it could&#39;ve been better but overall food was great

Who hasn&#39;t dined at least once at The Cheese Factory. It&#39;s being one of the moist successful chain restaurants of all time. Most important key elements is that it stays pretty much consistent. Severs are well trained and groomed.  Pricing is average with an Enormous menu. This is the reflection of a good company.

Only reason I&#39;m giving it 2 stars is for the cheesecake. I also suggest ordering ahead of time to avoid eating inside. No matter how many times I try to give this place a shot, I leave with a bad experience. First, you spend most of the time waiting to order, food to arrive, getting your check and being able to pay. The last time I went the waitress confessed she forgot us and instead of trying to arrive faster the next time, she forgot us again. Secondly, the majority of times I go, the food always comes out burnt. And unless you enjoy buying an overpriced plate of burnt food, I&#39;d recommend steering clear. There is definitely better places to eat in Fresno that is worth the money.
Got some curbside today from Bryan. The food was amazing! Very happy with my visit, thanks guys for holding it down through this pandemic
Cheesecake doesn&#39;t disappoint but the service is a hit or miss. This last time we went our waiter was useless. But cheesecake was delicious.

Of course the wait can be really long but still worth it! Had the Thai Lettuce Wraps today and loved them! Was with a party of 14 this afternoon and the staff did a great job serving us efficiently and was very friendly. Drinks were always filled and food was amazing!

My son had a Marching band competition at Fresno State on saturday and he said after that he must have Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s like out thing when we&#39;re here in Fresno lol...So it was super late we arrived around 11 pm. (they are open till midnight) We we&#39;re seated immediately and as always very professional well dressed and super nice servers and staff all around every time.  We decided to step out of our norm and get the calamari app after of course we stuffed our faces with that yummy hot bread and butter of course...The calamari was tentacles and body perfectly light and crispy not over seasoned.  It came with your standard cocktail sauce but wow also had this garlic sauce which my son and i fought over and by the time we were done with that lil cup it was licked clean hahahha...<br>This time for dinner we stepped out of our norm and went for some steaks my son decided on the filet and i got the Hibachi hanger steak, wasabi mashed potatoes and tempura asparagus.  My sons steak was cooked perfectly med rare but a bit chewy in my opinion he didn&#39;t care he devoured the whole thing hell he&#39;d just ran thru 2 marching shows and all day of practice.  He loved his meal.  Mine wow Soooo flavorful cooked med rare as i like it and that sauce!!! The wasabi mashed potatoes with that steak i was in heaven Delicious...Let&#39;s not forget that unexpected treat with the tempura asparagus nice touch with my dinner.  We actually didn&#39;t leave till after midnight and they never complained a bit.  We will be back always a nice time here.

I told them it was my daughters birthday, and they were like oh well sing to her. Then the girl next to us said it was her birthday they gave her a free cheesecake, and I was sitting waiting for daughter to get sang to. Like if they didn&#39;t want to do the thing they could have gave my daughters meal free, but no. Then I checked the website under birthdays and it said FREE cheesecakes. False advertisement like honey no.

Love coming to this Cheesecake Factory. Always great service and great food. Came here for happy hours and barely made it in time. Came here with friends and sat in the happy hour section/bar then placed our orders. Most or all items on the happy hour menu are $6.50/plate. They were all generous size portion and delicious too. We&#39;ve ordered almost all the items on the menu because everything sounded so good. We had fried Mac and cheese, tamale cakes, wild buffalo chicken (huge portion!), Tex-mex egg rolls, avocado egg rolls, fried shrimp, and nachos. I enjoy it most when there&#39;s food for happy hours. I definitely recommend checking out their happy hour, it&#39;s from  4-6pm. Service was great too!

What a disaster. Made an online yelp reservation for 6:15   Showed up 15 minutes early. They had our reservation. They gave me one of their buzzers  and said it would be 10 minutes. Ok so far so good. About 10 minutes later the buzzer goes off. I take it to the desk and gave it to her and she says to  stand on the the other side of their desk. So I step over. Granted the place was packed. I wait there for another 10 minutes while they are seating others. Finally I say something. She goes and checks  and says there are  9 in front of you!  Huh??!<br>What was all that I just went to?<br>No thank you  cheesecake. I won&#39;t be back.

You really cannot go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. We stopped here for lunch and ordered nachos for an appetizer and I had a burger. We ordered desserts to go. Their menu is just overwhelming with all the pages and possibilities, I&#39;m not sure how they keep that much food in stock but I guess there&#39;s something for everyone. We had so much leftover food we all had boxes to take home along with our desserts. I love the Oreo cheesecake myself. Good spot to eat if you&#39;re out shopping at the mall!

Returned to the Cheesecake Factory. Service was good. Very friendly. The food was much better. I ordered the jambalaya chicken and shrimp with brown rice instead of noodles. It just needed a little salt which is fine but it had great flavor. I found myself craving some more a few days later. I&#39;d recommend that dish. Sat in a booth for the first time which made the experience more enjoyable than sitting at the tables which can feel a little crammed. Wait time wasn&#39;t bad on a Wednesday evening. About 5-10min. Overall enjoyed this time around better than the last.

My wife ordered pasta with shrimp. To both of our surprise, she only received 5 pieces of shrimp. This seemed a bit ridiculous given the inflated price of the meal...especially considering that this dish was quite a bit more expensive than pasta with chicken.

I have been here multiple of times but out off all these times and mind you the food was good but I am under the assumption that during COVID they had their best chiefs at home as well as their customer service skills. We ordered bang bang chicken and shrimp as well as warm apple crisp. We called and complained since their bang bang chicken and shrimp had sliced apples in it, I have never had apples in this dish before and it made the meal taste off. Then the warm apple crisp which we have ordered before they gave a turtle cheesecake. When we called and told them, they told us that a warm apple crisp was in a cheesecake form, there were no apples in that cheesecake and on the menus it states a speciality item and not a cheesecake. The customer service showed how poor of insight into what the meals they were making and the actual descriptions. This was supposed to be a mother days dinner as well as welcome home from the hospital which they screwed up. For the price we paid, especially during these times, the customer service training is needed.
Waited 45 minutes or more for order. When we asked the manager about the delay he gave us a perfunctory and in my opinion, snotty answer. Next time we are going to Pismos

Disappointed that I had to leave today before my food ever came out because it took over 30 minutes before I decided to leave. I come regularly to eat at the bar and tip well over 20% every single time I go. The fact I don&#39;t feel I was acknowledged to some extent has led me to this rating. Keep I mind this is a Saturday afternoon &amp; they were busy.

This restaurant never disappoints! Weather it&#39;s dinner, take out or the excellent Saturday/Sunday brunch, they are always on point and if ever there is a problem, they will make things right without any hesitation. We love trying their constantly evolving menu, thanks Cheesecake Factory Fresno. Sorry to say yesterday I had a bad experience at this Cheesecake Factory. I ordered take out and while I was there talked to the take out guy who also said he was the manager. I have gone to this restaurant so many times and didn&#39;t recognize this man as one of their managers. I paid for my takeout order and wanted to show him a photo I took of takeout I got from them a few weeks ago. I ordered Thai lettuce wraps and when I got home and went to eat them noticed the lettuce was brown and black with slime. I was grossed out and wondered how a cook couldn&#39;t see that or did and put out the product anyways. I just assumed cheesecake would make it right on my next visit as I can&#39;t go back right away I live an hour away. The manager said I don&#39;t need to see your photo and I can&#39;t help you as it was weeks ago, you needed to bring it back the same day. I was shocked by his response and unwillingness to make it right, not even a token gesture of complimentary desert. The right thing to do would have been to offer replacement of the entree but I just got brushed of by a business my family has spent so much money with over the years, so disappointing!
Got take out, first time. Ordered  tai lettuce wraps. Chicken was good but butter lettuce was all brown, wilted, and full of holes. Don&#39;t order.

I understand times are rough right now but I will never go back and order anything from this restaurant again my family ordered dinner there and we did it through their app they still got the order wrong we ordered two warm apple crisps they sent us two apple cheese cakes my daughter ordered the chicken and shrimp bang bang and she got that one all the time she has gone to that restaurant well I guess they add apples to it now she did not like they way it tasted plus in the description no wheee does it say apple so when I called the manager about the mix up she stated well we ordered the apple cheesecake no we didn&#39;t but that is not here nor there when a customer calls and complains about the meal you ask how can we make it right and not just state well that&#39;s what you ordered I know what I ordered so I finally had enough and just told her I won&#39;t be back again even after they reopen
Brunch is amazing!! The brûlée&#39;d French toast was so so good! The Monte Cristo sandwich was huge and delicious! Mimosas were delicious, made with fresh orange juice. Fantastic service!

Unable to make a reservation for 17 people turned us down and only said sorry. The manager whom I believe to be adda first answered. Told us we couldnt. We call back to talk to the manager again and was told the only manager on shift was sam. We are clearly getting the run around and for what? I&#39;m not sure. We were peppered to shell out alot of money for my mothers 50th birthday. This has been one of the worse experiences with them. We will not be coming back.
They are so far off there game.I will never set foot in this place again.waiter was awful, Food mediocre.

Huge menu sometimes too overwhelming lol but food is always good sometimes better than others but never bad. Every cheesecake flavor is delicious. Try the brunch menu now available on Sundays! Full bar is also great.

So good! It doesn&#39;t matter what you order everything always taste delicious! My go to is the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. It is such a huge portion that I always have enough for later and lunch the next day.
It was my first time out at a restaurant since the pandemic, I have to say I felt safe. Everything was clean and a good distance away from other people.

Well my daughter gave us a gift card to go to the Cheesecake Factory, so while in Fresno we did just that.  We had dinner early about 5 pm before returning home.  Upon entering the restaurant, we found it to be noisy. With music playing at a level that made conversation difficult.  We were seated at a table for two but really suited for one, it was small and cramped.  Upon our request we were moved to a booth, much better but very cold air blowing on us.  <br><br>My wife order the Asian salad and I ordered the herb grilled salmon along with coffee.  The coffee was a joke, luke warm.  It has become apparent to me that most restaurants cannot make coffee correctly and the Cheesecake Factory is no exception.  I asked for a reheat and the second round was just as cold.   My wifes salad was &#34;not very flavorful&#34;.  My salmon and mashed potatoes were ok. The best part of the dinner was our server who was very polite and the bread she started us with was to die for.  So my recommendation is don&#39;t order the Asian salad or coffee and maybe stick to a steak instead of the salmon. Don&#39;t forget the bread.

Took a young birthday lady here for an early dinner. No reservations, just walked in from the mall. <br><br>We were seated promptly and were greeted by our server. We started with the egg roll sampler plate with the various dipping sauces. Absolutely delicious! Presentation was even nice. <br><br>Dinner was dinner, nothing special, but the service throughout the evening very good. Birthday song and dessert topped off a <br><br>Just had another birthday dinner here. Steak Diane and Shrimp Dinner. Doesn&#39;t get much better than this for me! Good food, good service.

It was worth the wait and delicious Avocado Egg Rolls and dinner was delicious. The best part the server were very polite and the factory burrito was worth the wait. If you had reservations they take you quick.

I ordered a slice of cheesecake on a Monday evening and found a long 12 inch hair in my food. Based on the reviews I read this isn&#39;t the first time this restaurant has had this issue. It&#39;s so disgusting. Please make your staff wear hair nets and tie their hair back!

Let&#39;s hop right to it! This restaurant is located in a busy shopping center especially weekends came on a Friday for lunch with family. Very nice cheesecake factory one of the smallest ones I&#39;ve gone to but the way the seating is arranged it accommodates all guest. It took about 20min to be seated which wasn&#39;t to bad. When it came to customer service everyone was friendly and attentive to our needs. The negative with me is I dislike silverware on the table I watch how they wipe down the tables with the same cloth and then put your eating utensils on it (I&#39;m weird with germs medical field issues lol). When I asked for plastic silverware after my food was brought, I put my hand out to grab them from my waitress she put them right on the table ugh:-| defeated the purpose of me asking smh, I just wiped my fork off and prayed for the best. <br><br>My food was delicious no complaints there I had angel hair pasta with as side of shrimp with asparagus and to drink a strawberry daiquiri. Would I return if in the area maybe.

Great location, although parking was a nightmare and their wait it crazy long <br>This place is in a great spot! <br>It&#39;s right where the mall is and they have a great outdoor seating area <br>-patio area was super nice and they also have the heater going for you at night when it gets a little chili <br>Prices are great! <br>Great bartenders here they made some pretty good drinks <br>Service was amazing!!!!

After so many people talking about this place, I gave this place a try last night. I had my birthday dinner here with a group of eight girls. The customer service was great and so was the food. Inside the restaurant is a romantic vibe kind of decoration and honestly is very cute/fancy. I ordered a Carne Asada Steak and the reason for the 4 stars is because the meat portion was very small. They also open very late too so that&#39;s a plus. But overall it was a wonderful night. Thank you Cheesecake!

Here in town for work and decided to pick a new suit at the mall. Low and behold a Cheesecake Factory where my car was parked. <br>Tonight it&#39;s pene pasta with four cheese and marinara sauce and salmon yum. <br>Oh yes a Coppola Claret to go with. <br>Excellent service at the bar thanks to Lilly who a great mixologist. Fast friendly and efficient.

Well it has been nine months since my one star review and decided to give CF another try. It hasn&#39;t gotten any better. We went in for a late lunch so it wasn&#39;t very busy. Our waitress said she was going to bring warm bread to our table. After a wait, I finally asked her and she said it was just coming out of the oven.  The bread she brought us was not the slightest bit warm. I mean really, like we wouldn&#39;t notice. I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich off the skinnylicious menu. The bacon on the sandwich was overcooked and dry like jerky. A big thick slice of unripe tomato, which I removed along with the bacon. No lettuce which I asked the waitress if it came with and she said yes so I ordered fries instead of the green salad. The bun  tasted week old. The fries had no flavor and needed salt but was unable to get her attention to ask for some while they were warm. My husband had the chicken riesling. Overabundance of dry pasta, very little sauce and chicken. The dish was not hot. Maybe it was with the warm bread? Again, we were disappointed and regretted wasting our money here. We will not ever be going back! If CF doesn&#39;t up their standards like they once had, I&#39;m sure they will be closing their doors down the road.

Saw a huge roach crawling around the entrance floor and went under a vase. I&#39;m assuming it&#39;s probably from the plants they have inside. It&#39;s dark and very dim in the evening so you probably wouldn&#39;t notice. I&#39;ll never eat here again after seeing that.
They brought back the pineapple cheesecake! Also had a really good drive up pick up experience during covid shutdown. Very efficient compared to their neighboring restaurants.

I don&#39;t mind the ambiance, but it almost seems like it&#39;s getting darker as the years go on. I had to assist my mom with reading her menu in the dull lighting, and she&#39;s only 46, haha.<br><br>We were seated and served quickly. My go-to is the meatloaf, which has never wronged me, but this time, all the edges were a little burned. Nothing too crazy, but it definitely wasn&#39;t the same quality as my many previous hits.<br><br>Our waitress was sweet, although not nearly as attentive as we would have liked. Understandable as the restaurant is always busy, but we too are customers afterall.

Ordered omelette thru door dash. Not at all made the way I asked. Missing ingredients and the omelette is overcooked and cold at the same time. Potatoes look 3 days old! UUGH! Not even EDIBLE! I&#39;m so glad they included the dry white toast. Guess that&#39;s what I get for 40 bucks, dry white toast!

My boyfriend took me here the day after Christmas, we came in around 11:30 for lunch. I first walked up to the hostess stand where there were two women, and both of them didn&#39;t acknowledge me for about 5 minutes it was very awkward and rude. I felt like they could of at least said i&#39;ll be with you in a moment. but no, nothing. <br><br>We got sat fairly quick at a table, I asked the waitress if she could sit us at a booth and she found one in another location and sat us there. We got our drinks and meal ordered quickly and our waitress was on top of bringing us our refills and bread. She was kind of standoffish though and didn&#39;t seem too friendly. <br><br>I ordered pasta and my boyfriend ordered a burger, she brought out his burger and left and I was assuming bringing out my pasta, 5-10 mins go by still nothing. She comes out says they are still working on my pasta then leaves. It&#39;s always a pet peeve of mine when a restaurant brings out one persons meal but not the other at the same time. Finally I think a manager or supervisor came by and apologized for the wait, said there was some kind of mix up and my meal was being re processed... he offered me a side salad or fries but I declined. My boyfriend doesn&#39;t eat his food until my food is at the table out of respect so while my food was getting re cooked his food was getting cold. The manger offered to put his food under a heat lamp until mine was ready.<br><br>My meal finally came out about an hour after I ordered and everything seemed fine, I noticed there was two kinds of pasta in my dish when there&#39;s only supposed to be bow tie but that wasn&#39;t a big deal. My boyfriends food however was cold. I was just disappointed because I told my boyfriend how much I love the Cheesecake Factory and then when we finally go, everything just fell short. When we got the bill and I was expecting at least a small discount for the long wait but nothing was. I don&#39;t know if we will be back to this location.

I usually love cheesecake but my experience now was TERRIBLE. they for sure disappointed me with their service. i wasn&#39;t notified that they weren&#39;t taking reservations after i had made one. i waited for 3 hours and other parties were being seated before my party. worst experience ever

I enjoy going to a restaurant with a smooth ambiance and good decadent food. I get all of that from the Cheesecake factory. I have ordered a number of items here, but my favorite is most defintely the cheesecake. There are so many flavors and styles, my mind boggles trying to decide what I would like. <br><br>I most recently ordered the herb salmon. This was my first time trying the salmon here, and I was not let  down. The salmon was seasoned well and fell apart with the simple touch of my fork. My sides included mashed potatoes and asparagas. I was let down with my four pieces of asparagas. It just didn&#39;t feel like there was enough. The potatoes were tasty and creamy. I could do with out the skin though. <br><br>Service is swell. I enjoy eating in the bar area, but the chairs are so close together, I feel like I am dating my neighbors beside me. I need more elbow room.

I love this restaurant so much!!! My absolute favorite. The food is great and the cheesecake is amazing! Great milkshakes too. Waiters are very nice and always make sure to give us the complimentary bread while waiting for our food. I&#39;m a very picky water but I love this place!!!

Before I had kids, we would eat here once a month or so. Now a days, it&#39;s less than once a year. But for our anniversary, it was about that time. Not because all the other places I wanted to eat at are closed on Sundays. Nope, that had nothing to do with it at all lol. So anyways, first thing I noticed when walking in, the waiting area isn&#39;t as full as it used to be. That&#39;s a good thing. We sit outside, and after an initial start, our waitress disappears for far too long. But after that, everything is copacetic. We ordered the eggroll sampler and mango avocado chicken salad, or something like that. I thought the salmon eggroll would be my least favorite, but turned out to be my favorite. It was the dipping sauce really. My salad could have used more dressing, but was otherwise fine. Anyways, 1 sampler, one main entrée, sode and cosmo, and 2 cheesecakes later, and we are $75 down after tip. The cosmo cost more than the sampler, somehow. I guess that&#39;s why they don&#39;t post the prices of their drinks. Still enjoyed the evening, no matter the cost. Even saw a few familiar faces. On to the next stop<br><a href="mailto:Imabigdeal@yelp.com">Imabigdeal@yelp.com</a>

My friends and I got together to go to Cheesecake Factory to celebrate BLACK HISTORY Month and waited for almost THREE HOURS. <br><br>On top of that, the food took forever to come and we were basically ignored by the staff all night. <br><br>I&#39;m definitely never coming here again.

I am extremely satisfied with the fashion fair locations service!!!! I curbside ordered 2 slices of cheesecake while parked in front of the restaurant, I then followed the curbside line and they already had it ready for me! That&#39;s exceptional service. I thank all the employees for their hard work and especially the gentleman taking out the orders!!! Thank you Cheesecake Factory fashion fair!!!

Well it was my birthday and all I wanted was to eat here and we go and give them the name and basically the girl upfront lied and said we will get a text when our table was ready and we never received a text waiting for no reason waste of time &amp; she said it was only a 30 to 45 min wait .
Why have a reservation system if your not going go to honor them. Maybe you should disable it if your not going to utilize it

I came here with a friend for dinner during the monsoon of Jan19. Surprisingly, the restaurant was super busy, waited for a table for about 20 minutes. Once seated, the waitress was a sweet one! She asked for our drinks and came back with freshly out-of-the-oven bread to start! The bread was soft and lightly sweeten, definitely baked in house. The restaurant is SUPER DIM so it difficult to read the menu- bring a flashlight ;) or use your phone. My only complaint. I was very impressed with the lighter/healthier dinner options- all sounded so tasty, plenty of options, and perfect for anyone trying to watch what they eat. My friend highly recommended the VEGAN (yes VEGAN) cobb salad so that&#39;s what I ordered. The waitress went onto lunch after we ordered and kindly introduced our new waitress to us... I very much appreciated that! Our salads came out and they were HUGE! I had to take half of it home. Definitely your $12 worth!!! The salad was fresh with SO many different veggies! It was delicious! <br><br>I really enjoyed my time here and look forward to trying out the rest of the healthy options!

I came in on a busy Friday afternoon. I was seated immediately and was had my drink order taken. Our server Melissa brought bread and took our order. I ordered korean fried cauliflower with the sauce on the side and the stuffed cheddar burger protein wrapped. My daughter ordered the impossible burger and sweet potato fries. The fried cauliflower came out quickly and was hot and fresh. All our food was delicious and my daughter was blown away of how much the impossible burger tastes like real beef. I ordered a low carb cheesecake to go so I can enjoy later. This was our first time at Cheesecake and we really enjoyed it. Our server Melissa was a delight and left us a little holiday note on our receipt.

Ask to be seated in Rodney&#39;s area, he is extremely attentive, very observant and very polite. He noticed I favored the wheat bread and brought me extra pieces of wheat bread. He kept my drink glass full and made certain my every need and comfort was to my expectations. The turkey sandwiches was huge, I had leftovers to take home. The bread was soft, turkey tender and tomatoes and lettuce fresh. I was so full I had to take my cheesecake home.

Would have been 5 stars but the first happy birthday Cheesecake had a hair in it and then where we were seated outside something was leaking from the roof so we got water all over us and had to move. But we appreciated how quickly the staff worked to get everything fixed. <br>They replied and said to email them but have yet to contact me.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory quite a bit always for lunch or dinner but it&#39;s not my favorite chain restaurant to go too. You do need some time to read the menu as it&#39;s over 20 pages long with a variety of food options with no specific specialty aside from cheesecake. This visit was my first to try their breakfast and I was impressed with the amount of pancakes I received. I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and it came with 3 Big cakes that were delicious. You could see the lemon zest in every bite. I also tried the creme brûlée French toast which didn&#39;t seem like a lot of food but my boyfriend said by the time he finished he was full. The fresh squeezed orange juice was tasty but expensive for a small glass that wasn&#39;t filled to the top. We came first thing in the morning to avoid any wait which was great.

We don&#39;t come here often and last night was definitely a reason why don&#39;t eat here. They were fairly crowded, which we knew. Wait time was 30 mins...well, we ended up waiting 1 hour and 18 mins. We only had a party of 5. We thought they made a mistake when we seen others that came after us get seated before us. So I asked the hostess and Henry the manager. They said they were still waiting for a table for us. I told them other people got seated before us and they came after us. Henry said rudely, if you want to be seated now you can be seated outside. Even though all those other people that got seated before us sat inside. We said no, we still want to sit inside. So he said then we need to wait. I was very upset at this point for the way the manager was talking to us. We waited so long already we didn&#39;t want to leave now. Finally, we get seated 1 hr 18 mins it took them to get us a table. <br>Monica H. was our server. Wish we can say her service was better than Henry&#39;s attitude. Definitely one of the worst experiences we have ever had at The Cheesecake Factory. It took forever for her to get our drinks and order. Our food came out cold. It took a long time for us to get our food. So I&#39;m sure it was just sitting out for a long time. The service never visited our table for refills or asked if we needed anything. One of our friends was sti eating and grabbed her plate and set another plate on top of her. My friend said uhhhh I wasnt done eating. Monica shrugs her shoulders said sorry and walked away.  We had to ask another server to get our check. Monica didn&#39;t even come back. We will definitely not come back here. Oh, and our cheesecake was frozen.... what a disappointment again.

Wow! This place has really gone downhill. Silverware is dull and looks dirty, crumbs on the bread plates before we got bread. We first were sat near a window, where there was no joke at least 8 flies and a bee!! The bee came at us and the flies were swarming. So we moved tables. There was still flies in the restaurant. Drinks were made wrong . Ordered the lunch pizza  and salad, salad came out pizza was taking longer . The manager came to the table to apologize for the wait. By the time the pizza came out everyone was finished  eating so I had it boxed up. All of this and no discount on the bill! It&#39;s one thing to have flies and bees but geez , add drinks wrong, late food, dirty plates . We will not be back!

This isn&#39;t my first visit to the Cheesecake, but it was an exceptional visit. The place was boisterous and full. Basically, another day at the Cheesecake. What made this trip unusual is that I cane by myself and figured I&#39;d be in and out. But I was quickly seated in a far corner (what I was hoping to get) away from the crowd. My servers name was Jennifer. An extremely attentive young lady and always flashing a beautiful smile that lights up the room. I was quickly served my cup of coffee and decided to have breakfast as dinner, and ordered the normal fair, the California Omelette, only I added bacon and onions to it. Before I could finish my cup of coffee, the cup was replaced with a fresh brew. This is how the rest of my breakfast as dinner went. A very positive experience, due to a wonderful server. The Omelette was very tasty and fluffy. I was ready to have an uneventful evening, but this waiter made my stay a lot more better and happy. She put a smile on my face. Make sure if you eat at the Fresno sure, to look for Jennifer. Your time here will be s better experience because of her !

I got the pasta napoleon or something like that. It was good, I realized I don&#39;t like pepperoni in pasta though it&#39;s weird. What I do like is the cheesecake. It&#39;s so bomb. The food is subpar though. This is a dessert spot.

Best Cheesecake Factory (CF) I&#39;ve eaten at in a long time as the CF&#39;s in the bay area have gone downhill tremendously.<br>This CF is clean and the servers are very attentive. The food was very fresh and the cheesecake is the original huge slice cheesecake we&#39;ve all come to know. <br>My friend and I shared one piece of the key lime &amp;  it was yummo! Our server was tbe best. I only wish I could remember her name and shout  kudos to her!<br>Keep up the good work Fresno cheesecake factory!

This is how I received my to go order of French onion soup last night. In a to go coffee cup. Cracked and bent lid, which spilled what you see missing in my car. Worst $7.95 I&#39;ve ever spent.  Caramelized Onion Soup.

Oh my, I came here on a Friday evening for dinner with my fiancé&#39;s family and it was super pack. Given it was a Friday, so I know people are going out for dinner, but this place was super pack. I was actually super surprised. This place has been around for awhile now but it&#39;s not like the first place I think of to go have dinner. <br>-the food is amazing here. I have a steak plate and it was cooked to perfection. Delicious sauce with some veggies on the side and mash potatoes. Very filling meal and I was satisfied. The service was lovely and our waiter was very nice even at their busiest hour.

Came here to pick up a Doordash order and was informed that Doordash drivers are no longer allowed in the building and must wait outside, in 100 plus degree weather!  The old lady standing next to me had been out there 15 minutes waiting for her order and wasn&#39;t looking too good.  The first person to pass out from a heat stroke waiting for their order needs to sue this place and whatever idiot decided on this policy.
Roaches crawled out from under the food at this location. Absolutely disgusting. Reporting to the health board. Don&#39;t eat here!!!

I am far from NJ. There are also cheesecake factory in East side. But the taste of Cheesecake surely the same, but the pasta and steaks are a little salty to eat. But it is bog place and good atmosphere and nice to be there for a dessert!

I can&#39;t give a 0 star. Again incompetent wait staff dirty plates wrong orders and all I get is oh sorry oh sorry    Would have been nice to eat my breakfast with my family but the staff can&#39;t get a order right

I love cheesecake factory! It&#39;s such a fancy place with affordable food and good portions. I haven&#39;t come here for a while but i&#39;m never disappointed when i come here. Every time i get a steak and asked for how i wanted it cook, they always made it right for me!! I love their bread, its what i look forward to whenever i come to Cheesecake factory. The waiter is very kind and as busy as they were, he&#39;s always checking up on how are are we doing. I always love coming back to Cheesecake!

Came in said we would sit wherever we could get in the fastest. Very unorganized. Very loud. They paged is to come in. Stood there the desk for over 10 minutes, watching people who came in after us get seated. Waitress waited on people that was seat after us. Finally ordered 30 minutes after pager went off. It has been 40 minutes after the pager went off, still no bread
