The cheesecake factory is a great date night location. The menu is huge so no matter what you are in the mood for they probably have it. My husband and I love this place. The food always taste fresh. I love the cheesecake. It&#39;s fun to try different flavors. Or you can just get your favorite flavor and enjoy the classics. The service is spot on.I will be back. The drinks are killer and the stakes are delicious. I highly recommend the Cheesecake Factory for a great night out

The only reason I&#39;m giving this place three stars is because the server was nice and attentive. The Madeira chicken and shrimp scampi combo was a joke. 3 shrimp on the plate and mashed potatoes that were old and dry and barely warm. Very disappointing experience for my husband&#39;s first trip here
It was a 35 min, the service was good, They did mess up on one order out of 7. Food was amazing like always and the cheesecake is always aweso
Huge menu, full bar and endless cheesecake flavors. Service is always pretty good and very large restaurant with out door dining patio.

The food was amazing but the service was less than.<br>Worst service ever, from the moment we walked in!<br>We walked up to the greeters desk to give them our name and she was on the phone, looked at us, then turned her back to us and continued her phone call without any acknowledgement. Another couple walked up and stood next to us, when the Greeter hung up the phone, she turned around to the couple that walked up AFTER us &amp; said &#34;You were here first, can I help you?&#34; We were seated 5 minutes later, which wasn&#39;t bad. 10 minute wait from walking I. The door to being seated.<br>Then at the table the waitress asked if we were ready to order. Well, I ordered the Avocado Chicken Club Sandwich with a Substitute of Hand Battered Onion Rings. (They are listed as a menu item on the Sides Menu- I really wouldn&#39;t have ordered a fantasy item.) <br>The waitress demeaned me. &#34;We don&#39;t have onion rings (chuckle) I don&#39;t know where you saw that, but umm, unless the menu has changed in the last 2 days, we don&#39;t serve onion rings.&#34; So I opened my menu and said, &#34;Oh, well it says here, &#39;Hand-Battered Onion Rings&#39;&#34; as I go to point it out, she snatched the menu out of my hand with the ferocity of a toddler who was stealing back a toy, that had been stolen from them. Straight yanked it out of my hands. Me and my guest were appalled, we just stared at her! She read the sides and turned on heel and marched off. She came back and said &#34;Ok well it&#39;s on the menu, but I don&#39;t even know how to ring it into my computer.&#34; I replied with, &#34;That&#39;s ok, I&#39;ll just take the fries.&#34; She said, &#34;No, I&#39;ll get you your &#34;Onion Rings&#34; (in the snottiest tone ever)&#34; Our food was delivered by a cook, and low and behold, my onion rings. My sandwich and rings were really amazing! The food is always great. The staff needs a reminder on friendliness and Customer Service.<br>Then we waited 20 minutes for boxes, after we asked. And another 20 minutes after we boxed our food, for our check! It was not a busy time either, they did not look short staffed, I just think my server today was terrible. I also had to flag her down, as the wheelchair bound disabled man was trying to get her attention for 10 minutes while she gabbed and walked around topping off already full water glasses. He was yelling and waving his arm! I said a stern, &#34;Hey!&#34; And she said &#34;Yes?&#34; I said, &#34;This gentleman is in need of your service.&#34; And I pointed to the table next to me. She scoffed and walked over to help the man and his guest. Today&#39;s experience was enough to turn me off from returning for quite awhile. If you are looking for a good meal, and rude service doesn&#39;t bother you, look no further than Fresno&#39;s Cheesecake Factory.
It was a busy evening at the restaurant but we Had a nice time. Prior to going to the concert we had a nice dinner.

Came to enjoy dinner for my birthday tonight. Our server spoke so fast I couldn&#39;t catch his name but I believe it was Bryon after looking at it on my receipt. I asked if they did anything special for birthdays and he said they give out a small sundae and if we order a dessert they write on it. Food came out good but in the end no sundae and no writing on my dessert. It&#39;s the small things that keep us wanting to come back but in the end I felt like he sorta rushed us because it was half an hour before closing time.
Always try a new dish here (can&#39;t go wrong). I never switch u on my drink it is a constant GEORGIA PEACH!!!

Very nice place. The  average entree is approximately $15-20. The food is definitely worth it considering the portions and how good the food is. Teresa was our waitress and she was AWESOME!! She was courteous, attentive and patient. Definitely recommend her! Great food and the ambiance is amazing. The cheesecake here is delicious. (They have soo many flavors to choose from) Please know the parking is a pain!!! ESPECIALLY during peak times!
Everything taste very good and is a high class customer service. I really like this place. Clean beautiful. Relax and nice dining:)

Waited 3 hours because they don&#39;t take reservations for my group of people. Extremely disappointed. We ended up leaving Bc we just kept getting lies, &#34;it&#39;ll be 20 more minutes.&#34; <br>I highly recommend they start doing reservations. That&#39;s ridiculous

I stopped by here to pick up my whole 7in cheesecake today, there was a little problem on my order but I appreciate how the staffs and the manager at the bakery fixed the issue . They were very generous and showed positive attitude towards the problem.  for their customer service and food quality. No doubt, cheesecake factory is my most favorite restaurant in town.

Came here for dinner had horrible service horrible food.  <br>Didn&#39;t get any bread, no water, no waiter to get anything for me over all bad experience and food was weak.   If I could rate the experience lower then a 1 Star I would

If you go on the weekends it can be loud and crowded lines. I usually eat at the Pasadena one but I come to this one just for the cake and cheesecakes and there delicious. Dulce de leche is my favorite.

The veggie burger patty on its own was very bland, but with everything else it was okay. Not the best but not bad. The fries were the same, not horrible but not great. Personally I prefer them crispy on the outside and they were very soft, so could be good if that&#39;s your preference.

Stop by the cheesecake factory tonight to have a bite for dinner very pleased with the portions and the flavors of the dish I had this evening I had chicken piccata with a hint of lemon<br>For an appetizer I had they bang bang shrimp with spicy spicy sauce<br>Quite delicious everything was really fresh and I have to give a shout out to the waitress she was top-notch I like a Cheesecake Factory and We will be back again

Went for dinner last night, and will not go back! This place is overpriced, and overrated! After waiting 30 minutes for our food, it was lukewarm at best, and not good! The only upside was the service.

The Cheescake Factory, service experience , greet instantly as we entered the establishment, nice smile and welcoming. We were questioned on how many  in our party, we had 4. We were sat just about immediately, our server, we meet instantly. She offered waters in addition to our cold refreshing drinks. Our servers second encounter she took our orders offered extra sides and closed strong. Our food came out , refreshing, hot and delicious, as my request for a side of dressing she was spot on, did not have to walk away then return all compiled with in her food delivery visit. Our server was great and offering refills as our beverages became empty. I can not say anything disturbing, seating it comfortable, roomy and clean, bread is hot and soft. As I do not often visit the Cheesecake factory it would be a definite visit again based upon the service and food and location, close to home.
I highly recommend making reservations, was a great experience the food was delicious and the service from start to finish was 5 star great experience. Yvonne was a great waitress!

Well our first mistake was coming on a Saturday night sadly even with a reserved table. It was definitely more crazy then expected. We reserved a table for two at 8pm showed up maybe two minutes late, checked in was told we&#39;d be called in a minute obviously knowing we won&#39;t be called in a minute we picked a spot to stand right across from the front desk being able to see everything they do of course not staring because I see how crazy it is and working in food services myself I can understand the chaos. 15 minutes pass by I start to get a bit impatient I give it another ten minutes and I see a lot of parties being called, big parties like 4-6 people. It is 830 pm and I&#39;m pissed and my fiancé has all the patience in the world so we go to the lady at the front desk and tell her we had a reservation for 8 she starts to stay we don&#39;t have- then stops and says oh yeah we called you guys but you must not of heard us. I immediately get angry and bite my tongue I could&#39;ve called her out on her lie obviously since we were TWO feet away from her and they certainly did not call our name and addressed her manager about it right behind her but we were the next people called and we waited 30 minutes so I said whatever walked up to another lady that was seating us and asked her if it was the first time they&#39;re calling that name and she said yes I say I figure and she seats us. Luckily we get a great seat with privacy and away from all the chaos. Look down see I have food on my silverware and I&#39;m just so let down on the vibes of the joint already cause I&#39;ve heard great things. I&#39;m ready to go but we STILL decide to stay and order food that was mediocre and great drinks but sadly OVERPRICED. They have a great selection and I&#39;m sure not everything on the menu is mediocre but I suggest if you wanna go somewhere pricey and worth it you go somewhere else.
Very bad service. The wait time from ordering to plate on table is over 30 minutes. Forgotten appetizers. Basically forgotten about overall Terrible service

Highly disappointed! I&#39;ve been coming to this location for years. Today, my mother and I walked in and the lady at<br>The front desk as is if we would like to sit outside. We said no since we had my 5 month old with us asleep in her car seat and on the stroller. The place was next to empty. It was late afternoon. We were told 10-15 min for indoor, there were maybe 10 couples inside. As we wait, the lady at the front says, can you park the stroller somewhere else, it might bother the other patrons. Umm excuse me? Bother someone with my stroller/car seat!?There&#39;s hardly anyone in the restaurant. Who am I bothering? Also, sit us in a corner. Oh sorry we can&#39;t, that section is closed. Aka: You don&#39;t have enough people working to cover the section. I have no clue what that even means because there were people sitting right next<br> to the spot we had mentioned. I said, let&#39;s just eat outdoors and  we were seated outside. Wow! Just Wow! I&#39;ve never felt so unwelcome. Honestly I&#39;ve never been made to feel like my baby in a car seat who was asleep  snapped into the stroller was a bother other &#34;patrons&#34;. If my child had been screaming and the stroller being pushed by a 3 year old , I might understand bothering something, but it was I the 36 year old mother pushing the sleeping baby. Sad, I expected more from your restaurant today. I&#39;ve been coming here for years and now I feel unwelcome.
Love this place! Huge selection of food on the menu. I come in on Saturdays for the soup of the day it&#39;s loaded potato soup.

I went to Cheesecake Factory to check out their new menu items under the title SkinnyLicious. Yes, this is a real word. Yes, the Cheesecake Factory has a copyright on it.  None the less, I must get back on subject.  I order the Grilled Steak Medallions which was served with Fresh Asparagus, Shitake Mushrooms Sautéed Cherry Tomatoes in a Madeira Wine sauce, and I had the Mashed potatoes substituted with a side salad and I was very impressed by the food presentation, taste and quality of the steak meat used. I must say it was very impressive and very scrumptious! In fact, it is so tasty tender it that the tenderness of the meat reminded me of the Filet Medallions they serve at Hap&#39;s Steakhouse in Pleasanton, CA.  Both are truly Exceptional dishes.
This is always the best place to eat<br> Food is excellent. Service was a little off but overall it was good very one nice and ever helpful.

The food here is always delicious and hot. It can get packed here though so expect a wait if you are arriving at popular times like weekends or dinner time but they do their best to get you seated quick and you can see that. It is a &#39;fancier&#39; restaurant but all the servers are always helpful and friendly regardless of age/ethnicity. There have a been few times though when I have gone and customers are the one making me uncomfortable. But anyways My go to is either eggplant Parmesan or the bbq chicken salad! You can never go wrong with an original cheesecake too. Nice place overall if you&#39;re looking for good food and great service.

I went there on Saturday to celebrate valentines with my husband service was good, food was great! The only thing I didn&#39;t like was that we had to wait over 40+ mins for our food and we never got our appetizers  and the waiter never even notice and they were trying to charge us at the end. Hopefully if we go next time we have a better experience.

The Cheesecake Factory is a restaurant you go to and feel like everything will go right since you are paying quite more than your casual food place. My husband and I went and I had asked for a salad with ranch that came along with my sandwich. I expected a fresh salad but it was completely opposite. The salad looked like if it was sitting out for a while, it was WARM! The ranch on it looked disgusting and it was just horrible. <br>The waiter was amazing when it came to greeting us although, she did not check on our table after our food was served to ask if the food was okay. I would of loved to request another salad. She came back after about 40-45 minutes ( we were long done eating by the time she came back) and asked if we would like our bill. I feel like a better service should been given and not just one that checks if you are done eating. I wish I had better words to say about this restaurant since a lot of people around us talk about it but it is hard to say we will go back any time soon.

To be fair, it was very busy when we came in on a Friday night at 630 but it feels that while the wait staff were doing well checking in us regularly, the kitchen and bathroom might have been going a bit slow. More importantly though, I&#39;m a huge fan of jambalaya and while the first bite there me off thinking that I enjoyed it, I was disappointed quickly into it as the flavor lacked any form of spice. The jambalaya spice  seemed like it was mostly paprika. The meats and pasta itself  we&#39;re good quality though.

Service is so horrible.  We came here for a birthday lunch and am having to remind and flag down my waitress for EVERYTHING. Food is coming out with 10 min gaps between plates. I had very high expectations and am severely disappointed.

The service is very friendly and attentive from the host in the front to our waitress. It&#39;s a fast service too. Hubby had the Chicken Madira, I had the shrimp scampi, mom had the pineapple crispy chicken and shrimp. I tasted both hubby and moms food and they&#39;re very good. We had the 30<br>Yrs anniversary chocolate cheesecake that was very very good. The food is not cheap but it&#39;s okay for the quality of the food they served. They gave us brown and white bread. The bread was rustic but the brown bread is good . I don&#39;t care for the white bread coz it&#39;s too hard for<br>Me. Overall experience was good. Thank you

My family and I came for Christmas Eve dinner.<br>We were seated within 10 minutes. Our waitress was polite and attentive. We all loved our dishes and the cheesecake was to die for! Highly recommend the white chocolate caramel macadamia cheesecake.

Wow! Great experience! Our waitress Natalie J was wonderful. She was friendly, made great recommendations and was consistently checking in on us to make sure everything was good. She sold me on the chocolate cake! (I never buy dessert but her description sold me!) and the cake was delicious! <br><br>Food was fantastic, so delicious! The only other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to was in the Livermore area, and it was awful. Needless to say the Fresno location made up for it and more! <br><br>Will be frequenting this location next time I&#39;m in town. Thank you Natalie for the great customer service!

i order food from the cheese cake factory thru door dash and what a night mirror ......door dash pick upthe food at 6.25 and it was delivered at 6:47 and i live 2 miles from the cheese cake factory . i have been there at least 20 times for dinner in fresno  and over 100 times in huntington beach. i called the restaurant and talk to henry and told him and he told me that it was between me and door dash and i explained the orange chicken had 7 piece on chicken and think they eat some of the food !!!!!   beware he told me its my problem and door dash. he has terrible  people skills for being a manager !!!! he told me if you want to call the corporate office the number is 818- 871-3000??? poor customer services!!!! i will call jose he is the general manager and i will call him when he get back on wednesday.
Never a bad experience here. Love the service and love my shrimp Alfredo,spinach dip, and burger sliders !!! My boyfriend and i go for literally any occasion.

As a reoccurring patron of The Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;m saddened by how negligent this place is of their guests. I come here maybe a handful of times a month, dine in and for take out. This time, I make a call for pick up ordering just a cup of soup of the day. The girl on the phone was so polite and made sure to confirm everything, and went as far as asking if I wanted bread, needed utensils, etc. I come in a bit later, go to the bakery counter and I don&#39;t get acknowledged for a good couple minutes. The girl goes to the register and just goes &#34;Hi.&#34; I tell her I have a pick up and she doesn&#39;t go as far as even looking for my order, and her first response to me is &#34;Okay well we don&#39;t have any bread so you won&#39;t be getting any of that, and I&#39;ll have to go get you another soup right now&#34;. Rings me up. I ask if I can add on a slice of cheesecake. Charges me, and basically dumps my change in my hands and takes off to the kitchen. Minutes pass, and the other girl behind bakery counter looks at me puzzled and goes &#34;Did she already charge you? Your cheesecake was just sitting here..&#34; and hands it to me. After quite a bit, the other girl comes from the kitchen, EXTENDS HER ONE ARM OUT and gives me my bag, doesn&#39;t even look me in the eye, and says &#34;here ya go&#34;. <br>Just wanting to leave, I walk out, check my bag and realize the container isn&#39;t even half way full of soup. I get it, it&#39;s late, but I didn&#39;t place the order while it was last call. My order was NOT at the counter when I came to pick up, so regardless of whatever standard or anything the store has, it would have been nice to at least let me know it was going to get trashed or given away or whatever so I could maybe get a refund instead of a 1/3 full container of soup? <br>After calling for the manager all he responds is with &#34;Yeah well corporate changed our standard for the to go containers, we don&#39;t use the cups anymore. Didn&#39;t want you to think that was something wrong&#34; like that justifies this half effort and completely ignorant attitude of the staff. Look, I get it, employees are under immense pressure here. But customers shouldn&#39;t be seeing it. Ever. My advice to management is to focus less on table turnover and cash flow and more on customer service.

Love this place, not a bad drive it beats driving over the grapevine... employees are very polite .. I always get the Louisiana pasta you definitely need to try and the environment overall is great. it is close to the shopping centers and other restaurants.

I have been to cheesecake factory twice within the last month after not eating here for years! The main reason for not eating here is because I&#39;ve been improving my diet and quality of the food that I eat, most recently trying to follow the Forks Over Knives way of eating. I recently heard that CF offers a a vegan cobb salad and was excited to try it after unexpectedly finding myself at CF on Mother&#39;s Day. I was pleasantly surprised by this salad. The salad contains beets, grilled asparagus, cucumbers, avocados, quinoa sprinkled with almonds, garbanzo beans and tomatoes, over a bed of what looked like romaine and spring mix? This salad is not listed on the menu, or not that Ive seen, and had no clue how much it cost. When the bill came for our group of 5, the vegan salad was listed as being only $8.  I enjoyed the salad so much that I have really been looking forward to going back. Yesterday my husband and I returned to CF specifically for this salad and thinking we would be eating lunch pretty inexpensively. We were quite surprised when our bill was over $40. When I looked at the bill, the salad was $13 each. Though I do enjoy the salad, it IS NOT worthy of $13. I would have gone somewhere else to spend $40. Plus tip was $50 because we always tip 20% unless service is extremely bad. Our waitress didn&#39;t seem that she even wanted to be there. When we asked what was in the dipping sauce of my husband&#39;s cauliflower appetizer she replied &#34;I don&#39;t know,&#34; and didn&#39;t even offer to find out even though we were asking her about health conscious options without dairy or egg in the ingredients. This most recent was quite disappointing. I&#39;ve heard that CF is very accommodating when asking for certain variations for special diets, but our waitress didn&#39;t want to take the extra step and find out. Additionally, isn&#39;t it their job to know what is in something? Needless to say, the &#34;aioli&#34; for the cauliflower was very much ranch dressing based. I don&#39;t think that my husband and I will be going back anytime soon. If I&#39;m going to spend $50 on lunch, I will be spending it somewhere else.

For however long I have been coming to this chain (at this location and at others), I don&#39;t think I ever had an issue or problem with any of the food here.<br><br>On a recent visit though, I tried their Hibachi steak. Pretty good! For $20, I thought it was well worth it. I would have liked more mushrooms though, but not a big deal. The Snicker Cheesecake I tried was really good as well, and everything else looked pretty good on the menu.<br><br>My only gripe, is most of their table layouts here. Some of the tables are just way too close to another table. Another group was literally inches away from us, and you can hear their whole conversation. Lighting in this location seems too dim as well, and makes it a little harder to go through the menu.

The service was on point. The dishes were clean. The bathrooms were clean. The food was amazing and it did t take forever but also didn&#39;t come out too fast! The drinks were on point. Kid friendly dishes and price very reasonable for the quality! The staff was very nice! Overall great experience!

Celebrated our anniversary for lunch. This is our first time here and the experience was decent. We arrived as soon as they opened and they were already busy. Our food was very delicious would recommend the herb salmon! Cheesecake was good as well, we defiantly got our cheesecake fix which was basically the whole point of us having lunch there. Service was ok.
A big chain restaurant, with a huge menu, usually crowded, with lots of salty, oily food.  One visit was enough.

Three of us went to the cheesecake factory last night about 5:30 PM. Food was overpriced,two of Had California steak sandwiches. Small amount of meat but it was flavorful. We had to send back our sweet potato fries because they were burnt, second batch was good and hot. Third person got chicken enchiladas, I told my friend not to order Mexican food in American restaurant because it wouldn&#39;t be good. She ordered the chicken enchiladas anyway. She said it Didn&#39;t have any cheese but it was OK. She ate less than half of her meal and didn&#39;t take it home for later. That tells me she didn&#39;t like it. We waited a long time for the mail to come and when it got there all three meals weren&#39;t Hot. Waitress was fine I felt sorry for because we had the complaints. Probably won&#39;t go back

This place is a mess. The server was extremely rude and racist. She refused to give us a napkin for a coaster or a straw, even after I asked nicely. Her exact words &#34;we dont give straws or napkins to people who order WATER&#34; WTF?!?!?!! Then she proceeds to hand to everyone else napkins and straws in the restaurants after us who were caucasian. F that place and F that caucasian waitress. I hope she finds herself under a bus

The wait was about 25 minutes. We were seated in a corner table that was not cleaned. The previous patrons receipt was still on table. Our waitress was nice brought our drinks and food in a reasonable time. My food was not as good as I remembered the first time I had the dish. The chicken lacked flavor and the sauce was lackluster. I was not impressed and disappointed. I hope it was because they were busy put we still paid $57 and added at $10 tip since she was nice. My husbands burger was semi burned when he asked for medium rare.

The menu here best exemplifies the restaurant. 16 pages of mediocre food. Seriously, how can any restaurant make 600 different dishes with any semblance of deliciousness?  Expect to wait long to be seated, long to receive your drinks, a long time to place your order, and a long time to receive your mediocre food. My plate was literally meat and mashed potatoes. How about a few green items on there? At some point I just got bored and stopped eating.  If you like cheesecake, fine. Go and get some cheesecake to go.

I gave this place a try my first time around and I like their pasta and especially their bread ... very yummy. But omg !!! I tried their cheese cake it was soo yummy but then I pulled out something from my mouth and it was a long lint stuck inside the cheese cake... lol I&#39;m not trying to be mean or anything but when hair or something long that feels like hair in my food, gets in my food I trip out.... since then never again.... I&#39;ll probably try things out maybe one more time but just never their cheese cake...

4 stars because the service lately has been great... the drinks and food are consistent.  I really appreciate the multitude of options available on their book of a menu... especially how accommodating they are to my GLUTEN FREE lifestyle.  The sweet corn tamale cakes are such a treat to my limited diet and the Godiva cheesecake is always a great gluten-free dessert option yum! Their cocktails are great!  <br><br>I would say this is my go-to restaurant in Fresno area due to the options and I can always get something that I want.    <br><br>Things that can improve their rating: <br><br>They NEED to start accepting reservations!!! (biggest downfall of the entire restaurant) I have wanted to book Cheesecake for my birthday dinner, family events etc... but due to their inability to accommodate larger parties with reservations we always eat elsewhere <br><br>The RESTROOM maintenance: whenever I have to use the restroom at this location there is water splashed all over the sinks, toilet paper not on rolls (which is a health code violation) etc... just need more attention to their facilities<br><br>Overall a great chain staple in Fresno<br><br>5/5/17 - taking FOREVER TO GET APPETIZERS

Had the Fish tacos and some water, I must say the black beans tasted very good, normally I don&#39;t care for them. I was thinking about ordering some banana cheesecake but didn&#39;t, I&#39;m still working on my weight loss. Enjoy

The atmosphere here is really nice and relaxing. You have a choice to be seated inside or out. We came on a Sunday evening, the wait was not long at all. <br>I ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon for $19.95. It was a grilled salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus. This dish was absolutely delicious, no complaints whatsoever. My boyfriend ordered the ribeye steak for $26.95. The steak was a decent size, I had a couple bites of his steak and it was also very delicious. It was cooked perfectly and was very tender. My brother in law ordered the avocado egg roll for his appetizer, I tried one and it was alright. <br>Service here was not so bad. My only problem was how long it took for the food to come out. Other than that, I enjoyed my visit here and I will probably come back sooner or later.

Never had a bad meal,  or a bad service here at the Cheesecake Factory. 5 minutes from my work and opens for lunch . Yet to take my family here to see how they like it , but my Colleagues and Business affiliates , always commend the food and the service here. The wait in the Bay area for any Cheesecake Factory location is at least on hour.<br>I do recommend the Cheesecake Factory for Lunch or dinner , whether its a full meal or a Salad you will never leave hungry . So far so good.
Had the taquitos and they were pretty good with the pico, still love celebration cake.

I never venture out on the menu every time I eat at this place. Today was different and will also be the last time I venture out. I tried the parmesan chicken sandwich. Not great by any means. Chicken strips they used did not have a good crunch. The peppers were too soft and the cheese did not taste fresh, very processed flavors. Overall the experience was still great. Awesome outdoor eating area and great service.
Amazing service by Robin, the best experience we&#39;ve had by any restaurant in a very long time <br><br>- Aidan

We had an amazing time, our server Shark  (yes his name is really Shark) was absolutely phenomenal! Very attentive well versed with the menu and his descriptions of menu item painted a vivid tasteful picture of what we would soon be enjoying. His recommendations were spot on perfect. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU ASK FIR SHARK! <br>Management staff should definitely give him a raise. <br><br>With that said, the one thing we did notice (my girlfriend and I) was that management over sat Shark time and time again. He seemed to handle the over flow very well and being ex-servers we both understand that being sat a 4 top two 2 tops a 6 top all at once can be hard to handle but nonetheless Shark seemed to doing an outstanding job.

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. Everything I have ordered here has been really good including the drinks. My favorite here is the shrimp Alfredo. It is so creamy and delicious. I also really like the jambalaya. So much meat and Cajan sauce is so good. The sangria is really refreshing and strong. The service is always good and pretty fast for how busy they are. One of my favorite places to eat.

Came here for a friends birthday dinner, we had to wait 3 hours to be seated, I would have changed locations... but it wasn&#39;t my birthday dinner.<br>First of all when we were being led to our table from the bar (where we were waiting) we were told by our waitress that our drinks from the bar would be added to our tab, then the bar tender storms over to our table full of people acting like we were trying to not pay for our tab, talk about embarrassing.<br>Our waitress brought out every single person&#39;s drinks besides mine and was extremely rude when I told her I think she forgot my drink and my water.<br>3 of us got sick after dinner.<br>I was 10 dollars over when paying my tab and the waitress never brought my change expecting it was a tip... she definitely didn&#39;t deserve that much lol.

Delicious food and awesome service! My sister and I were seated in the main dinning area right when we entered. To our surprise there was no one in front of us! Shortly after being seated, our waitress showed up and we asked if happy hour was throughout the entire restaurant and she confirmed it was only in the bar area. She went over and got us a happy hour menu and right away we decided to go to the bar area. The waitress mention that all high tops were taken and that the only available seats were at the bar, but quickly noticed one table became readily available and rushed us over, she apologized for rushing us, but we didn&#39;t mind it at all.  After we transferred our bread, silverware, etc. over, we waited and waited to see who our waiter/waitress was and no one stopped by to check on us. So we decided to pull the closest waitress, her name was Alissa (AMAZING), and asked. She counted the tables down to ours then looked at her paper and said a woman&#39;s name (can&#39;t recall) was our waitress for the night, but she&#39;s busy with other tables and said she can get our drinks. So she took our drink order and left. As we continue to wait for &#34;our&#34; waitress, who never showed up, Alissa came back with our drinks and also decided to take our food order. It was never mentioned to us that Alissa was taking over, but we didn&#39;t mind since she has already been taking care of us. I noticed our &#34;was&#34; waitress was running around everywhere and serving others and felt so bad for her, but was lucky enough to be taken care of by Alissa for the night. She was amazing and checked in on us regularly to make sure everything was great and even offered dessert, but sadly, we were beyond full and didn&#39;t make it to dessert, maybe next time. Thanks for taking care of us tonight, Alissa!!
Unfortunately dinner tonight was very disappointing. Everything from the app to the entrees. As soon as we left, the bf threw up. He never throws up, all bad.

Trying it out one more time. We were told the Sunday brunch cooks are different than the weekly cooks. And that they know how to make poached eggs. I&#39;m returning again to find out if that&#39;s true. *fingers crossed* I&#39;m not ordering eggs this time but someone in my party is. I am ordering the brûlée French toast. Keeping the stars at a 3 until the end of the meal.<br><br>Ok. Meal is finished and the verdict: <br>Sunday is the day to order ANYTHING breakfast. They have redeemed the poached egg tragedy from Saturday. <br>5 stars today for the food. <br>Service was about a 3. <br>Check out the difference from Saturday&#39;s egg catastrophe  to Sunday&#39;s success.

Coming from a restaurant worker myself there is a reason for leaving this review. Given that today is Mother&#39;s Day I am fully aware of how busy this particular location can get. My review is not about me waiting from when my order was placed online at 3:40 pm and barely getting it at 7:00 pm. My complaint is about my food quality. I had asked after waiting in line for 2 hours that my food be made fresh due to knowing how food gets from an hour of sitting in the food warmers. When I got home (keep in mind I live across the street) my food was as cold as food out of a refrigerator. Fries were stale for all three lunch items ordered, the bread was soggy and chewy on two of the sandwiches, one entree was missing, and to top it off one of the sandwiches (the club) had no meat on one half. But besides the cold food and having to throw away most of it, with my Mother missing her entree; I was not satisfied with the experience. The customer service was great and accommodating just not the food quality. Also mentioning that the manager on had allowed what seemed to be a friend of his jump to the front of the line place an order and leave with their food within 20 minutes. That&#39;s upsetting for someone who was waiting 3 hours let alone to receive low quality cold food that should have been hot or at a warm temperature if anything. Not pleased at all with the food today.

our waiter was super attentive and helpful, the staff was especially patient considering that they sang happy birthday to four other tables plus ours, <br>buuuuuut their chicken piccata deadass tasted like 1000 island dressing....so that&#39;s that

Came here for the first time not having high expectations. I was very pleasantly surprised! The service was outstanding! Our server Alita was phenomenal! The ahi tuna poke was amazing. Great drink specials for happy hour. We will definitely be going back.

Hosts were very rude about a mistake that they made. We called two days ahead of time and made reservations for 13 at 7:30. When we arrived we were told we missed our reservation because they booked it for 6:30. Before getting off the phone while making reservations the lady on the other end asked me if it was for 6:30 and I said no 7:30..... Then we were told that we could not have made reservations because they don&#39;t take reservations over the phone. After telling us we had reservations but they booked them for the wrong time.... Was one heck of a hassle.

This review is for the hostess who was working Wednesday 11/07 after 6:00 pm. <br><br>I walked in and told the hostess that I needed a table just for myself, she said the bar area was available if I wanted to sit there. I said no, I&#39;d rather sit in a quieter area. So she told me that the wait was about 10 mins. I agreed &amp; said that was fine. (I figured there were other people on the list waiting) So I stepped to the side out of the way near the cake display &amp; she could still see me. <br><br>So about 10 mins later she calls my name &amp; walks me over to the bar area to sit in a tight space by the bar. So I repeated myself &amp; simply said that I didn&#39;t want to be by the bar. Then I go back to the front area to wait again for a table. <br><br>The whole time I&#39;m waiting on her to seat me, I could see a few tables that were completely empty &amp; away from all the families &amp; a large group that was celebrating a bday that were seated in the back area. Also while I kept waiting on her to seat me and I never saw her take anyone else to the tables, she was just greeting people who were walking in after me. <br><br>Finally she motions me to follow her to a table, she walked me over to a table in back, the most crowded area of the restaurant to sit me at a table that was in the middle of the large party that was celebrating a birthday to the right and a family of 5 to left of the table. <br><br>I don&#39;t know why she was making it so difficult for me to get a quite table so I could enjoy my dinner. So I decided to just leave and go to another restaurant (Fleming&#39;s next door). Her attitude &amp; tone was so unprofessional that I didn&#39;t even want to deal with her seating me somewhere else. As I walking out I asked for her name so I could review my experience she said her name was Laura. Her behavior is absolutely unacceptable for the job she chose to be in.
Friend and i always die for the sourdough breadsticks with butter...NO REGRETS.<br>Food coma , yuhs.

Meh.. food is pretty good but food is over priced and unless you know one of the servers personally the service always sucks!!! I don&#39;t hate it but I don&#39;t love it.. it&#39;s never a choice for me I only go there if some one else has already made plans .

We went for dinner this evening. It was a long wait due to it being a holiday but it was well worth it. <br>Our waitress Alexee was amazing. She was very attentive and personable. <br>The food was great and appetizer came before the food(some places don&#39;t understand that concept). <br>Our drinks were also great. I was impressed with the quality of food and service for being so busy.

Oh Cheesecake factory ( CCF ), why is it almost always a disappointment ???<br><br>We took my girlfriends mother out to lunch today, as normal the CCF was pretty busy, but we only had to wait a few minutes to be seated right near the waiter stand when I saw a few other table that were open, but this time at least they weren&#39;t loud like the ones we have been to in the past.<br><br>Over all the food was good, but the noise level seemed a bit high inside, so we ordered drinks and apps and everything seemed fine till we were told &#34;we are out of the wheat bread for a bit, but should have some soon..&#34; WTH I like sourdough, and she likes wheat bread.... Well can you bring it out to us when you have some ready, I sure can said the waiter.. Hmmmm<br><br>So as we are eating our apps, which of course one of them was the Cuban roll, which I gave a epic fail rating, everyone at the table thought I ordered some fish in a roll with tarter sauce ( that&#39;s right CCF ) it was a really sucky roll. Meantime I see a few bus boy/girls walk by with wheat bread and no waitier in sight, so I flag down a bus person ( they always know whats going on ) and ask for Wheat bread, BANG Bread at our table and it has wheat in the basket.. Sweeettttttt<br><br>So we eat more bread and finish our apps and get even more bread ( that was a big mistake ), Food food food food, bring out the food... Ok we are just hungry, so here comes the 2 salads, and then the pasta, and wait one more noodle salad for the girlfriend, ok everyone has food but me, ok anytime now, and then I see a waiter walk right by me and I think that&#39;s mine ...  Nope, so the clock starts to tick, and tick and tick and I eat more bread and drink my drink and of course tell everyone don&#39;t wait for me EAT, so now about 10 mins go by and I grab a bus boy, hey ummm we are missing a meal mine, can you check please.<br><br>So about 5 mins later he comes back and says what are you missing and I said my bbq burger and he says I will be right back, by now our waiter swings by and says is everything ok here and I said Ahhh NO, we are clearly missing my Burger, and then I see the bus boy come out with a plate in his hand coming to my table and of course the 1st thing I think of I bet it&#39;s been sitting under the heat lamp for the last 10 mins or see, the cheese seemed cold, but he meat was warm/hot, so I said thanks and chowed  down.<br><br>Our waiter appears once again asking about everything, and leaves and then we get drink refills and so on and after that things seemed better so we ordered desert, paid and left.<br><br>Over all the food was good other then the cuban roll aka fish stick wrap, service was poor via the waiter, but the bus boys/girls saved the day ..

Usually the service is okay and the food is delicious. Unfortunately that was not our experience this weekend. It just went from bad to worse. The wait was not too bad-15 minutes roughly. The waitress took quite a few minutes to come over. She took our order and then we waited. The tables on both sides of us received their appetizers and their meals. It turned out our meal went to the wrong table. The tables next to us finished their meals and had their desert before we finally received our dinner. <br>The waitress offered us soup or salad while we waited. She came back with 1 side salad for 2 of us, with the wrong dressing. Then she brought us a bill. We sat there confused for awhile and a manager came over to say the meal was taken care of. Which left us even more confused because our waitress had just told us she would take care of the bill when we were ready. <br>Normally a good experience here, but every place has its ups and downs. <br><br>The bread is amazing and so is the cheesecake.<br>The fried chicken eggs benedict is absolutely amazing and i highly recommend that.<br>also a favorite of mine is the bacon bacon burger, but you should share this with someone and have a large appetite.
I had the Steak Diane cooked medium well and it was delicious! The service was fast and super nice. Will definitely be back :)

I come here for salad. They have good salad and it&#39;s difficult to find restaurants that serve good salad meals in Fresno. My favorite is the ones in &#34;Super Foods&#34;. Good price and good volume. I highly recommend their salads with or without additional topping meats.<br>Because of its busy location, finding a parking spot nearby is impossible. And sometime waiting time is very long. That&#39;s the reason I give 4 stars.<br>Otherwise, store is clean and good service.

Cheesecake Factory is my all time FAVORITE restaurant- I love coming here. I ordered my favorite dish, and guess what I find???? A PIECE OF PLASTIC IN MY PASTA!!!!!!! Are you kidding me? In my food? I could go on about how dangerous this is uhmmm are you kidding me this is a food establishment.

They make it so difficult to book you really feel like they don&#39;t want business! It&#39;s during the week I called 3 different times and was told 3 different things. All I wanted to do was have a birthday dinner for me soon. They lost on a big ticket and we bought eddies cheese cake! I thought maybe it was just a mishap spoke with the manager and no he didn&#39;t care to help out even after I explained. I would rather spend my money with people that know what customer service is!

With tables open it took over 30 minutes to get seated and get a beer in front of me. About 15 to get seated and a solid 15 minutes to get a beer delivered to the table.<br><br>Goodbye Fresno Cheesecake Factory, you lost me for good.

Pros: <br>-Food. The portion was huge... well for me it was. <br>-The customer service! The lady had such great customers service. I absolutely love her. <br><br>Cons:<br>-The wait<br>-The left the silverware on the table which is soooo unsanitary. <br><br>Thanks for everything :)

If your looking for options look no further this menu is huge!<br><br> I enjoy food, the ambiance and the many choices of items to order at the Cheesecake Factory. Perfect for date night or a family gathering. Average prices and if you like cheesecake there is great selection to choose from, you can order a slice or a whole cake. Me, I do not like cheesecake so I cannot tell how good it is or is not. <br><br>The restaurant is nicely decorated, wait staff are dressed well and professional. The parking at this location is not the greatest as it shares the parking lot with the mall. You just might be that lucky person who pulls in at the right time, and that right time would be as someone is backing out of a spot in front of the restaurant or right across from it.<br><br> I have not tried all the menu items so I can not speak for all the food. The food I have tried has been good, seasoned well and nothing to complain about. My favorite item so far is the free range roasted chicken with mashed potatoes and carrots. I would recommend giving this place a try if you have never been.

Everyone can agree good service can&#39;t be replaced with good food. We were having a good night up until we came to the cheese cake factory. We walked in and checked in for 2. There was only a couple people ahead of us. We were not seated until we said something about 7 other people that came after us were seated. When asked why we weren&#39;t seated yet, she gave us a nasty look. The young lady said there was no tables available and they were cleaning the tables. When seated we notice 6 other places we could&#39;ve been seated. Our table that we were sitting at wobbled and we asked to move to a booth. This has happened to us twice by the same young lady. I hope she learns that we live in a diverse community and to treat others the same regardless of race and ethnic background.

I love eating here I always get the same plate because it&#39;s delicious it&#39;s called a chicken bellagio and it&#39;s flattened chicken over a bed of basil pasta. Plus I think they have some of the best mojitos in town. The bread is delicious and they tend to have some pretty good service.
Food was okay. Watered down drinks and my pasta was pretty dry. For the price, I would go elsewhere.
Why do I feel like food at Cheesecake Factory is just okay? The cheesecake is great but the rest is average for the price.

The service was not good for our large party table of 12. Either the waitress was new and overwhelmed or she was not trained to serve a large table. She forgot my dressing and I had to remind her 3x. Other family members ordered no cheese on their burger and it came with cheese. We waited almost 40 minutes for our table and the service was bad.
Our waitress was super sweet and very helpful. The food is always great and we always have a pleasant time here.

Took my sisters here for their birthday dinner. Natalie was our server and she amazing. She answer all the questions we had and she knew her menu very well. I highly recommend the mac and cheese burger if you haven&#39;t had it. Also the avocado egg rolls is to die for.

Steaks are pretty good. They always tend to over cook mine but the flavor isn&#39;t bad. The service is really slow. Be prepared to wait for at least a hour and a half to get seated. The wiaters are somewhat attentive. Dont come here on the weekends if you&#39;re hungry.

We have not been here in many moons. I just had a Steak Diane  I could cut with a fork. Now if a 3/4 &#34; cut of meat is that tender, well worth the visit. <br><br>We also recommend the egg roll sampler.....very flavorful. <br><br>Someone in the kitchen is on their A game to be sure.

Ordered the nachos. By the time I was done it didn&#39;t even look like I made a dent. They were really good. <br>We had a party of 8 around lunchtime and got taken care of in a timely manner. Also ordered the apple cinnamon cheesecake to go. I think it had a different name, but it was delicious. Waitress was nice and even gave us iced tea to go. The menu is ridiculously long. I feel sorry for the cooks. But everything was good.

My family and I have been regulars at this restaurant for so many years. We have been to different Cheesecake Factory locations across the United States; we feel that this place is a landmark. About 3 weeks ago we try to put our names down to get a table and the hostesses ignored us for nearly 15 minutes. They were to busy talking about their dates and other things that may be really important to them but should not be that important whena guests is waiting. We got tired and decided to leave to end up at another chain restaurant where the host staff did not neglect us.<br><br>I was not asking much...just acknowledge the guests and make sure they does not feel ignored. It will take a few weeks for me to cool of and by then I&#39;ll probably give this place a very last chance.

I travel a lot and when I go to a town where there Cheesecake Factory I always go to, I&#39;ve believe that Cheesecake Factory is a great restaurant to go to but this one it really disappointed me, I was deeply hurt. It was a Thursday night me and one of my friend we had decided to go to Cheesecake Factory for dinner. We got there the first thing I noticed was the lighting it was very dim. My order was buffalo wings it came with blue cheese dipping and I asked for ranch dipping. I was enjoying my wings and talking to my friend I ate about haft of the chicken wings when I notice something red on the bone I thought it was the red buffalo sauce but I took a picture of it and the chicken wings was raw, I felt disgusted. I quickly let the waitress know about the raw chicken, she took it to the back and told the manager and show the manager the raw chicken. The manager, I believe his name is call Sal ( he looks Southeast Asian) he came in he said &#34;what seems to be the problem?&#34; Me, didn&#39;t Kourtney show you the raw chicken? You and your chef serve me raw chicken. Sal, I&#39;m so sorry there&#39;s nothing we could do but I could give you a free cheesecake that&#39;s the best I could do. At that moment I felt that I was punched in the face and then was offer free cheesecake. I denied the free cheesecake. I said free cheesecake you going to give me a free cheesecake after you guys served me raw chicken I don&#39;t want cheesecake. The manager Sal said well we could take your information down but there&#39;s really nothing we could do we have to follow procedure we&#39;ll follow up with you( the follow-up never happen it been a week). I was calm, if it was someone else who ate the raw chicken would of FLIP. Diners if you want to go to a place where you could trust them to handle your food that you&#39;re going to consume into your body I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody! I took picture of the raw chicken bone it&#39;s in the photo.

WORST POSSIBLE SERVICE EVER! <br><br>I guess if you are under 21, have self esteem issues or don&#39;t really know anything beyond McDonald&#39;s, this MIGHT be the place for you.<br><br>Otherwise, read on . . .<br><br>I have personally been to this place around a dozen times over the last 6 years or so. The first few, it was OK. It was like watching Episode IV - A New Hope . . . Then, the new pattern . . .<br><br>Last time we went - Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back . . . a group of 4 adults &amp; 2 toddlers. Waitress literally rolled her eyes at my mother - Right in front of us ! ! All because she didn&#39;t understand the dish description. What a nerve!  We called manager &amp; asked her dismissed from our table. Result - Big upset &amp; left with stomach ache.<br><br>Today - Same group of people. Arrive right before 5 on a Saturday. Asked for a booth &amp; were tild 15 mins . . . 35 mins later . . . We&#39;re called over as beeper rings. We hand beeper over &amp; ARE LEFT STANDING in front of hostess station 5 MORE MINUTES whilest NO ONE addresses us &amp; continue talking amongst themselves.<br><br>Today Part II - As I complain and ask if anyone is going to take care of us, one of them walks over to see where  a table might be open and directs a busboy to set it up! We ask why no booth (kids) &amp; point over to previously open booths from mere moments ago (now seating someone who got there after us). With attitude, says it&#39;ll have to be a few more minutes!<br><br>Today Part III - Episode VI - Return of the Jedi, I mean, I take it from my parents hands &amp; ask what the problem is ALMOST 40 MINS LATER ! She presents further attitude  (stereotype coming up) . . . and disappears. I think her tongue ring was as disrespectful as her attitude! WE LEAVE!<br><br>Today Conclusion - We drive 5 mins to the most wonderful restaurant with the most amazing meals, with a waitress that shined! Name of place - Black Angus on Shaw &amp; Cedar. New Favorite  :) ! ! ! <br><br>Thanks incompetents of Cheesecake Factory Fashion Fair Fresno CA ! ! !  You showed me the path to dining heaven - elsewhere :)!

I almost had a five-star experience here.<br><br>We came here with dessert on our minds and left after consuming a whole lot more than that.<br><br>We arrived on Labor Day at approx. 9:30 PM. Closing time on this particular evening was @ 11:00 pm.<br><br>The atmosphere was low light and kind of romantic. Candles were burning at every table. We were seated at a two-person table which is the basis for my only real complaint of the evening - the table just wasn&#39;t big enough to allow us eat what we ordered comfortably.<br><br>Our waitress was extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive the entire time.<br><br>We started with drinks - I had a beer and my wife had a Blueberry Mojito which she loved. So far so good - off to a very good start. <br><br>To eat, we ordered the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps which are build-your-own style. What this means is that they arrive to you in parts - the lettuce,  chicken, sauce, carrots, cucumbers, etc. all come separate on the dish and you build your lettuce wrap yourself. I&#39;d rather them come prebuilt but they were so good I didn&#39;t care. The chicken they came with was seasoned and grilled to perfection. The three different sauces that were included tasted great and I used all three together. In total, we were each able to make about 4 lettuce wraps which was more than we expected. Great deal in my opinion.<br><br>In addition to the lettuce wraps, we ordered the Skinny Shrimp Soft Tacos (skinny calorie-wise) and three very fat (by appearance) soft tacos came to our table. They were filled with lettuce (maybe cabbage), chicken, tomatoes, avocados, and maybe some other items. At this point we were almost too full from the lettuce wraps to pay close attention to what was inside. My wife ate one and I ate the other two. The soft tacos were very good but the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps were the star of the night.<br><br>We didn&#39;t order a main entree and were too full to order dessert (the reason we came lol). Let me add that before we ordered anything, we were given two types of bread (one dark and one light) and butter. The bread was delicious - the perfect combination of crust and softness.<br><br>Overall, we were both really impressed. We have avoided this place for so long but really for no reason. We just always went to BJ&#39;s instead. They have a very extensive menu and a full bar. Another complaint I have is that if I am in the mood to drink a beer and eat, their beer selection is quite slim. This isn&#39;t really a complaint though because it&#39;s not often I drink and eat.<br><br>We will definitely be back to try some of the other items that caught our attention on the menu.

The location is great for after a day of shopping! The atmosphere is beautiful. The food is amazing! We ordered the Carne Asada steak medallions. The beef was cooked perfect and a very tender cut, juicy and thick. It was bursting with tangy flavor. The pasta Napoletana was bomb!!!!! Robin was our server at table 83. She was very kind and welcoming.

If you have a large group then this is not the place to go eat. I called a week ahead of time and was told they do not take reservations however to call 15-20 minutes prior to arrival at the restaurant. I called as directed and was told they do not do call ahead. I arrived at the restaurant and was told to wait for a manager. The manager tells me it is a 2 hour wait. At this point I&#39;m so frustrated that they can&#39;t just be straight forward on the phone. It would have saved me time and and now I am never going back. Poor large party procedures.

I always love the Cheesecake Factory. My all time favorite is the chicken Madeira. It&#39;s perfect every time. I love the Godiva chocolate cheesecake! Always have great customer service as well. Bread is great as well.

As always, this Cheesecake held true to the brand.  Clean and friendly and food was great.  Kourtney F was our server and was delightful and attentive.  Great job Cheesecake Factory.. even if your passing through a city it&#39;s nice to have a restaurant you can trust..<br>Cheers
Only for the bearded bartender working tonight. He is absolutely rude and unprofessional. Charged us more than double.  Wouldn&#39;t make eye contact and he sucked

This place is def one of my favorites places to dine. the whole menu provides an array of so many great choices. The fresh bread is always an added perk. We had a couple Long Island and man.... I just wanted to hug the bartender! Two thumbs up! The lighting in the building is fairly dim, but I guess their conserving energy. Anyways this is a great place great service overall you won&#39;t be disappointed

We went on a Sunday about 4pm and we waited maybe 20 min before seating our party of 6 not to bad considering it was the weekend. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food was great we had the pork chops and truffle chicken, which my sister loved as well. The waitress was very kind and prompt in getting out orders and refilling our drinks. We tried a few slices of cheesecake of course and they were okay. I myself got the vanilla bean and my sis the banana cream cheesecake and they were good.

Goodness this is the place to go if you love terrible servers. Our server not only ignored me and my girlfriend for 10 minutes while she greeted tables that came in after us, but she also took 15 minutes to get our drinks (no lie we timed it). Our waters were never refilled and her attitude was atrocious. The manager gave us some cheesecake to make up for it and gave us a new server but our experience was already ruined. Plus it was our first time here. Never again.

Lunch during at Cheesecake Factory seems like a great idea any day. And most of my past visits have been great. This day, however, the pressure of graduation parties, shoppers, and just everyday restaurant-goers was definitely getting to the service staff and it showed. Their patio is great. They do battle the sun with their 15 or so umbrellas. There is the time of the day where there aren&#39;t enough, and we were there during this time. Come to Cheesecake Factory for the food, though there are a few things that have been retired from the menu - one of them being the ahi carpaccio. They do offer ahi tartare, but of course, that is not the same. The service could definitely use improvement. Maybe the patio is where the new wait staff starts with the motto &#34;hit the ground running.&#34; The patio dining is a coveted location for dining, esp on the gorgeous day we were there, but I was not interested staying out there longer that we had to because of slow wait staff who kept forgetting what they were supposed to bring or just plain didn&#39;t check up on things. Food is good. Menu is huge, so allot for time to review if you need to decide on what to order. Location is great if you happen to be by the Fashion Fair area. If you aren&#39;t service sensitive, come and definitely try the food. I will be honest, their menu is a lot to look at and I always end up with the grilled salmon. I don&#39;t know if that is just my brain on over load and shutting down, leaving me to go with something familiar. There is a full service bar. If you have a time limit to your meal, do not come here or: ask to look at the menu while you wait (they do not take reservations), ask for the extras when you order so that come out with or ahead of the food (i.e. ranch, sweetener, extra straws, etc.), and ask for the check after they ask how things are after the whole table does get their order. IF YOU DO NOT DO THIS, you will be there for a very long time! Now, if you do not have a time limit and are more forgiving than I towards the level of service I do expect at a $25 a personrestaurant, then this is the place to eat. The ambiance is casual yet classy, not formal or dressy, but if you wanted to get gussied up, you wouldn&#39;t stick out.<br><br>Definitely a place to try if you haven&#39;t yet or go to once a year for a special occasion. Not a place for any more than that.

Spent $40 on 4 desserts to bring home for my family, which I am usually happy to do, but I get home and open this? It looks like someone&#39;s leftover dessert! We drove 45 minutes to this place. So disappointed. Won&#39;t be back for a while.

It wasn&#39;t the best place I have ate, it wasn&#39;t the worse. The service was so/so. I had to ask twice for an item. Which I understand it was a little busy for a Saturday. But when you over pay for food and drinks you do expect A higher level of service.

People sure do go crazy over this place, and while i do enjoy a few select items on their menu, I&#39;ve never been as impressed as my peers. I will say that the atmosphere, decor, and cleanliness is impeccable. Also as much as I despise mushrooms, the stuffed mushrooms here are so good that I forget my fungi hatered. The avacado stuffed eggrolls are a favorite. and their claim to fame ( cheesecake) is always mouth watering. I guess im mainly not impressed with their entrees, or their very weak albiet pricy drinks. I&#39;ll just stick to appetizers, and the cheesecake.
Best service ever. Food is always great. Always greeted. Waiters check on us periodically.

I went to cheesecake factory for dinner Saturday night 8/10/19 ordered the jambalaya pasta it was very delicious. So delicious I decided to return Monday 8/12/19 for lunch along with two co-workers our orders totaled about $65. Being that our Lunch is only 30 minute I called in the order of multiple jambalaya pasta and asked for extra sauce. We picked up the order curbside got back to the job with 15 min to eat. I had a bed of pasta with no sauce period!!! The peppers and chicken were lightly sauced.. I called the cheesecake factory to let them know my order was not correct and before I could finish my statement I was placed on hold. After 15 minutes, I hug up called back and asked for a manager who responded to by complaint by telling me the jambalaya pasta has no sauce it&#39;s only butter. I had to explain I just had the dish two days prior and there was plenty of sauce. His response was for me to come back in for some sauce then. By this time my lunch break was over I was so upset and disappointed I had wasted my time and hard earned money on the dish that was delicious two days prior and horrible today. Needless to say $20 for a plate, I expect it to be correctly.  I can promise you I will never order a to go meal from the Cheesecake Factory again. The manager should had known customer service is the key to a successful business. People work hard for their money and expect to get what you pay for !!!!!!!!!great
The steak medallions were absolutely delicious! <br><br>And of course the celebration cheesecake was to die for!  I will be back...

Love almost everything on the menu and in fairly a picky eater. Although parking sucks it worth the hassle. Lunch specials are very affordable if your looking for quality food on a semi budget ($12 a dish)

I had brunch with about 13 friends here and we&#39;ll never come again. I was told they did not take reservations when I talked to a hostess a couple weeks before our event (even though I told them we had a large party), so I decided to call an hour ahead of time to put our name in the waiting list. I was told they only took reservations until 11am (contradictory to what I&#39;d been told before) and wouldn&#39;t take our name and that the restaurant wasn&#39;t busy so we&#39;d have no problem being seated. Upon arrival, the restaurant was busy and we were told that we&#39;d be seated once half our party arrived. When that happened 15 minutes later, I went to the hostess and we were then told if we wanted to eat inside we&#39;d have to wait an hour and a half! We ended up seated outside after waiting 35 minutes.<br><br>This could&#39;ve been avoided had the restaurant taken my name down an hour ahead of time, especially since we had a large party.<br><br>This wasn&#39;t the only problem, though. Once everyone paid, the manager and server came out and accused two people in our party of not paying, which was ludicrous. They claimed to have cameras inside to prove this, yet we were seated outside, so no footage could show what happened between collecting our payments and taking them inside the restaurant. After we complained, the server said it was &#34;a misunderstanding&#34; yet the manager never came out to apologize for their accusations.<br><br>We will not be bringing our business to this location again. They need to learn proper customer service to earn it back. Take my advice and go somewhere else!

After shopping at the mall and parking in the valet outside of the cheese cake factory my husband and I decided to eat here since Flemings does not open till 4 and we had time to kill. So we have given this place atleast 3 try&#39;s in one month, drinks are corporate so overpriced and barely any alcohol (but with drinks 10$ a drink they want you to keep drinking) so my advice have a martini not a mixed drink. <br>I had the hibiscus martini and it was actually really good!<br><br>So the last time we came here which was yesterday it was such a bad experience. Food wise that is; customer service is always amazing here. The cooks need a new cook book or something! I ordered the salmon with steak Diane which is served with mashed potatoes. Mashed potatoes were cold salmon tasted weird (fishy taste) and I asked for medium rare and record fully cooked steak. My husband ordered this chicken dish that I thought was so delish, it was also served with cold flavorless mashed potatoes and flavorless asparagus. Honestly the food was worst then hospital food bland no flavor and cold! They were incompetent to listen to what I wanted and served me what they wanted me to have. <br><br>The manager asked if I wanted anything else but at this point I was so over this place and there food.<br><br>Will most likely never be returning here.
Overpriced. Tasteless food. Service was good tho. Never come here again. Ordered turkey burger. Size is tiny. McDonalds makes better burgers.

So I am at Cheesecake Factory now at 5:30pm on a Saturday half the restaurant is empty inside and there is two tables taken up outside. But yet it is a 45 minutes wait. Can someone from management please explain to me why that is?

I had the worst experience at this Cheesecake Factory location. I ordered curbside pick up and had to call twice to let them know I was there. I was told the wait would be 25 minutes and ended up <br>Waiting over an hour. I called a third time to cancel my order and the woman who answered the phone hung up on me.

So I promised myself I&#39;d never return after the horrific train wreck of a experience I had last visit but lo and behold like a roller coaster of Goliath proportions it was actually great this time like literally a whole different atmosphere maybe last time everybody was drunk or something yeah that&#39;s possible I mean I was unblinded by the difference, whoa and the service jeez the service was great,see kids it goes to show you second chances are what keeps optimism alive in the old Shnaz here I mean if it wasn&#39;t for second chances I wouldn&#39;t be married still that&#39;s how much I believe a bad experience can be overturned by a good old solid second chance :) 4 stars Cheesecake Factory I gotta say cherrio lads and lasses I tip my hat for a job well done ole boy

Teresa (server) and Al (mgr.) took care of me when I left my Credit Card behind after enjoying the absolute best Cobb Salad and wife&#39;s terrific Thai Chicken with brown rice. Top-notch personnel, pleasant ambience, moderate prices, and diverse menu. Hope to have room for dessert next time!

Ok so I walked in in their was a wait ,so I went to wash my hands. I went into the bathroom and walking in I was  immediately reminded of a port o potty at a music festival the smell was awful , no soap and the paper towels were overflowing all over the floor I went and told the hostesses and they sat me . I started eating then got up to go to the bathroom again thinking it&#39;s been 50 min they took care of it now both stalls were full of  overflowing in one and the other with some dirty socks on the floor . The only reason for the 1 star is the server was on point . My stomach still hurts I hope the kitchen is cleaner . Get it together ppl

We ate there in a large group. 14 people. Lunch time. Service was great. Our orders were taken and food out pretty quickly. They warned anyone ordering a burger it would take 20 minutes to come out. Nice to let them know. My cucumber lemonade was so good! And bang bang chicken and shrimp was delicious! Parking was no bueno so I took one star for that. I had to valet.
Jose is a very respectful manager , good food and obviously there cheesecake is why you come here!

Four of us Visalians happened to be in Fresburg early this evening,and visited your establishment in that beehive called Fashion Faire. Perhaps your cheesecake is very good-don&#39;t know. <br>  The three others in our party found their meals passable ,if over priced;but the fish &#39;n chips i had might be described as mediocre at a third the price; way more potato fries than the five or so little hunks of dry fish. Certainly my first&amp; last visit there;kudos to your server crew ,though. Lots &amp; lots of better places to go.  Georg S.

Disappointing. That&#39;s how I&#39;d describe our last visit to this chain restaurant. With all chains, the food is pretty standard between the different locations. What distinguishes each location is the quality of service.  <br><br>We went to celebrate an anniversary last month, and visited mid-week for dinner. Luckily, we didn&#39;t have to wait very long before we were seated. It took quite a while before anyone came to give us water or find out what we wanted to drink. And after our first server took our drink order, she told us her shift was ending, and we were assigned to a different server.  <br><br>Maybe our mistake was ordering appetizers at the same time that we ordered our entrees.  About 20 minutes after we ordered, our entrees showed up.  I asked the server what happened to our appetizers. He looked at me for a moment and said he&#39;d check on them. As the server started to walk away, I had to call him back and ask him to take back our entrees, and bring them to us after we had a chance to enjoy our appetizers. I don&#39;t know about you, but there is no excuse for bringing out entrees before appetizers. That&#39;s like forgetting to provide a salad course and then bringing it to the table after dessert. <br><br> It took at least another 15 minutes or so to get our appetizers.  The server did apologize for the mix up, but then came back less than five minutes after dropping off the appetizers and asked if we were ready for our entrees yet. REALLY?  It was almost as if he was inconvenienced by us calling him out on screwing up the order of our meal.  We weren&#39;t even half way done with the appetizer course, when he came back and asked us again.  I couldn&#39;t speak I was so frustrated (I have NO verbal filter when frustration swells), so thankfully my husband asked him to give us twenty minutes before bringing out the entrees.<br><br>When the entrees did arrive, it was obvious they had been sitting under a heat lamp from the time they were sent back. The veggies were soggy (unusual for the Cheesecake Factory), and the crispy crust on the breaded chicken had softened.<br><br>Other than that, the food was decent, but the borderline rude service really marred the experience. <br><br>I love this chain and will be back, but it will be hard for me to choose to return to the Fresno location.

We love to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. We have been at this restaurant several times. Recently, we went to this restaurant to celebrate my daughter finishing her studies at California State University, Fresno. We hosted a small group of her friends for dinner. I ordered the salmon for dinner. Other guests ordered different entrees which were all good. When I received my meal, the salmon was over cooked. It was actually burned. Initially I thought that I ordered blackened salmon. I sent it back and it was replaced with a perfectly cooked salmon dish. It was great. For dessert we each ordered a different kind of cheesecake. I chose fresh strawberries on cheesecake. It was tasty and delicious. Everyone loved their desserts. The best thing about this restaurant is that they care about you as a customer. They will try to make you happy when you come to the restaurant as a guest. It is a wonderful place to celebrate and enjoy a special evening.

I met a friend here the other night for a late dinner. We decided to sit on the high tables near the bar area. I ordered the Thai Lettuce Wraps, and they did not disappoint! The vegetables were crispy and fresh. The chicken was served hot and very flavorful. There are sauces that accompany the dish that go on top of the chicken, and they are incredibly delicious! I will definitely come back here! It is a busy, loud place as it is adjacent to the Fashion Fair Mall.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory on several occasions but today I decided to give my review. Overall it is a timely meal service. I would advise you not to come here hungry. Come here with a few friends that you want to catch up with. Order a few drinks and try and get lost in the moment because your food isn&#39;t coming anytime soon. I came to have a late lunch with a friend of mine and this was the case. <br>I was not promptly greeted at the table and I was feeling a bit perturbed about that. My friend finally met me there when the waitress decided to ask me if I wanted anything. But never mind that let&#39;s speak on the food.<br><br>I die for spinach avocado dip. So when I saw on the menu they had crab and spinach dip I thought how bad could this be - its the best of both worlds, right? Wrong. The dip tasted more like a seafood dip with cheese. The crab tasted &#34;fishy &#34; not like fresh crab taste. I don&#39;t know if they mixed in the crab juice or added some shrimp, it just didn&#39;t taste right. All night I&#39;ve been praying and hoping that I don&#39;t run into tummy problems later. <br><br>My friend ordered hamburger sliders and the cheese triangles which is a play on the mozzarella sticks. The sliders were very good. The mozzarella triangles were really unique and tasty. My happy hour drink was the Cosmo which was very tasty overall it was a nice time but it was nice because I had great company. Had my girlfriend been a no show, I would have been very up set. If not I would have realized Hey speak to management about this?

This review is more on the drinks then it is the food (which tasted great) so short story, a group of us go in for a birthday dinner, we end up buying 4 rounds 8 shots of patron, i figured they would be semi pricey, but holy crap, 15 dollars per chilled shots? 3 dollars more then just regular shots, which btw were not even shots at all, im so disappointed in your pricing, please give the right amount of liquor, if you&#39;re  going to mark it up so high, ill always come back for the food, but the drinks on the other hand...you&#39;re better off going next door to the competition.

I have always been a fan of the Cheesecake I could always depend on the consistency of their dishes<br><br>I am not sure what has happened at the Fresno location but they cannot seem to manage the consistency of certain dishes, and when brought to their attention can&#39;t seem to rectify it. Example are their normally fabulous Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I love these, and have always look forward to Sunday brunch for years just to order them. I keep trying but unfortunately I and my friends have given up at this location. The manager can&#39;t seem to control it. I have been told by waiters that the kitchen is inconsistent on this and certain other items on the menu and get many complaints. I have kept going back in hopes they can get it straight but without   success. Come on guys it&#39;s not a complicated  recipe !!!!
Best waiter we have had !! He took his time to listen and came enough times to the table to make sure we had everything we needed. I wish we remembered his name. Service was great

the food here is always good. i love the cheesecake factory and always find it so consistently delicious.
