HOWEVER, i do find that the desserts at the location, specifically, are insanely sweet... to the point they are impossible to eat more than a few bites of. i don&#39;t know if the actual cakes are made in-house and how much control they have over that, but i do suppose that the whipped cream is? and that is also just way, way, way too sweet.<br>service is also a little lacking... but it just kind of seems like they are under staffed.<br>and one last complaint... i just really don&#39;t like when things aren&#39;t the same everytime at a place like this, and I have gotten the same salad three different times and it has been plated differently, each time a different size with different ingredients. to me, that is not okay. only kind of letting it slide because it&#39;s been yummy every time... just would like it see it the same!<br>my personal recommendations are the stuffed mushrooms, and of course the chicken madeira, and the chicken marsala (sub mashed potatoes for pasta.) i don&#39;t know what they do to those mashed potatoes but they are certainly heaven...<br>pass on the potato bite things, and the fried mac and cheese. too heavy, not that great tasting. the egg roll sampler is okay, but i think next time ill just get full orders of the ones i actually liked, the chicken and the salmon.

Food was Not good at all today my husband &amp; I always stop here all the time but however today we decide to stop by for a early dinner and he order the fillet mignon but which  taste like it a cheap Chuck stake instead of a fillet mignon I however order a basil marinara chicken penne pasta which taste so disgusting I guess this will be our last time over there now. Take a close look at the SUPER THIN SLICE OF MY CHICKEN BREAST. HOW CHESP CAN THEY BE? SERIOUSLY? So upset we both did not enjoy our dinner.

Too expensive for the atmosphere. It was date night, so no kids. We got seated next to a table inches from us. Trying to block out other people&#39;s conversations is really hard when they are literally a foot away. Plus our table was so small. <br>We spent $100 on just the two of us and that&#39;s including the tip. We had an appetizer, 2 alcoholic drinks each, 2 entrées and 1 cheesecake. <br>The worst part was when they started putting out the discounted menus &#34;happy hour&#34; right after we paid. If we had knew about that, we would have waited 30 minutes to get the discount. It was half price beers and appetizers. That would of cut our bill drastically. <br>The food was pretty good. My steak was cooked perfectly. The bread they give you before your meal was excellent. If I decide to come back here it will be during happy hour.

We got a gift card for this place as a wedding gift. It was so nice to have a date night as newlyweds. It was sometime in the fall and we ate outside. They had standing heaters so the temperature was perfect. Warm and chilly all at the same time. We didn&#39;t do appetizers but they looked amazing. I ordered an Alfredo pasta and my husband had the peanut Thai pasta. My pasta was steaming hot and so creamy. It was everything I was craving! My husband&#39;s pasta (I had to snag a bite!) Was so different and delicious! I&#39;m definitely set on ordering that dish the next ti.e around. Sadly, we didn&#39;t have the cheesecake this go round but they have them displayed at the counter when you walk in. They&#39;re glorious! But about 7.50 a pop and I wasn&#39;t in the mood to splurge. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The place was clean and had a great vibe. I&#39;ll definitely be back!
Waited 30 min for Water and never got my coffee or<br>Cheesecake. Had to walk out.<br>Terrible service

I came here twice in one weekend, so will review both experiences. I came into town for a big women&#39;s motorcycle weekend earlier this month and was meeting an old colleague I had not seen in years there after I rode into town and was staying at hotel a few blocks away. We met for lunch. We were seated quickly. Since she picked me up, I indulged in a refreshing pina colada. I may have had two..they were good. I was not super hungry, so ordered the Thai lettuce wraps. I was very impressed at the presentation. Fresh, vibrant ingredients to assemble the wraps. It had chicken satay pieces, carrots, noodles, sprouts and a few other things I forgot. Also came with three sauces..one was a peanut sauce..and two chili sauces..everything was flavorful. I ate some and packed up the rest which became a late night snack in my hotel room!<br><br>Two days later after alot of motorcycle riding, I decided I would have brunch before I started the long ride home. It was a Sunday around noon. I was on my motorcycle and had to circle around the parking area a few times. They rope off a large section of parking in front of the restaurant next door to offer valet service. That was a bit annoying. I lucked out as someone pulled out of a spot in back! I decided to just sit in the high tables in the bar rather than wait for a regular table. It is open seating in bar. I had my motorcycle gear and helmet so was nice to get a table with extra chairs. <br><br>I decided on the fried chicken and waffles. So glad I did! Delicious from start to finish. It was chicken tenders, perfectly battered..light and crispy and tender meat. The small waffle sections were perfectly light and had a little crisp to them as well. The home fry potatoes, which I usually hate at every restaurant that comes with a breakfast were GREAT. Just what I like. These were smaller bits of potato..I am not sure how they prepare them but was almost like they twice fried them...they were not greasy..but all perfectly crunchy and crispy. The dish came with maple butter to pour over the waffles...YUM! I am glad I do not live that close..I would be there every weekend and quickly weigh 400lbs eating that every weekend! I ordered a virgin pina colada..I loved it the day before, but this time I was riding and left out the alcohol. Perfect with the dish...love from start to finish!!

Be careful what you wish for, it might come is seconds. My boyfriend was being a bit rude saying &#34;where is my food..!&#34; And as I was telling him not to say that the server comes quickly and served us. <br>... we did not even finish our food... hahaha...

Definitely had better, nothing special... at least they got the deserts right.<br><br>Passed this place up many times, was in the mood to try a new restaurant and my expectations were high since I am a fanatic of cheesecake deserts. Little did I know I was going to get mediocre food.<br><br>Complained to the manager for the bad service and the appetizer crab dip was horrible. He didn&#39;t care to hear what I had to say just nod this head and repeated, &#34;okay&#34; with a straight face multiple times.<br><br>Will not return to eat anytime soon, at least they didn&#39;t mess up on the desert which was good. Other than that I&#39;ll pass.<br><br>Rate this place 2.5

Really disappointed! Placed an order to go, I ordered a total of 5 slices of dessert which was a total of $44.70. They quickly got my order together. I asked &#34;is this everything&#34; I was reassured my order was all there and than asked if I needed utensils/napkins. I said yes and left. I drive home which is about 20/25 mins away and once my family is ready to sit down and enjoy our desserts together, we realize my husbands cheesecake is missing! Very annoying and inconvenient. Please check your orders before you leave!

We were visiting family for a graduation and ate lunch there the day after we arrived.  I had the chicken tacos, my brother in law had the fish tacos.  Several hours later, I started to pay dearly for it.  Shortly afterwards my brother-in-law vomited as well.  5 others did not get sick.  Since I had only seen them for 1 hour before lunch it couldn&#39;t have been a virus and Cheesecake Factory was the only place we both ate it was clear to me it was food poisoning.   My husband had planned 2 new nights at a romantic chateaux.  All was ruined!  No romance this trip other than the time I shared with the porcelain god.  Would not recommend.....

Believe it or not it was our first time eating here.  Believe me I will be back.  We had a party of eight and an infant, walk in no reservation.  The hostess lady was super sweet in accommodating us (wish I got her name).  Early dinner rush and was seated within 20 mins.  Our server Patrick was super helpful and patient being there was so many of us (3 adults + 3 teenagers + 2 littlest and don&#39;t forget the baby!). Superb service !!  But when tried to tell the Asian floor manager what a good job he was doing he was very curt, and seemed to be trying to rush us off by asking if we were having dessert (which Patrick already took of).  4 people had salmon (a salad, a plate, &amp; 2 kids salmon) nobody was disappointed!!  I had the crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp with brown rice.  Delicious! Could&#39;ve had a little more sauce but all in all it was good..  <br>we were kinda celebrating my little ones b day, they brought sundaes with candles and sang to the both of them. Of course we finished up with cheesecake somebody had hazelnut I had the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake..  man oh man I&#39;m thinking next time just stop for the dessert alone!! $8 for a huge slice can&#39;t go wrong ...  thanks Patrick !!!!!

The food had great flavor and the menu has so many options you probably need 15 minutes to go through it which can get a bit overwhelming. They bring put bread and butter for appetizers, which saves you time going through their appetizer selection. The cheesecakes are ok. I ordered the red velvet, birthday,  and oreo. All were overly sweet. Next time I&#39;ll just order the classic. Good food. A bit overpriced.

I&#39;ve been a fan of Cheesecake Factory since my first bite.  This particular branch has not been an exception.<br><br>On our first visit, we dropped by for a late lunch which turned out to be an early dinner cause we stuffed ourselves.  Was the perfect time to go because there was no wait and plenty of tables available.  I ordered the Vegetable pizza with goat cheese, and it tasted terrific. The roasted vegetable pizza included roasted eggplant, red &amp; yellow peppers, grilled onions, artichokes, kalamata olives, tomato, mozarella, and I requested goat cheese.  Again, I say that it was terrific!!  Just fabulous!  Too bad it is no longer on their menu!!   Argh!!!!!<br><br>My better half ordered the Pasta Carbonara w/chicken, and she said that it was delicious as well.  We both had plenty of leftovers to enjoy for two more meals! <br><br>On another visit I ordered their Chile Relleno burger because they no longer had my favorite Monterey burger!!  That Chile Relleno burger was almost as good as the Monterey, but not quite!  Found out on my latest visit that they no longer make the Chile Relleno burger!!!  Argh!!!!!!!  What is going on!!!<br><br>So, for the most recent visit I had to try something different because of the fact they no longer make my favorite entrees anymore.  My choice was called &#34;The Everything Pizza&#34;.  Well, it was everything except nowhere close to being as good as their Vegetable Pizza with goat cheese from days gone by.  Oh well.<br><br>My wife discovered a new favorite for herself.  She had a new menu item which was their Chicken Katsu!  It was the best that she has ever had.  I took one bite, and I would have to agree that it was very very good!!  Better than any other restaurant we have been to.  Hard to believe we had it in a Cheesecake Factory restaurant.<br><br>Of course,  I always save room for cheesecake!!  Their cheesecakes may be too rich and sweet for many people, but that does not bother me one bit.  Yes, i must admit that I am a major sweet tooth!  Almost every cheesecake that I have tried at Cheesecake Factory has been yummy. but very expensive.  Most range from $7.50 to $7.95 a slice.<br><br>Some of my favorites cheesecakes here are the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle, Fresh Banana Cream,  White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia,  and the Caramel Pecan Turtle cheesecakes! <br><br>Note that parking is a problem during peak hours so we try to avoid that time.<br><br>Service has always been terrific.  Cleanliness is not an issue.<br><br>My only issue with any Cheesecake Factory branch is that they keep deleting my favorite entrees from their menus!!!!

Thank you Courtney for your great service today. After a long day of business meetings I was really tired and cane cheesecake factory to eat. Instead my day got better because Courtney smiled was very pleasant and cheerful and that&#39;s all I needed.  Thanks again.

Never again!  Got 2 pieces of cheesecake to go. $17 before a tip. Get it home and the whip cream on both was rancid. Scraped it off trying salvage what was left and was pretty bad. Ate two bites and done. Bits of coconut was like nibbling on balsa wood. Over priced,  over glorified, and just bad. Walmart has better cheesecake.

If I could give less than a star, I would. I went to Cheesecake on Sunday for my friends bday and I was utterly disappointed. Not only did it take forever to get our food (tables surrounding us were served before we were), when the food arrived it was made wrong. I asked for no bacon on my sandwich so my server went to take it back and remake it. She didn&#39;t come back until my friend had practically eaten her whole meal. By then I had to ask to get it to go. I have never waited that long for food to be remade. I took the sandwich to go but by the time I ate it, the bread was already soggy. The server took so long to do everything and it ruined my friends birthday lunch. I don&#39;t plan on returning here, nor do I recommend it to anyone. After being there for 2 and 1/2 hours, we were over it.

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory numerous times (not necessarily this location.) I highly recommend the avocado egg rolls, they are a must try if it&#39;s your first or even your 50th visit. I have had chicken sandwiches, a burrito, BBQ chicken salad, chicken Madeira, chicken Marsala, pizza and burgers here. Tonight I decided to try the Jamaican chicken entree. It was soooo full of flavor and wonderful spices. After eating a few avocado egg rolls and about 3/4 of my entree, I knew I couldn&#39;t possibly have room to eat cheesecake but c&#39;mon, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s almost blasphemy to eat there and not have cheesecake. So I ordered a lemon raspberry one to go. Can&#39;t home and had 2 bites of it and it was also just as heavenly as I imagined.  I have always had great experiences here and it will continue to be my favorite place to eat. My only annoyance was waiting nearly 1 hour and 20 min to be seated. But it&#39;s to be expected when you arrive at 6:30 on a Saturday night.

Today was supposed to be an enjoyable holiday meal with my department from work at this establishment. Sadly, it was a very disappointing visit. My department decided to have our holiday department luncheon with a large party of 15 on a time limit. I decided to order the skinny chicken pot pie. When it arrived, there were only two tiny pieces of chicken in that whole platter full of gravy.  I called the waitress over to inform and show her my plate and asked if they could at least put a few more pieces of chicken. The waitress returned from the kitchen and said the chef told her there was enough chicken and returned my plate to me (nothing was added).  I then asked for a different item but that wasn&#39;t any better because it took extra long for it to come out. By the time it came out,  my team was finishing eating their dessert so I asked for the plate to go.  My team was already eating dessert at this point so I asked the waitress if they could at least throw in a piece of cheesecake since they took so long to bring out the new plate and for the fact that I didn&#39;t get to enjoy my meal with my team. The manager came back and said no, he would not offer a free piece of cheesecake.  <br>Now, normally I wouldn&#39;t mind being told no but this manager was very rude and spoke to me in an angry tone. The Cheesecake Factory is not cheaply priced and you would expect more from a reputable place to recitify a failure on their part to provide decent service even if just a simple apology. <br>I&#39;ve had many years in customer service management and know how management should conduct themselves in business. This was very unprofessional and any manager who speaks to their customers in this tone should not be a manager. I will be contacting corporate office and anyone else I need to to let them know just how poorly Garry Choi conducted himself. Myself, my family and my coworkers will no longer be taking any business back to this Cheesecake Factory. They did not take the meal off the tag because &#34;I was given food.&#34; Too many other great places in Fresno to take our business to.

Service is great. Food is excellent. Beautiful atmosphere and the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake is BOMB. <br><br>I got the Farfalle Chicken and Roasted Garlic pasta dish that came with a garlic, parmesan cream sauce (kinda like alfredo) and bow-tie pasta and it was SO good. <br><br>Love this place! Will definitely be back!
Great food, friendly service, expensive, and huge menu.<br>Finally found a cheesecake that was  not good Key Lime (should remove a star) lol

This review is only for their waiters. My wife and I just left and we had a fantastic waiter! Didn&#39;t get her name down but she was a blonde. Great service. As soon as I finished a beer she kindly asked if I would like another. I didn&#39;t have to ask or wait on anyone. Great service!!!!

The food is great quality and the prices are definitely reasonable. The cheesecake is amazing! Oh, and did I say the food tastes DELICIOUS?! The minute you walk in, you&#39;ll probably think &#34;crap my receipt is going to be $200-$509&#34; because of how fancy it looks. For two people, I spend about $50 including the cheesecake. Definitely a win win!

This place is alright. This place is pretty big, so the waiting time to be seated is short. Having said that, the parking space is not very good; but then again this is at the mall area, so it&#39;s understandable that the number of parking space is not convenient.<br><br>Their service is good. There&#39;s nothing really to complain about. I&#39;ve been here a couple times, and their service have been great.<br><br>This time i had Spicy Chicken Chipotle. I loved it! It didnt taste spicy at all (i will order it extra spicy next time). I didnt finish it, so i boxed my left-over, and ate it the next day. I&#39;ve gotta say that it tasted so much better on the next day. Haha. I loved it even more... i just wish it was spicy as I expected it to be.
I love this place bread is always warm best cheesecake in fresno always good service friendly atmosphere always recommend this place

I am a true fan of The Cheesecake Factory as the food is consistently good every time I visit. My husband and I visited this location and was extremely disappointed. The music was so loud the patrons were forced to practically shout to have a conversation.  Needless to say, it was not the relaxing experience we typically encounter at a restaurant of this magnitude. I expect a robust atmosphere at the gym but not somewhere I choose to dine and have a few drinks. <br><br>Good food, good service but Please turn down the music a few decibels!!

Came here for the half price cheesecake but ended up ordering an appetizer, as well. We got the Thai Chicken Lettuce wraps and ironically the chicken was my least favorite part. The menu listed &#34;grilled chicken&#34; but the grill marks were so black and deep that the chicken just tasted dry and burnt. All the rest of the ingredients were delicious, though, and so were the sauces. I made a wrap of just the cabbage and pickled cucumber (and sauce) and it was soooooo good! Maybe next time I should just nix the chicken LOL. Now onto the cheesecake...<br><br>My personal favorite is the 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake Cheesecake but I decided to try something different this time. I tried the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle and it was delicious! Perfect balance of cheesecake, white chocolate and raspberry flavor. Delightful and refreshing on a 100+ degree day! My husband got the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake and it was good but a little too rich. I don&#39;t like the taste of fake peanut butter that they use in other peanut butter cups but this was made with the real stuff. The rich peanut butter flavor was nicely balanced with the cheesecake but it was overwhelming after a few bites. I also tried the Snicker&#39;s Bar Chunks and Cheesecake which is basically their regular cheesecake with chopped up Snicker&#39;s on top. It was delicious and paired nicely with the cheesecake without overwhelming it. <br><br>The sour note to my visit was the restrooms. The toilet paper was falling out of the holder in multiple stalls as someone didn&#39;t shut the doors properly after refilling them. The wood on the vanity was all scratched up and the trap door was open, exposing the pipes. For such a nice looking restaurant to have such an unkempt restroom was a shock. I was hesitant to use the toilet paper as it had obviously been dropped on the floor multiple times but the roll on the holder bar was at a funny angle as the door wasn&#39;t properly closed which rendered it completely unusable. So I had no other choice. I&#39;ll definitely be getting takeout next time.

Normally the food and service has always been good here however last night was pretty rough. Ordered the filet and it was one of the worst steaks I have ever had in my life. Absolutely no flavor at all it was if it went straight from the fridge to the grill without any salt or pepper. It was the kind of steak that you would expect if Denny&#39;s cooked it. If it weren&#39;t for the fact that I had to wait 45 minutes just to get my meal and I had been drinking I wouldn&#39;t of bothered choking it down.
Love it!!!!! Love the atmosphere .. Love the food ... Love the service! <br>But I wouldn&#39;t recommend the lunch menus...  For dessert, the strawberry cheese cake is a MUST!!! OH~ I crave it now~~~
This is always the choice of restaurant when we can&#39;t decide where to go lol I love their brown bread before meals and ofcourse they&#39;re food too

Cheesecake Factory review:<br>I really had high hopes dining at this nice restaurant. <br>I Came with my family for the first time for my friend 20th birthday. We wanted to go somewhere pleasant, looking for great Food with wonderful customer service. Unfortunately we encountered a variety of issues that contributed to our unpleasant dinner that made everyone very displeased and upset at One point. To keep it simple and to the point the issues we experienced was the following 1. Dirty silverware 2 sets. 2.Unknow floating objects in my water black in color. 3 tons of flys. 4. When asked the waitress does the burrito have onions inside?, answer-no, burrito had grilled onions!, dish was returned. 5 Manager who we addressed about concerns, Garret was very dismissive to all of us along with some smart*** comments &#34;so nothing was good I can&#39;t believe that&#34; really last I checked I&#39;m the paying customer with very valid concerns and for my family &amp; friends to have the manager NOT TO APOLOGIZE FOR ANYTHING and to turn his back and walk away. Ok I&#39;ll make sure that I&#39;ll never come back  Not to make threats but to express the total out rage we felt &amp; encountered at this restaurant I will share my story and hope that you can found this useful &amp; prevent it from happening to you.

This place was crowded on a Sunday night! Our group wanted to make a reservation but found out that they don&#39;t do that here. I had the Pumpkin Pecan cheesecake and OMG the crust was amazing. It was pumpkin flavored and the pecans on the bottom was perfect. The pumpkin had an excellent creamyness with a hint of spice. There were rye, sourdough, and white bread served at the table with butter. The rye was everyone&#39;s favorite pick. I had the Shrimp Garlic noodles. To be honest, there were very little taste and smell of garlic. Some of the shrimp still had partial shells on it. It&#39;s spaghettini with asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, and parmesan with garlic sauce. The food was expensive, presentation was nice, but for the amount I was paying, I was expecting better flavor. I would only come here for the cheesecake.

I haven&#39;t been here for awhile and I thought to myself why not stop by again and get great service from Craig. Unfortunately Craig is no longer working there and I heard he&#39;s moving up the ranks in the restaurant business to become a manager. I usually dine at the bar because they give you better, faster service than regular sitting at the table. Anyways on to tonight service and food I ordered the following:<br><br>Arnold Palmer 3/5 it was ok nothing stood out.<br><br>Egg Roll Sampler 2/5 each varieties of egg rolls sucks each has different flavor and I wasn&#39;t too impressed I took each bite and told the server to take it away.<br><br>Green Salad with croutons &amp; honey mustard dressing 2/5 the croutons weren&#39;t crunchy and lack of flavor on the honey mustard dressing.<br><br>Smokehouse BBQ burger with American Kobe Beef patty 3/5 for a $17 dollar burger normally I can finish a whole burger but even with the thick cut bacon and BBQ sauce and fried onion strings the flavor was plain and not worth the $17<br><br>Server 2/5 yes service was good but my server complained about working weekends and complained about her hours I&#39;m like at least you have a job.<br><br>I haven&#39;t been here for awhile and I&#39;m not missing much. Their food was ok nothing special and nothing stood out. I wished Ruth Chris would open later on the weekends because their prime burger is the best burger in town. Service was kinda annoying tonight hearing your server complaining about work and etc... Anyways I won&#39;t be back to Cheesecake Factory anytime soon other restaurant can do better than this. Congrats Craig.

Came for a casual valentine&#39;s day dinner. As we ordered we got our bread. But only one small piece. (Weird) took a while for our food to arrive so it would have been nice to get more bread as i waited. But my waitress didn&#39;t come by.... so no bread for me I guess.  Just an empty bread basket <br><br>Food finally came. It was barley warm as if it had been sitting there a while.   Our dishes were served 5min apart instead of together. <br>Would I consider coming again? Yes.... but only if it&#39;s my only option.

I enjoyed the small plate options, but the noise and mall parking are always an issue with my husband and myself. We live up the hill though and for holidays shopping, it&#39;s a nice place to stop in for a quick bite. Very big, love the variety in the menu and bakery. Cocktails are weak, good wine options.

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been here because I avoid chain restaurants but it was one of the few places open on a Sunday night late so we landed there.  I was glad to see they have trimmed the menu slightly, although disappointed that the prices have raised substantially since I last ate here.  I can&#39;t give an in depth review but I can comment on what I did get.  First, order your soup by the cup instead of the bowl because they are about the same size and the price is $2 more for the bowl.  I had a cream of chicken soup which was bland and flavorless.  I added a lot of salt and pepper but it didn&#39;t help.  It was basically a thin white sauce with some vegetables and chicken thrown in, very disappointing.  However, the chopped salad was a delight.  It was sweet (corn and the balsamic dressing), bitter (blue cheese), salty (bacon), crunchy (fresh Romaine) and soft (avocado) all at once.  I would return just for that.  My son was equally happy with his miso salmon, cooked to perfection on a bed of rice with a miso sauce.  I have to admit I don&#39;t care for the cheesecake here (of all things!) but we had a chocolate mousse cake that was devilishly good with their real whip cream.

Me and my boyfriend went here for our first time after shopping at the mall. I had heard good things about it from friends and family, so I decided to check it out. We walked in around dinner time and were seated immediately. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. My boyfriend had asked her opinion between two dishes and she was very knowledgeable.<br><br>We ordered the nachos for an appetizer and OMG there was so much! It could be a whole meal itself for 1 person! and they were delicious! Chips were fresh and crispy, and all the toppings were fresh as well.<br><br>I had ordered the fettuccine alfredo for myself and my boyfriend got the Louisiana chicken pasta. Let&#39;s just say weren&#39;t expecting the portions to be so big! We were only able to finish half our plates so we got the rest to go, so I think you get what you pay for.<br><br>In the end we had a very pleasant time there and will definitely be going back again!

The Cheesecake Factory is always a reliably good in terms of food and service. Since I only come into town for work I like these ease of having a quick meal at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and quick. The chopped salad that I had was also delicious.

Mediocre, overpriced food with small portions.  Rude, entitled staff.  Horrible parking situation with few spots.  <br><br>Boycott this place as much as possible.  There are so many better places in town to eat, like any place else.

Love this place. Amazing food and atmosphere. Beautiful restaurant and great friendly staff. Love their chicken bang bang with shrimp. Very pricey but very worth it. Only go here for special occasion.

Went to cheese cake factory in Fresno today and found a dead fly in my cheese cake, asked for a manager and all he says to me is oh would u like a new one. And I tell him no I lost my appetite and he says ok I&#39;ll take it off and I told him I&#39;m not eating the other one cus they are all kept in the same refrigerator and he say well there&#39;s nothing wrong with the other one so u have to pay for it. And never once apologized. So to all of u who love cheese cake factory double check your food cus u just might find something dead in it. #Fresno #fresnoca #fresnocheesecakefactory #cheesecake #cheesecakefactory #snickers #oreo #cake #fly #deadfly #dead #foodporn #foodfail #management #nastyfood #food #desert #sweets #cheesecakes #cheesecakelover #cheeselover #cheesecakefactory

If only there was a zero star that is exactly how I would rate this vile restaurant. <br>Not only was Miss Lakyn a horrible waitress, I asked for the manager twice and instead of speaking directly to me he/she sent Miss Lakyn as our messenger. I am EXTREMELY dissatisfied. Although this dinner ruined my uncle&#39;s first experience, he still offered a tip and she was still unappreciative. <br><br>BOTTOM LINE: Horrible customer service

September 14, 2016- <br><br>This had been my very first experience with The Cheesecake Factory, and I can say it was absolutley EXCELLENT! <br><br>The waitress we had, for our last mintue 25 people party was absolutley amazing. Not only were they able to fit us all outside, they were more than happy to assist to our every demands. <br><br>Brittany M. our waitress had exceeded our expectations again and again. Being very poilet and attentive to our every need and complaint.<br><br>The food portion was large and exquiste. The wait period was long as expected for a 25 people party and other guest, but not as long as other resturants.

The first time we came here is for a birthday party for my friend. Everything was fine and we were happy to enjoy the food and the drinks. Even though we didn&#39;t try as much food and having an appetite. Recommend this location

As always the food was very good. I got the chicken parm &#34;pizza style&#34;. They bring you and nice size portion of a round flattened chicken covered in cheese and pasta. The reason I gave it four stars is because the food took awhile to get to us and it wasn&#39;t all that busy. People that had gotten their after us got their food before us.  For desert you can&#39;t go wrong with a slice of cheesecake. Left feeling very full and satisfied.

matthew takemoto thank you for the amazing and efficient customer service you did your job exceeding expectations thank you for making me feel relaxed amd super speedy service thank you again amazing service

Zero stars if I could. Food was bad service was worse and the real issue. After being ignored when trying to get a servers attention. When she noticed I was calling for her attention she continued to ignore us. The problem was a bug in our beer. Our booth was dirty, crumbs piser webs etc. If your ok with spending $50+ on a below average dinner this is your place.

If you like heavy desserts this place rates a 4.<br><br>If you&#39;re wanting a meal it&#39;s a 3 or 3 1/2.<br><br>Their small asparagus salad is great however avoid the chicken coated with pretzels as it&#39;s terribly dry with inferior chicken on a stick.<br><br>Service is good.<br><br>Want a house scotch on the rocks? Yes, they have it at $9.25 an unreal ripoff price.<br><br>All in all not a bad place.

Let me just start by saying I don&#39;t usually have a problem with cheesecake factory, but tonight was awful. My husband and I both ordered steak dishes which both came with mashed potatoes and mine also came with shrimp. After already waiting a while for the food because it was packed, our plates came out and both our mashed potatoes were cold. Like completely cold, not warm at all. My steak was also cold. The only warm thing on my plate was the shrimp. My husband&#39;s steak was warm and ok, but again, his potatoes were cold. So obviously this was a kitchen issue and not a waiter issue. I called the manager over and told him that our food was cold. He immediately apologized and said he would fix it. My husband&#39;s plate must have just been completely reheated since his steak was no longer medium rare and was chewy after that. On my plate they must have just scooped off the mashed potatoes and replaced them with new ones because the potatoes were hot but my steak was still cold and exactly the same as it was before. I told the waitress and let her know that I wouldn&#39;t be sending it back again since I was hungry and didn&#39;t want to wait yet again. She apologized and said her manager told her we could have a free slice of cheesecake. My son was jumping up and down at the idea of cake so I said ok whatever, sure. They must have wanted us out of there because they brought it in a to-go container. There was no way my son was going to wait until we got home, so I let the waitress know that we would be eating it there and needed spoons. We finished and left without ever seeing the manager again. Extremely disappointing.<br><br>***update: I did as cheesecake factory instructed me to do the day they posted their comment and still have not heard anything from them 18 days later***
Eaten here maybe twice ordered to go at least three times. 1/5 times everything was great. 2/5 service was ok. Other times It legit took me near 45 minutes to pick up two slices of cheese cake.

Honestly we eat here religiously and after our experience today, I can say that will be no longer a thing. We were told the wait would be 20 minutes for a booth, we watched parties of 3-4 come in after us and be sat before us... after 30 minutes of waiting I was told they seat people who have bigger parties than us.. when I asked how much longer they kept saying we were next.. and then continued to seat more parties. Our waitress was nice, but honestly the whole experience was ruined by how we were treated at the front. Maybe retrain your hostesses or find a better system - seems pretty ridiculous to me for a classier Applebees.

Good cheesecake. But I don&#39;t really know what their definition of curb side pickup is. We ordered 25 minutes ahead and by the time we arrived at the curb side, we called them up that we are at the curb side. After 20mins , we have noticed no one brought our orders and everyone at the curb side waiting started getting out of the car to get their order. So I joined the bandwagon and went inside myself. Of course there were 2 people that I followed ahead of me that just walked in and ordered cheesecake and they got their orders right away. Then it&#39;s my turn, and to my surprise my order was not even ready and they just started working on it. Next time, don&#39;t brag with curbside pickup if you guys don&#39;t have the services to do so. It&#39;s misleading bullshit and wasting our time. To the management, take note!

I usually love this place, and I visit often.  However  this particular visit was less than appetizing when a cockroach scurried on the booth we were sitting on. We tried to smash it to show the waiter, but it took us by surprise and it hid between the cushions.  I was thoroughly disgusted!

Came here on 1/14/17 30 minutes before closing with a party of 15. They accommodated us and the waitress was so nice. We totally thought she was going to have &#34;attitude &#34; because it was so close to closing time. Complete opposite reaction from all of the staff. They even made more bread for us!! The food was hot and absolutely delicious. Thank you you Lilly you were AMAZING.

I love their diverse menu and like to order through CakePay to pick up my order at the curb side pick up. It&#39;s usually fast and convenient. However, today I was on hold for 5 minutes and when someone was finally available to take my order he got it wrong and put me on hold again. After 10 plus minutes my order was placed. This was during a workday and I didn&#39;t have a lot of time to spare.

I come here often! I&#39;ve gotten great service every time! I love to come during lunch or happy hour. Their lunch specials are great! I love ordering the half salads. Its a big portion size and the quality is great. I would rather pay $12/$13 dollars for their lunch salads than going other places where the salads are just minimal (iceberg, chicken, and dressing) and close in price. I rotate between the Santa Fe and BBQ chicken salad (dressing on the side) love the happy hour as well!

Don&#39;t bother coming here if you&#39;re​ looking for vegetarian options. If you tell them your looking for something vegetarian they will serve you stuffed mushrooms SMOTHERED IN BACON! They changed their menu recently and completely got rid of the yummie​ veggie melt and vegetable sampler.<br><br>Two stars only because of the great cheesecakes.

Service was decent and very timely. The only downfall of the whole night was the 12&#34; hair my girlfriend pulled out of her pasta. They have very good menu options but definitely need to pay more attention to detail.

This review is solely based on the happy hour and happy hour food- <br><br>AMAZING.<br><br>I mean that happy hour burger though!!! Like really? Damn that&#39;s good. They make the meat in house and it literally melts in your mouth along with the artisan bread they use. This and a side of fries with their aioli and you are set for a measly $7 during HH. Service is always good, never really like amazing but I would say consistently just good. Which is a plus.

Enjoy this going here. I love their food; especially the lettuce wrap and calamari.  I love the environment &amp; Patio seating. Their menu is loaded and I had their Georgia peach drink from the bar and its amazing. Def recommended!

Worste experience I&#39;ve had there by far. I normally love this place but after yesterday, I can honestly say that I won&#39;t be returning. Now the whole situation was not as serious as it turned out to be. Backstory..I don&#39;t like anything that&#39;s on the pasta portion of the menu, as I eat very plainly. They happen to have a butter and parm plate, however only on the kids menu. I HAVE ASKED BEFORE if there is an equivalent to that on the adult menu. I was told that there was not, but they would go ahead and get me what I wanted to eat regardless and it wasn&#39;t a big deal. So from then on, that&#39;s all I order. And I mean countless times. Now yesterday when I went, i asked, just like I always do, if they could bring me the kids menu, and the HOSTESS, looked a little confused and told me &#34;um I can see&#34; and walks away. Shortly, she does return with it, only to tell me &#34;just so you know, it&#39;s only for ages 10 and under&#34; before handing it to me and leaving before I respond. The waiter comes to take our orders, and I tell him that I normally get the butter and parm plate from the kids menu, unless you guys now have it on the adults. He told me, &#34;no unfortunately they still don&#39;t, but the manager has been informed and he says you will have to order something else.&#34; At this point, it&#39;s just gotten a little ridiculous because he&#39;s standing there trying to take the order but looking impatient because I&#39;ve literally gotten the SAME thing for years. Now I understand that there are polices in place for a reason, however maybe all employees should be on the same page and actually ALL enforce them so we aren&#39;t all sitting there looking stupid. And the manager didn&#39;t even have the nerve to come address us himself. He told the waiter to let us know what he had said. It was just very embarrassing. And I just received a gift card to there that I have to sell now because I obviously won&#39;t be using it anymore. I just wish the manager handled the situation him/herself and that the workers there all followed protocol properly so minor things like this didn&#39;t have to be so absurd.

Very very friendly service . The lady we had was very happy (or she put on the best show) and it created a nice energy for the restaurant . Though we switched waiters to another nice tall guy who still had positive energy .The only thing I did not like was the two seaters table that make you sit by people . I could hear one side some ladies talking and then they both looked at me (I&#39;m hoping the we&#39;re complimenting my nice jacket ) haha.  On another side two people fighting about their relationship ... but I tried to focus in on my boyfriend . The customer service was excellent. The food was excellent ! Great option for vegan and people who like to eat breakfast for dinner lovers . Hi asked for a to go cup of my tea and the guy brought me a nice huge new one ! I was very flattered that he went ahead and gave me another fresh one to take home with me . Also , this nice lady helped me figure out which cheesecake was the best option for me , I think she held a nice convo for two minutes . We chuckled about the calories as well, 1000 calories for one piece ! WOW. Anyway , def recommend to everyone !!!! Go try it out , super friendly ! And excellent food .

Ate here for the first time yesterday and I will definitely be back soon. We had two servers because one of them went on break but both of them were amazing. I&#39;m not sure where to begin with the food, everything looked amazing on the menu and when we finally decided on our meal it came out in about 15 minutes even though it was pretty busy and having worked at a similar restaurant, I expected the food to be good but the portions to be small. We ended up getting huge portions of probably the best food I&#39;ve ever had and I was happy to enjoy more at home and STILL have left overs. Next time, we&#39;ll make sure to save room for dessert.

I have eaten here numerous times and usually I am not disappointed but unfortunately that day has come today I ordered a california cheese steak that looked nothing like the picture in the menu very deceiving it was much smaller when I received my food, didn&#39;t have much cheese or flavor didn&#39;t taste bad but their was hardly any flavor. Gordan Ramsey would not approve he would be appauled.

ridiculous price  considering the service was mediocre as well as the food. We made a &#34;reservation&#34; 5 hours prior to their dinner as recommended by a host for our large party, our table was given away. Spent $30 at the bar on two beers domestic and a app, went to dinner an hour later when a table opened and spent $75 on two pasta dinners and two cheesecakes. Just a little FYI
Way overpriced. Bartender was great but wow, not worth a lunch visit. Go to Panera instead

This restaurant is focused on profits, not people. We brought my sister, who is in a wheelchair here, and the staff did not accommodate our need for an appropriate place to sit for her. We were made to wait for about an hour before we finally were offered a table that was accessible for her. The manager lacked courage to make things right. Needless to say, we will not return to this establishment. Everyone has the right to feel welcome.

Bring a flash light it&#39;s dark and makes it hard to see or read the menu, food is always good staff  friendly and a huge variety mex, Asian , pizza and of course cheese cake in just about every flavor

This restaurant is fantastic. I have only been here one time as the price is higher than the mountains. But the food is excellent and service is superb. You certainly get what you pay for. Would recommend to anyone. One of those once a year restaurants.

Cheesecake Factory has a HUGE menu so if you don&#39;t know what your feeling like it may take you awhile to figure it out. Me and my husband came here for my birthday. We got there around 2:00 it wasn&#39;t busy and we got seated right away. Our waiter was amazing and got our order in quick, our food came out hot and delicious. I gave it 4 stars because the only Con I found was the set up of the restaurant was a little tight for my liking. We sat at the table that was chair and booth, our table was tiny (like our 2 plates and 2 drinks fit tight with no extra room) They were sitting new customers right next to us when there was open tables everywhere. I heard the conversation of the 2 ladies next to me more than I could hear my husband.
I love all the pasta here but a little pricey. Cheesecake is a obvious must! Great seating. Service wasn&#39;t the best, but still okay. Love the seating and inside of the restaurant.

This is the second night in a row that I&#39;ve sat at the bar, ordered appetizers and had to wait more than 30 minutes for my dish. Actually, I still never got the dish because I had to leave for work so who knows how long it would have actually taken. Both times I ordered appetizers and both times it&#39;s taken an extraordinary amount of time. I ordered these dishes simply for the fact that they&#39;re usual the fastest things made in the kitchen. Instead, both days I had to settle for chick-fil-a down the<br><br>Update to previous review. <br>I Went again tonight and service was back to the great service I&#39;ve come to expect from The Cheesecake Factory. Staff were nice and looked me in my eyes when speaking. The bread came out within minutes of placing my order and the dish came out shortly after. The waiter even remembered me and apologized for the previous visit.

Everything here is delicious. Nothing has disappointed so far. Service is friendly!<br><br>I gave 4 stars because I remember one incident that I thought was a bit stupid.<br><br>I remember when a waiter asked if there was an occasion, and we just said it was a friend&#39;s birthday. He brought out cheesecake at the end. We thought that was a nice gesture. Then he later asked who&#39;s tab to put it on. What?! <br><br>Usually when a place BRINGS something out for an occasion, it&#39;s free. If not, ASK us first. Give us the option. We weren&#39;t intending to get any cheesecake as we already bought a cake. Dumb. It just didn&#39;t look classy.  <br><br>BJ Brewbouse gives you a free birthday pazookie! :D
This restaurant really impressed me not only was the food delicious, but the service was incredible. The atmosphere was perfect and intimate. Great date night choice.

Cheesecake Factory. You go there &amp; expect great food, great service, and of course great cheesecake! Every time I go there I&#39;ve gotten all 3 of those things. If there is a long wait, I suggest opting for first available (inside or outside). They have heaters outside if it is cold. I honestly prefer outside when it is packed because it gets really loud inside. They give you bread to start out, which I love the brown bread they give you (it is similar to out backs brown bread). I have recently become addicted to the crispy crab wontons and have went back to just eat those (seriously). I usually order the hibachi steak &amp; it is great. I have also tried the steak Diane &amp; salmon combo and the steak Dianne and shrimp combo which are both good. Also save room for the cheesecake because you will probably be so full and only have room for one bite by the time dessert comes around.

One of my favorite places to come for pasta! I love the spicy chipotle pasta it is fantastic!! The roasted garlic with chicken is also very good. I have been here many times and usually always have good service and you can call ahead seating.

Warning!!!!!It&#39;s not what it use to be!!! This place has gone down hill in the past 3 years. A lot of the meanu classics are gone. I use to frequently vist the restaurant when it first opened.<br><br>The higher steps of service they use to have here are also gone. They have been replace with jaded under tipped servers . I feel there pain I also use to be a waitress . But treating people poorly is not going to help the situation. <br><br>In the past two years this has been third  time coming here. All three times have been a horrible experiences.  Unfortunately I will not be returning to this location. My money and my time I&#39;m much more valuable to me. BJ&#39;s on the other side of the parking lot is a better alternative. :)
The food was great today everything was fresh and just came out so quick today was a good day here
A great restaurant to go too if you want to take someone on a date or just a dinner! The food is great and great enviornment.

Not very busy on a Monday afternoon for lunch. Were greeted and sat down. Asked what to Drink,drinks on our table asap. Ordered. Food was on the table fast. Dessert too. Love the atmosphere. Love the decor. Waiter was friendly. Will be back when in Fresno.

I had a take out order with a little glitch that was resolved in the most courteous and professional way. The staff (Joe) and management (Brian) are TOP rate, especially Bryssa who&#39;s customer service skills are first class. Thank you so much for going beyond expectations! YOU MADE MY DAY!!!

Love this place! So many options to pick from and never disappointed. It&#39;s my go to favorite. Steak Diane and shrimp scampi combo is great! I also get the chicken sliders with fries. I don&#39;t highly recommend the fries, they get cold fast and taste terrible. I love the soup and salad so fresh! Orange chicken is really good too. Hit the happy hour for great deals on drinks and a small menu of items. The avocado rolls are my favorite appetizer. Get a cheese cake to go if your to full, it&#39;s worth the splurge.

Great food! No wait to be seated. Menu is huge so it took awhile to decide what to get. Luckily I&#39;ve eaten here before so I just went for the steak, mash with green beans with house salad. That&#39;s boxed because I was saving myself for the banana cream cheesecake. I am so full I feel I&#39;m probably going to need to be rolled out lol. Service was slow and my seat is dirty so I can&#39;t give 5 stars. Food was great!! Oh!! Lights are dimmed so if you are coming for dinner be prepared for that. People were having trouble reading the menu with the lighting .. Will be back!

I used to like to come here often with my sisters for a late lunch, but the service has gone down drastically - especially with the front of the house. My last visit (New Year&#39;s day) was terrible - not only due to the wait, but with the way the hostesses handled the situation as well. I walked in with my family and was told that a party of 9 (6 adults, 1 kid and two toddlers) would be a 20-30 minutes wait - we were okay with that. 40 minutes passed, and I noticed everyone (parties of 2-8) who&#39;s been coming after us getting seated within 5-10 minutes. I went to ask the hostess if our table would be ready soon, because a lot of people who&#39;s come in after has already been seated to which she replied that we will be seated within 5 minutes as &#34;they&#39;re cleaning up your table right now.&#34; 10 minutes: nothing. After waiting for 20 minutes when she said 5, my sister went up there again. Then the hostess told her that the server was on her break and that she&#39;s going to seat us in 5 minutes for sure. Welp, another 10 minutes passed and my father walked out. My sister told the hostess that this was unacceptable and by then the party that walked in at the same time as we did had already finished their meal and left. Then she said, &#34;well, your table was ready. We&#39;re just waiting to seat you, but we can seat you right now if you wait a bit.&#34; Our question was if our table has been ready as she said, why did she have to wait to seat us, yet kept seating everyone that came after us. The toddlers were complaining that they were starving so we left elsewhere and was helped right away despite the other restaurant being packed.<br><br>Being a server for a decade myself, I was trying to be understanding of the whole situation and with the wait especially since it was New Years. However, it seems like no one at the front of the house really cared or know what they were doing anyway. I sincerely hope that management properly train their staffs (especially their hostesses) instead of them picking and choosing who they&#39;d want to wait and who they want to seat while they stand around talk and look annoyed.

Rediculous waits.  Once seated, rediculous service times.  Was told 30 minute wait, ended up being an hour and 15.  Got to the table, took 20 minutes to get drinks and bread out.  Another 30 minutes to place food order.  Food took forever to come to the table.  Literally the longest time I&#39;ve had at any restaurant in Fresno.  0/10.  Would not recommend.

Went in for dinner to celebrate my daughters birthday today. It started off as probably the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life.  Checked in with the girl at the desk that was rude, didn&#39;t smile and looked too busy to be nice. While getting seated by hostess I told her she should tell the girl at the desk to smile, she then replied she&#39;s just busy and stressed out. After we were seated it took about 15 to 20 minutes before our waitress got to us to get the drink order. She seemed hurried and unhappy as soon as she arrived. She dropped off the bread, then took her another 15 minutes to bring our drinks, by that time we were ready for some more bread so we asked for more and was told by the waitress she would be back with the sugar for the coffee and more bread. Didn&#39;t see her for about 15 minutes, still waiting for sugar. My mother then sees her walking by and asks for the sugar and bread, this waitress had the audacity to tell my mother &#34; I already heard you the first, second and third time&#34;. I could not believe she just talked to her this way, I was in disbelief. I then told the waitress not to talk to my mother this and she was being totally rude. She just stood there. My husband asked her to call a manager.  The manager was friendly and apologized, replaced this waitress with a very good waiter and we finished our meal. He was amazing and tried really hard to make up for her rudeness. We were told it was the end of her shift and doesn&#39;t give anyone the right to treat someone else like this though. I&#39;m not sure I would go back, left a really bad feeling. I wish I had recorded it. <br>Update 2-27-19<br>I emailed Cheesecake Factory through website the same day I posted this review and I have yet to get a response directly from Cheesecake Factory. Yes they responded through yelp, probably because it&#39;s public but not when emailed directly.
Love eating here. I always look forward to their bread and salmon dish. The mango cheesecake is to die for. I&#39;ve never had a bad visit.

They were outta artichoke dip?? Wait what!? I was so disappointed and shocked and ended up ordering the crab dip which sucked! Time for somebody else to do the ordering cause it seems to me the artichoke dip should be a staple!<br><br>Sad to see the comment back from the restaurant- not only did they not read it- but I never mentioned which location and they assumed it was Fresno.<br><br>Actually it was Woodland Hills - Cheesecake Factory - please read the comments- that&#39;s the ONLY way your service will ever improve.
Equally as great as all other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s<br><br>Kale n quinoa salad was delicious as was Asian Chicken tacos<br>Both healthy n fresh choices
I love this place especially the bread and butter for starters while waiting for your meal. The service is fast and great and very attentive.

This place drips with the term &#34;high class&#34;. From the building itself to the expertly prepared foods, it was all professionally and well put together. My grandma got the appetizer ceaser salad and boy for a size small, it was a lot! My boyfriend got cashew chicken since it was supposed to be &#34;very spicy&#34;. He said it was a little to heavily sauced and it wasn&#39;t spicy at all, almost sweet. Other than that though he thought it was fantastic. I got the bang bang chicken, essentially curry chicken. Although I eat this dish all the time, I still loved it and the sauce was very yummy! The bill was more expensive than expected, but that comes with territory for a higher end place than your average. If you&#39;re willing to shell out the extra bucks for fine dining, this place won&#39;t let you down!
As always one of my very very favorite places!!!! Had three cheesecakes! Slices that is! And fried mac &amp; cheese!!  And drinks! As usual all were wonderful!!

My friends and I decided to come have dinner here for an early Valentine&#39;s couples dinner date. With a party of 10 we waited about 2 hours to be seated. However, the food was delicious and staff were friendly and attentive. Our waitor, Justin, was great and really made sure our needs were met. I ordered the chicken alfredo fettucine dish and loved how creamy and flavorful each bite was. My boyfriend had the factory combo of the steak diane and shrimp scampi, which he enjoyed as well. The steak diane was cooked perfectly at medium rare as requested, although I felt the sauce was a bit salty to my liking. In all, we had a great night and left feeling stuffed and satisfied.
Foods are good and the service is ok,, but sometimes pasta is kind of too salty, but the cakes are really good and tasty!

Joey L was our waiter and made our experience great. He was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave us great recommendations that we really enjoyed. I would come back again because of the amazing service we received.

This place is amazing, the wait was kind of long. I ordered the avocado egg rolls, they&#39;re amazing. My sister had the Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls which were not the same as authentic Vietnamese rolls but still good. I ordered the Thai glazed salmon, unfortunately it was undercooked but they did replace it for me and even kept it off the tab which was nice. The place does get crowded and parking is limited but overall good place.
Cant ever go wrong with this place very consistently good and great variety of options.  I got the ribeye and it was fantastic.
Their steak Diane is amazing!!! Because of this place my husband request me to cook Steak Diane for his birthday.

The happy hr food is a bargain, the pasta Vinci is my favorite plate and any type of cheesecake for dessert is great.<br><br>Sit at the bar and have Jeremy take care of all of your requests, he&#39;s amazing and will take your order without writing it down, have it come out perfect, even if you have 5 substitutions like I always do, I try to get him to make a mistake but he never has in the long time I&#39;ve frequented the place.

This is the place for me to go when I&#39;m having dinner alone and I LOVE IT. I always sit at the bar and the bartenders are amazing. The happy hour specials are great prices and plenty of options. The corn tamales are something different to try, and soooo good!

We got take out from here on our trip from SF to LA. My veggie burger was HORRIBLE! It was bland and tasted old, not fresh at all. I gave it to my dog to eat, he wasn&#39;t even excited about it. They also gave me French fries instead of a salad and didn&#39;t include ketchup for the fries or burger.<br><br>The beet salad was pretty good but nothing special. Glad I ordered that to share because that ended up being my dinner because the veg burger was literally inedible.<br><br>My fiancé had some sort of GIANT burrito that was slathered in a forgettable concoction of sauce, cream, and other toppings. The thing was huge. So if your going for quantity over quality here you go.<br><br>I don&#39;t get how these chain places stay so popular with their low quality, thoughtless food.

Our waiter wouldn&#39;t look or talk to any of the girls at the table. He would only talk to the one guy but not the other guy. It felt sexist if he hadn&#39;t also ignored the other guy at our table. I tried to ask questions to be included in the service, but all my attempts were ignored. Since I was sitting inside the booth and had two other people on the exit side of the booth, I even called the front from my phone to ask for better service since we were all looking to be serviced. This is one of the worse locations for service, but the food was made decent. It wasn&#39;t the best, but good enough to feed our hungry stomachs since the waiter only brought 2 small breads for 6 people. It was difficult even asking another waiter to bring us more bread. I really wanted to get cheesecake, but the waiter dismissed me as I was handed the check. I really couldn&#39;t even tell him what a disappointment his service was because he wouldn&#39;t even look or talk to us. The one guy he did talk to barely answered before our waiter would disappear. So I also had no time to get him to try to get the waiter to stay.

Had lunch there today @ the bar by the time we ordered our 1st round of drinks which was water it&#39;s was 10min when we sat down we ordered right there and by the time they brought our food it was 45min later. This was lunch can&#39;t imagine dinner Cheesecake of Fresno you earned a &#34;D&#34; grade Summer 2017. Never going back.

I heard this place was great so I was excited to try it. It wasn&#39;t what I expected though. Not only was the wait long (I made reservations in advance) but the bread on my sandwich was a little too burned (similar quality to panera where I never get it burned). The lighting was so dim that I struggled to read the menu and then I ordered an $8 slice of cheesecake and found it to be much too sweet. Maybe others would have enjoyed it but when it comes to cheesecake too much sugar isn&#39;t a good thing. I wasn&#39;t pleased and this was my first time there so I will not be going back anytime soon.<br><br>I&#39;ll admit, I do appreciate that they have a large menu, there&#39;s something in there for everyone. Every single dish is like 2000 calories (seriously) so first scan the skinnylicious menu. It&#39;s not the worst place and in my book neither is it the best. For that price though I&#39;m better off going to another restaurant.

It is so ridiculous that Cheesecake Factory won&#39;t take reservations for large parties. We were coming to celebrate a birthday on Thursday evening, so I called in the afternoon to try and make a reservation for our party of 10. The girl on the phone initially said they can take reservations for larger parties but then talked to her manager and said only walk ins. We arrived that night and when we checked in they didn&#39;t give us a wait time and told us they would let us know how long. After 30 minutes they told us the wait would be an hour for our party. Thirty minutes after that, the wait time was still an hour for our party. There were tables we could have been seated at if they were moved together, but the hostess gave them to smaller parties who came in after us instead. We ended up cutting our losses and eating somewhere else, but the whole ordeal was frustrating and a complete waste of time. Between the nightmare parking and crazy wait time I don&#39;t think I will be back here anytime soon.
For our 14 year anniversary we decided to go have desert at Cheesecake Factory. What a great time.  Big shout out to Shark for making it an especially memorable. Thanks and see you next time.

There are three stars because our meal was delicious.<br><br>With that being said...<br><br>1. They should have more people in charge of the patio area. We waited over half an hour between ordering our food and getting our food. My friend finished her (scrumptious) drink before she got her food.<br><br>2. The menu misstated what was available. I asked for a certain side (potato chips) and was told it couldn&#39;t happen. I said, &#34;it&#39;s on the menu for a different sandwich, though.&#34; When I got my meal, the &#34;chips&#34; were actually little, tiny strips of what tasted like onion strings. It was the size of a quarter. It&#39;s fine, but those are not potato chips. <br><br>3. We had to stop the waiter several times for refills, the check, boxes, etc. and it looked like he wasn&#39;t going to stop each time when we were obviously trying to get his attention. TO BE FAIR--he was the only person working the ENTIRE area. Other tables started going inside to grab their own bread and water because it was taking so long.<br><br>4. The bread was delicious.

Overall experience this time was a 4 would have been a five if it wasn&#39;t for the open seating where we couldn&#39;t really enjoy our food without overhearing the conversation at the table next to us. As far as the food here my orange chicken was absolutely perfect a nice crispy batter tender chicken with good flavor I&#39;ve had it at other cheesecake factories and the batter on the chicken is normally very hard and chicken is dried out. My lady had the miso salmon which I tried while she wasn&#39;t looking it was pretty good the salmon alone was nothin to rave over but the sauce completes the flavor profile. Our waitress was great she checked in at perfect times and was very nice.

UPDATE for 2016:<br><br>GREAT JOB!  The Cheesecake Factory got better at this location!  <br><br>Service:  5 out of 5,  Perfecto!<br><br>Food:  5 out of 5,  Mmmm Perfecto!<br><br>Deco:  5 out 5, Perfecto!<br><br>Lunch price is higher since my last review.  Figure more like $15-25 per person (+tip) because you just have to have some cheesecake!  All food was great!  Two people had Asian lettuce wrap tacos, 1 strawberry cheesecake, California Cheesesteak with sweet potato fries, and grilled steak medallions with no leftovers. ;-)

Ok this was the worst restaurant experience I&#39;ve had in years. The waitress had fingernails 1 inch long. Her fingernails were in the food and water glass. I was disgusted. There were 3 parties if 2 and it was 9pm. We were thete 1.5 hours. It took fo racer to get our COLD nachos. The bacon cheese burger was cold and the bun stale. My wife didn&#39;t eat tb e fettuccine Alfredo it was terrible. Again the fingernails in the food didn&#39;t help. The waitress never even asked how we were doing. We saw her 4 times in 1.5 hours.<br>AMAZING! WE SPENT $80.00. We will never go back. I could go on but I won&#39;t. They insist on a star so I have to give them 1. I&#39;d like to give them <br>-5!

Just  finished dinner with my daughter for a late 17th birthday.  Got here Tuesday night about 6:45. Seated immediately although they were fairly busy.  Our server David, greated us and got our drink order.  He brought their great bread with butter.<br><br>In no time our order came out.  She had the spaghetti and meatballs.  Pasta to carb-load for her track meet tomorrow.  I get to take the meatballs home!  I had the chicken piccata.  Both were very good and just the right amount. My sweetie did order a piece of the chocolate tower truffle cake for later.<br><br>Great food and great service.  The only issue you might have is parking but we found a spot pretty close to the entrance. You can always valet park it.

My salad was really good. I always get the Tuna Titaki Salad whenever I go to the cheesecake factory. Our waitress was an absolute doll. She brought us all fresh bread when we requested it. I went with about 10 girlfriends for my friends Bachelorette party.<br><br>The reason why I&#39;m giving the restaurant 2 stars is because one of my girl friends found a slimy &#34;thing&#34; in her bbq chicken salad. My other friend ( who was sharing the exact same salad) found 2 cashew nuts in the salad as well! What of she had been allergic to nuts?!?! Two different kinds of substances in the same salad?!?! Yuck!<br><br>We brought this to the attention to the waitress  (again, she was a really good waitress. I told think she has any control on what goes into salads). She notified the manager and he ended up comping that part of the meal. Good call on his part!<br><br>This makes me kind of skeptical of this corporation considering the situation we experienced. I loved the cheesecake factory! But this freaked me out.

I waited forever to be seated which was fine but i waited longer than they told me. And when i was seated my waiter messed up my order i asked for a strawberry lemonade and i got a regular lemonade. I didn&#39;t say anything since it wasn&#39;t a huge deal. Then when we ordered the food the waiter messed up my order i asked for a Mac and cheese burger and to add bacon on it and she said that&#39;s fine. Then we waited another 30 minutes for the food and the waiter never visited us, we were waiting for a refill the whole time and she didn&#39;t notice until she dropped off the food and my burger was a bacon burger with extra bacon. I paid more for the burger i didn&#39;t even want I was extremely upset since she messed up everything i ordered and even the other food was messed up. The only thing that wasn&#39;t messed up was the water we ordered..  i don&#39;t think I&#39;ll come back since everything we ordered was wrong.

The Cheesecake Factory has kind of gone downhill. Their menu appears that they&#39;re targeting a millennial. The staff acts like they&#39;re  there just to collect a paycheck and they forget who&#39;s really paying their paycheck. Not happy with them and it&#39;s sad to see because this was one of my favs... So bummed

I went here for lunch with a friend and ordered the roadside sliders and rena&#39;s special. They were pretty good. The tomatoes on the rena&#39;s special were boy ripe. Our service was excellent and the food came out fast.<br><br>Overview<br><br>Food:4<br>Service:5<br>Ambience:5<br>Bang for your buck:3.5<br><br>TOTAL:4

Was eating Americana burger and was chewing and chewing - spit it out and was piece of plastic - manager comes out and says it was piece of onion peel - lol - i said C&#39;mon man it was plastic and he just blew it off - never going back again, burger was tasty , service was good, but many other great places for burgers in Fresno come to find out - poor management
I like the atmosphere and this place, but the foods are not that great than other Cheesecake Factory. Pasta is too salty and too oily. But the cheesecake is good

I ordered the Mac &amp; cheese hamburger &amp; it was delicious. My husband had the mushroom burger and said it was very good. One of the best burgers I&#39;ve had. The entire staff was very friendly and gave good descriptions of food and great advice on what to order. Definitely recommend you try it.

Simply put, I&#39;m not a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I got food poisoning so bad after eating here on one occasion that I vowed to never return. After a few months, I reluctantly gave this place another shot since my friend wanted to try it. I came in ready to be disappointed and I was.<br><br>The dishes here are &#39;eh&#39; and I hate how close/small some of the tables are (you can literally touch the table next to you without having to try). And if you&#39;re like me, you&#39;d think the cheesecakes here are WAY too rich and probably couldn&#39;t stand to take more than one bite. But yea, two stars for the complimentary bread and being able to get more bread lol.

I love cheescake factory. I ordered a pasta with a spicy sauce( i dont remember the name), but it was really good. I ordered the lunch size, since obviously the dinner comes in a bigger plate. I also had te caramel cheescake which was BOMB. Their tropical martini is outstanding. Best drink i&#39;ve ever had. The only problem i think was the service being slow. Everything else was good.

You know, I never wrote a bad review of this place before because the place is beautiful inside, the food is delicious and well plated, and the waitresses/waiters are usually very nice too. But I have had multiple issues with this restaurant and this one was the straw that broke the camel&#39;s back. <br><br>We had a perfect afternoon eating here and great food and service until we got the bill. I looked at it and they charged $8.50 for our strawberry cheesecake (no, we didn&#39;t need to add to our body&#39;s abundant fat reserves but it was my parent&#39;s anniversary). Yet all their menus showed the price was $7.95. <br><br>So I told the waitress I knew it was splitting hairs but it&#39;s the principle of the thing and she understood that and went and talked to her manager. While I realize I&#39;m having a lunch that costs more than your usual fast food or sandwich, I&#39;d still be a spoiled fool to act like 55 cents meant nothing. <br><br>She came back and basically said &#34;I&#39;m sorry about that, but we raised our prices and our system is in transition is that okay?&#34; Nooo it&#39;s not okay to be lied to about this. I told her no and she went and told the manager. The manager came back and told us the same thing.<br><br>First off, this shouldn&#39;t have been an issue to begin with; they should have correct pricing on all their menus at all times. Second, they should have corrected the error for us immediately. Third, you should never tell a customer some excuse and still make the customer responsible for it. I told him as such and he just looked at me and shook his head as if to say &#34;sorry you don&#39;t like it but tough luck we won&#39;t change it for you.&#34; Sure enough, they didn&#39;t change it on the bill they brought back. This is misrepresentation and illegal. You&#39;re lucky we didn&#39;t walk out completely. <br><br>I mean here&#39;s the bottom line: YOU squabbled with a customer for 55 cents. You lost a customer. OVER 55 CENTS. Petty, petty restaurant.<br><br>Oh and I forgot to mention, on our way to the parking two valets nearly backed into us!<br><br>Part 2:<br><br>This is actually a prequel to today&#39;s fiasco. A few months ago a friend and I went to eat here. Her and my favorite appetizer is the avocado eggroll plate. We ordered a plate of them but were told they were out of avocado even though we saw other plates of food being served with avocado. It must have been another issue with the eggrolls themselves but either way we were very disappointed. Now some background - I live a half hour away from this Cheesecake Factory so to go there is a special trip. A week later I called and asked specifically if they now had avocado eggrolls in stock and available to order to go. The person on the phone said &#34;we sure do!&#34; very confidently. So I took a trip down there, I went in and went to the to go counter to order, and they told me they still didn&#39;t have them available. This had me steaming. Obviously no one in this restaurant commmunicates with each other. Well I went home and wrote a complaint through the website. A while later I got an apology letter and a gift card from the manager. I figured at this point that at least the communication problem would have been addressed. So a week later I call, and I ask the same thing. They tell me the same thing they did when I called before: &#34;we sure do have them available!&#34; Well guess what? I drive down there and they&#39;re still unavailable. HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE!? You can probably guess how upset I was, and of course I complained online again. I didn&#39;t get a response for a couple of months in the form of a letter from the manager asking me to call him. Well I kept calling and every day someone told me that he had &#39;just&#39; left. Yeah right. Just awful, I&#39;m done.

I love this place, I really do.  The food is always amazing, drinks are always perfect.  But every time I&#39;ve been there the wait is at least an hour. This place is huge!  I&#39;m so sad with the wait time though.  If we ever get enough capital, we are opening another one.

Came in today for dinner with a group of friends. Sat out at the patio because it was immediate seating. Our server, Melissa, was awesome!!! I was surprised to know that she&#39;s only been serving for a few days. You know what they say, your server can make or break your experience. I must say she really made it great for us. The drinks and food were good, and we always love the free bread. Definitely can&#39;t wait to come back.

We were shopping at Fashion Fair and decided to go eat nearby.  The 3 of us had chicken dishes.  chicken romano, cajun chicken and spicy cashew chicken.  Oddly enough, all our chicken was breaded in the same dull, tasteless breading.  All 3 meals were poor substitutes for real flavor!  BLAND AND BORING!!! Service was great, the atmosphere was way above our noise level and the decor is a plastic faux Egyptian with scary ceiling lights!!!  The place was filled with glitzy fake people who probably dont even notice how boring the food is!<br>Worst part......my Marine son in law was denied a military discount!!!  <br><br>We wont go back!!! Nasty food gave all 3 of us headaches too!

I&#39;m not giving a perfect score the food was great but when we asked if he did we ask for a window there were multiple places where the windows were open and we were seated in a booth with out a window and told there weren&#39;t any issues we sat down and got our water and our drinks at a couple in a window Booth very upset I didn&#39;t get what I wanted was a window to watch the beautiful outside and there was nothing open on the patio

Typical Cheesecake Factory. Nothing great, but it also won&#39;t let you down on the dishes they serve. The mojito drink is delicious. I wish they had more of a variety on beer. It was really busy the day we dine-in, but our service was great and our expections were met with food being served with perfect timing.
