It&#39;s not often that I receive stellar service at CCF were we should be treated with respect .<br><br>I want to thank our server, Sayash G for her great service that night. <br><br>We went in on Valentine&#39;s Day with 4 children and two teenage parents. <br><br>I find it rather embarrassing to have to bring such young adults with their children because I know that their children could make a rather perfect evening dinner  go miserable. But because they are family, you just have to deal with it. <br><br>Luckily, Sayash had patience with our table and was extremely accommodating. She put my worries at ease as she came multiple times to check on our table and bring us anything that we needed. <br><br>She also had help from other server, but I didn&#39;t take down her name. Both of the ladies went beyond my expectations at making sure everything we ordered tasted right. <br><br>We did have an issue with the fried zucchini, portobello, and avocado fries. The fries had a horrible bitter taste. She quickly took it back and removed it from our bill. Sayash and the other server packed up our leftovers and bagged what we wanted to take home. <br><br>From beginning to the end of our dinner, we truly enjoyed our experience and I hope that this CCF continues to hire professional, caring servers who know how to provide excellent customer care. <br><br>Thank you Sayash.
Been here repeatedly now they have a &#34;lighter side&#34; menu.  Food is always good and the service is friendly.  Always a nice lunch place when you don&#39;t want a fast food feel.

I&#39;m a little surprised by some of the reviews, I sat at the bar, I believe Justen offered great service, the food was good and came out on time, the atmosphere was good, I would like a bigger selection of IPAs on the tab but overall I would recommend. i did hear that on the weekend it gets busy.

Worst service I have ever experienced. No water brought to the table and no greeting for the first 15 minutes. After 6 people order food and alcohol no offer for refills. Dinner arrives and condiments were requested and never brought. We also had a toddler at the table her juice was never brought after repeated requests. Don&#39;t waste your hard earned money
The avocado egg rolls are delicious. We come here for appetizers and drinks for dinner. Open late. Good music on.

I have no idea about floor service, but service at the bar has always been great and prompt.  Tonight I was bad, dietwise, and ordered the Pasta carbonara with chicken.  Nice and creamy sauce with smokyness coming from the ham.  Pasta was al dente (how it should be) and topped with lots of parmegianno regiano.  Excellent choice at this chain if accompanied by a glass or two of wine.
The few times that I&#39;ve gone here the wait hasn&#39;t been long and my food comes very quickly even though it was packed great service =)

Would have liked to be able to review the food but was reminded today why I never eat there. Got a gift card was planning on using it but after driving around for 15 min trying to find parking gave up. Suppose if I wanted to pay someone for me to visit there business I could have wasted my money there. <br><br>Hopefully someday I will be able to use my gift card but it won&#39;t be at this location.
I come to pick up online order. I&#39;m waiting 30 minutes not get my order . This restaurant care about customer to walk in more than online order. Bye

This is a tradition to eat here and go to a concert. We had plenty of time. We even ordered cheesecake so we&#39;d get it with the meal. The food took so long we are late for the concert. What a huge disappointment. When we spoke to the manager he said other stations are impacted and to avoid bad grade of food quality. No apology or acknowledgement of our wait. Simply going to not come back.

My visit to the cheesecake  factory was a delight. The waiter we got was very nice, helpful, and had answers to all of your questions. Though I do not remember the waiters name he did a good job, and to top it all off I got the specialty tomato basil pasta. You sure get your moneys worth. It was a very good portion with wonderful flavors that make your taste buds sling for more. I also enjoyed the feel of the restaurant. It was very clean, and nice. I recommend this to anyone who is a food lover.

Food was cold; very overpriced. Of course, cheesecake still delicious &amp; generous enough to share. Service was good, but food was not &#34;perfect&#34;, as we were constantly asked...far from it. Best to stick to desserts, I guess.

I went here for my anniversary and it was a good choice. The food was good and our server was seriously amazing. Her name was Jessica and she was super attentive, friendly, and really went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied. Anywhere with exceptional service and food gets a 5 star rating from me!

Food is good and there is a lot of dishes to choose from! My favorite is the cheesecake lol. Service is okay depending on the server but wait time is usually minimal. I recommend if you haven&#39;t tried before. This is a place I would go to on special occasions.

For being my first time there the food &amp; service was alright. Ordered the chicken fettuccine Alfredo &amp; was a bit salty. Then for dessert I got the strawberry cheesecake &amp; thought it could have been better.

Good food. Had a group of 11 people and our waiter(Monique) was quick and remembered all of our orders and drinks. Nice setting outside and inside, very laid back restaurant. A couple of our orders were off like sauce on the side instead of on the Burger. But nothing to major. I had the Bacon, Dates , and Blue Cheese pizza. My goodness I can&#39;t even explain how amazing it was. But i will try just from the sweetness of the dates, saltiness of the Bacon, the rich spicy blue cheese was a perfect balance. After the pizza we went for dessert i had the red velvet cheesecake and it was great kind of tart but sweet as well. Another perfect balance.
Food was amazing as usual and in great portions as well. The Cheesecake Factory never seems to disappoint.
Went back just for cheesecakes to go this time. Had mango and something red velvet. <br>Ah......superb quality, high end cheesecakes deserving 5 stars. <br><br>Will set you back about $20 though!

Great breakfast for the FIRST day of the NEW YEAR!<br><br>My friend and I were disappointed La Boulangerie was closed on New Year&#39;s Day and made the impromptu decision to try breakfast at Cheesecake Factory in Fashion Fair.  I am a huge fan of their brunch but had never tried the daily breakfast options! <br><br>We had a GREAT EXPERIENCE!  Mary G was our server (she was FABULOUS) and were also helped by Jay and Romero with bringing items to our table! We tried their espresso drink from the bakery and were VERY IMPRESSED - the Caramel Royale Macchiato and Cafe Mocha atthe suggestion of our server; they were both yummy! We tried the Chicken Chorizo &amp; Avocado Omelette and Fiesta Burrito - everything was pretty good.  My bagel was pretty over toasted and hard but the rest of the meal was perfect. Definitely add CCF to our espresso / late breakfast list!

Came here at the request of my brother for a dinner with the family. We ordered the french country salad, portofino pizza, jamaican pepper shrimp, herb crusted salmon, and the shrimp scampi. Honestly, the salad was probably the best dish for me and when that&#39;s the case, it&#39;s just sad. My dad ordered the jamaican shrimp, which was interesting.. but kind of salty. The herb crusted salmon had WAAAAY too much herbs and tasted off. The mashed potatoes it came with was good though. I didn&#39;t try the portofino pizza, but I&#39;m told it was not that bad. Probably 3 star dish. My shrimp scampi looked really good, but it was a tad bit salty. Overall, mediocre food. We also ordered a slice of the strawberry cheesecake. Unfortunately, too sweet for my tastes. I don&#39;t think I&#39;d come back.
We go every year for my daughters birthday. The food is great and the servers are the best. They make it special every year for her and she loves it. Great location for shopping afterward.
Fantastic customer service.<br>Great, consistently good food.  <br>Love the curbside pick up.

First of all the food wasn&#39;t even good. The chicken was not juicy as they said it was. The mashed potatoes wasn&#39;t even edible because it tasted disgusting and wasn&#39;t even seasoned. It made my sister sick the next day. ;-; The pasta oh don&#39;t get me started on the pasta... First of all it was so expensive 20 bucks for one serving of pasta who do they think I am bruh... It also didn&#39;t have enough seasoning. Ready to go pasta that you can get from the store for way cheaper is way better lmao. And the soda... I never thought you could serve fricken soda as bad as they did, it was basically water that they served us like wtf. That&#39;s it for the food and now to the service.... Basically it was horrible, they stared at us and gave us the feeling that we weren&#39;t welcomed at all and they didn&#39;t even bring the plates and utensils that they have to give us right away. The people behind us was given there&#39;s immediately. maybe they discriminated us because we were Mexicans... to be honest it was my first time going there and I hope the next time I go there they can put there act together.... ;-;

I frequently come here for lunch ~ about once a month. I usually order the Chicken Salad sandwich with Almonds. It is really flavorful with a generous amount of almonds to give it both taste and crunch. I always skip the fries and substitute them with a tossed green salad, which they do very well.<br><br>I have two complaints: 1/ The cleanliness of the bathrooms could be much better. They just need more frequent servicing. 2/ The quality of the service. When I was there yesterday, it took literally 20 minutes to be approached by the server. (I was seated at one of the high tables in the bar area, which is open seating &amp; usually very nice) I was so thirsty when the young lady came to finally take my order and requested a large glass of water to start with. Then I gave her my order.<br><br>15 minutes later, with no water to drink, after waiting now for 35 minutes, I flagged down another server and asked for a glass of water, *please* !! He quickly brought one over. Another 10 minutes passed, noticing the girl was now taking orders for another table not far from me, so I flagged the same guy again and ordered a margarita, which he brought promptly.<br><br>So, now it&#39;s been 45 minutes...and a totally different server was finally bringing my Chicken Almond Salad sandwich...the first server still busy with different tables.<br><br>I asked about the first girl who had taken my order and the new (third one now) server told me she was still my server, but that she got really &#34;busy&#34;. I decided to talk with the manager about it, who I found to be extremely defensive. He could barely get out an apology ~ it was obviously hard for him to admit there were problems with the serve staff. He left, saying he would &#34;talk with the girl&#34;.<br><br>I began to lose my appetite at this point and wanted to get my check and pay the bill. I looked around for all three servers who had waited on me; they were nowhere to be seen. So I got up and walked over the the server&#39;s station and asked someone to please bring my check over. They smiled and promised they would do that.<br><br>Another 20 minutes passed....I had time to finish my drink and take a couple more bites of the sandwich, but was feeling ignored and disrespected. I got up and walked over to the kitchen area to find someone to get the manager for me again. When he showed up (which took some time), I told him I had been waiting for 20 minutes just to get my check. He finally said there would be no charge for my meal and *almost* apologized this time, albeit defensively.<br><br>It was a disappointing experience and I&#39;m not sure I will be back anytime soon. I can&#39;t figure out why the serving staff is so disorganized and slow. The restaurant really wasn&#39;t all that busy ~ I had arrived at 11:00 a.m.

Over priced. 2 people with regular meals for dinner which were hardly average. Plus 1 slice of cheesecake...smores cheesecake which I had chose as my desert before i even had any idea what I was going to have for dinner and what I had thought would be the highlight of my night and sounded to die for.....which turned out to be very disappointing and just as our dinner, my dessert turned out to be barely mediocre at best. Used to absolutely love this place 4-5 years ago, now all the prices have went up yet quality has declined imo.  I want to go back on Sunday and try theyre brunch so they have a opportunity to redeem themselves with me....but dont plan to have dinner out at cheesecake factory again..or dessert. $120 wasted on an unsatisfying meal. Anf they&#39;ve gotten more stingy with the bread they serve at the begining of the meal which is the best in the world the brown bread is amazing i could literally live off that stuff now they bring u one small loaf of that and the white bread and thats it no refills blaahhh.

I had an etiquette teacher (yes my mother enrolled me in etiquette classes) once tell me that if a place specializes in a dish order that item off the menu.  This little bit of advice holds true for the cheesecake factory.  The best thing about the cheese cake factory is obviously the Cheese cake.  I am not a huge fan of the other foods but their okay.  Usually when I visit the cheese cake factory I will order some sort of appetizer nothing to heavy because I usually go for the dessert.<br><br>When I order appetizers I usually get one of 3 things 1.) the chicken pots stickers, 2.) the avocado spring rolls or 3.) Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls. <br><br>My go to cheese cakes are the white chocolate chip macadamia nut and the carmel pecan turtle.  <br><br>There&#39;s a definite pattern with the type  of food I order from the cheese cake factory.  Apparently all my appetizers are asian themed and all my desserts have carmel and nuts. However to me these are the best things on the menu.<br><br>I did subtract a star because every single time I have visited the customer service has been off.  Either I get a hostess/host that doesn&#39;t seem to enjoy their life or a server that like abandons my table.   However I am a fiend for cheesecake and other health destroying desserts so I&#39;ll likely keep visiting even if it is only to get my cheesecake go!

Recently went here for the first time. <br>Long wait, rushed service when you finally are seated, burger was pink(I asked for fully cooked), wings were over fried &amp; when I paid, the waitress didn&#39;t give me my change so I had to ask her for it &amp; got an attitude in return. I took my dessert to go &amp; the order on that was wrong but I didn&#39;t find out until I got home. <br>My first &amp; last trip.
Pretty good place to eat, like everyone else I come for the bread and cheesecake. The four cheese pasta is my favorite.

I really pay attention to detail and I never find a restaurant that earns 5 stars but tonight the star&#39;s aligned. To start great service from our server Rachel we were placed at a small table which was ok<br> since there was only myself and husband  I glanced apond a booth which was still to be cleaned and apparently she saw that and asked with a smile if we wanted to move we told her we&#39;d leave it for a larger group even though we would like it and she insisted, more comfy. Food was excellent I had the eggplant parmesan and my husband the mac and cheese burger, drinks and godiva chocolate dessert. I will definitely return and I hope Rachel will be my server. Thanks for making our 26th wedding anniversary special.
Ordered some appetizers for happy hour and they were all just okay, tasted kind of fun of and the spring rolls didn&#39;t taste fresh at all. You get what you pay for.

Have been to several CF&#39;s and my favorite item was the factory meatloaf. But it seems like the last few times I ordered it, it came out burned. So stopped ordering it. Stopped in here for dinner and ordered it again. Habit I guess. Was thinking of calling my server and changing to a salad. Glad I didn&#39;t. This was the best meatloaf I&#39;ve ever had. Perfectly cooked with just the right amount of spices in it.  The veggies were fresh, didn&#39;t have that frozen taste to them and the mashed potatoes were very good with the right amount of rosemary in them. My server was very fast and attentive. <br>4 thumbs up for the food, and 5 thumbs up for the service.

Saturday lunch with the girls had a great time good food BUT the waitress I guess was eager to keep her section moving because we had to eat and run. I get it...the more tables the more tips however between drinks and lunch with desert we spend over $100. My first clue the service was going to go down hill was after we ordered our drinks and main course the waitress had all a sudden &#34;a short snappy attitude&#34;I sure hope Cheesecake Factory management reads this comment. When service is this poor I certainly don&#39;t intended to go to this location again as well as tell my friends to stay away also .

I love the food and atmosphere! I adore eating in and outside. The waitresses are very nice and always tend to you quickly. The Katsu Chicken was great and the portions are huge. I ordered a pasta dish (can&#39;t remember which) and she asked if I wanted the lunch or dinner size. She said the lunch size was small or half the dinner, but it was a large amount. I had left overs. A little pricey but worth it.
Lot of selection and great Happy hour but don&#39;t laugh but my favorite dish is the nachos
I love their sea food dishes, cucumber lemonade is to die for!! Obviously the cheesecake is always on point and the service is great! Love it!!!!
Meh... Nothing to write home about. The service was nothing special , neither was my salmon. I was a little disappointed today. :/

We visited the Cheesecake Factory in Fresno on Shaw Ave. on a Monday evening.  The entire experience was very good; very nice environment, excellent service from our waitress, and very good food. The avocado egg rolls appetizer was awesome.  And, of course,the cheesecake was incredible!  Big kudos to our incredible waitress, Natalie J; she was very pregnant and you never would have known it by her positive and pleasant attitude and fast professional service.  You could tell she enjoyed her work and wanted us to have an enjoyable experience.  Hats off to Natalie!

Arrived at about 630 pm on a Tuesday. Perfect time, was able to get a booth with maybe around a 5 minute wait. Very nice waiter. Ordered shrimp with angel hair pasta and an order of fried calamari. With an Arnold Palmer and Strawberry lemonade. Drinks were very strong, had to water down with a glass of water. Pasta was very good. Fried calamari was salty. The cheesecake ordered was the dolce caramel. Very good.

I went for my first time tonight and it was outstanding! Our waitress was amazing she didn&#39;t bug us to much but she was definitely on top of it because she was observant and noticed when out drinks were low she got us refills. As soon as we were good and finished she was there to take our plates. Which she then offered us dessert and of course how can you not get cheesecake if you&#39;re at the cheesecake factory. I ordered the shrimp with Angel hair pasta and oh my was it absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I split a Oreo dream cheesecake and that was perfect. It all hit the spot just right! I&#39;m so glad my first experience was a great one. I will definitely be coming back!!

I&#39;ve eaten here once, won&#39;t return unless made to go because of a group event...service was ok for us but the table next to us had not gotten their food when we were finished and leaving yet they came in the same time we did.  We were crammed together on a banquet seating with tiny tables placed very close together.  We couldn&#39;t help but be part of the next table&#39;s conversation.  <br><br>The food was ok, but nothing I would go running back for.  Prices too high for what you get.  <br><br>Very crowded and noisy when we were there for lunch.
Great food; great service! Courtney is the best. Thank you!<br>So full we couldn&#39;t eat cheesecake:(

Had to make it out here for a quick work trip, so I threw the sis-in-law in the car and once mission completed we landed here.<br><br>Perfect place to have a lil girl time.  But, you don&#39;t normally come here if counting calories was your thing, but we were surprised to find a &#34;lighter&#34; menu and everything on it sounded delish.<br><br>The sis-in-law ordered a turkey burger and was thoroughly impressed, she had to ask the waiter what they seasoned it with because she liked it so much.  Me and turkey burgers?  Well, not so much.  I opted for the Fried chicken and mashed potatoes with homemade biscuit.  OH yEaH!!!<br><br>All I got to say is....winner winner chicken dinner!

Hubby and I went for a late night, quiet meal. The food was excellent (I had the Moroccan Chicken) and our waiter was very nice. The place is lovely and everyone we spoke to, with the exception of the hostess, was extremely friendly. The portions are large, the bread basket was warm and tasty. There was too much food in the entrees to contemplate dessert but, we did decide to take one home for the family. Our server was very helpful with selection and getting it packaged up for us. (We took home a lemon cheesecake and it was a hot with everyone!)<br><br>My main complaints, aside from the rude hostess, would be the menu has so any selections it&#39;s difficult to remember what you read by the time you get to the end. And, on the night we visited, the restaurant was incredibly dark! Not sure why but it was impossible to read the menu print in the dark and I couldn&#39;t see my food. <br><br>I will definitely return but the prices are high, so it would have to be a special occasion.
Ordered fish and chips. So much salt on the fries i could dust it off. Bland and greasy fish. I&#39;d be better off ordering a fish fillet sandwich and fries from McDonald&#39;s.

Went for dinner last night with family. Service was phenomenal!! Ordered the eggplant parmesan. Im not one to complain but when waitress came around to ask how we were enjoying our meal i was honest and told her it was ok just a little overbreaded and overcooked for my liking. She apologized and went on her way. When it came time to clear plates and bring the bill she saw that most was still on my plate n took it.. when she came back she was profusely apologetic that she examined what was left on my plate n yes definitely it was overcooked n over breaded n so she removed it from my tab. N offered to replace it with anything else on the menu at no charge! I declined and paid the tab but then im assuming the manager came over and profusely apologized also and made the same offer of replacing my meal at no charge! Needless to say everyone elses meal was excellent! By far one of the best experiences ive had at a restaurant!

Really happy with the online ordering and pick up service!  I ordered my lunch online, did a little shopping at Fashion Fair and swung by the restaurant. After a 2 minute wait my meal was ready to go. Had my food at home; juicy cheeseburger cooked as specified with plenty of bread and butter. I will definitely do that again!

I&#39;ve always loved Cheesecake Factory! My go-to dishes are the Chicken &amp; Shrimp Gumbo and Chicken Madeira &amp; Steak Diane combo. The times I come here, it is usually very busy and no parking at all.. yet, I always ALWAYS get great servers and the food always come out deliciously amazing. I&#39;ve never been disappointed here. The staffs are friendly and professional; atmosphere may be a little dark, depending where you are sitting, but it&#39;s very clean here.  I never order my Gumbo anywhere else... this is the only place I will only get it due to disappointment at other places. I highly recommend dining here. You won&#39;t go elsewhere for cheesecakes! Original strawberry is always safest to say to be the best, but try out the Red velvet and Lemon meringue are yummy as well

About a week after I was grotesquely disappointed with this chain, I conveyed my disappointment to the regional manager in their HQ and I was contacted by phone and by mail. They gave me a $50 dollar gift card to try the restaurant for the second time, and I gave it a go. <br><br>I must say on my second visit I was more impressed, the servers was as for the usual very professional, got my drinks, then dropped off some warm bread to be savored with these tasty heavily butter. I enjoyed having that as a starter. I also must add I love the white cloth instead of paper napkins, a very elegant touch.<br><br>I then ordered the orange chicken, and when I did get it, it was really delicious and the portions were amazing. It was only 12 dollars for lunch portion, which was amazing. My mum and my sister ordered the santa fe salad and my sister the shrimp bistro pasta, both were amazing, and this time for dessert we ordered dessert and got it correctly and it was delicious, it was the chocolate cheesecake.<br><br>In addition, we order some to take out, which includes the strawberry cheesecake, the orange chicken and the burger. It was all in the bag this time, and it tasted amazing and was very nicely packaged. <br><br>I am impressed with the cheesecake factory&#39;s improvement and would continue coming here as a result. Job well done. Keep it up.

Had a great night out here - Joshua was our waiter, he was very friendly and gave his personal opinion about what the best meals on the menu were. We had a rib eye steak and the lemon herb chicken - both were delicious and flavorful! Joshua made sure our drinks stayed filled but he wasn&#39;t one of those waiters that keep pestering. We hope to have him as a waiter again! July 23, 2017
Some of the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever tasted!!! I bit pricey for a slice, but it&#39;s worth it because the slices are very thick and delicious! Their customer service is also nice.

First time at the Cheesecake Factory. They were pretty busy for a Friday lunch crowd. Service was excellent and we were seated right away on the patio.<br><br>My wife had the chicken salad sandwich which was okay. The bread seemed a little stale.<br>I had the Chinese chicken salad. The portion was large which is good for me because I like to eat. The salad was fresh and I liked the dressing. The rice sticks on top of the salad were prepared perfectly but there were way to many. Completely covered the salad. The salad could have been excellent except the chicken was very dry.<br><br>Did not have dessert but maybe next time this is a dessert stop.

The food was fantastic, the cheese cake was so amazing. The environment is cute and welcoming however our waitstaff was not great. Our waiter was actually pretty awful. It literally took nearly 20 minutes for him to take our drink orders after we were seated. And we ordered your standard, ice teas and waters. <br>Then another 15 min for him to come back and take our meal orders. Once our food arrived it took an additional 10 min for my side salad. <br>The food was great, the service....not so much.

I have eaten here a number of times and always thoroughly enjoyed the food. However, for the price they charge, one would expect adjacent tables to be separated by more than 12 inches. The last two times I have taken wife here for a nice dinner we have essentially sat with strangers due to the close proximity of the tables. We were able to clearly hear their conversation, they were not speaking loud, and they were in turn able to hear ours. Sadly, the acoustics are terrible inside. It is so loud it might as well be a sports bar. In the future I will be taking my business two buildings East to B.J.&#39;s brewhouse where I am not required to eat with strangers and it is slightly quieter.

This is one of the few chains that I do like. They have a huge menu and with a lot of variety. The avocado egg roll appetizer and the sweet corn tamales appetizer are delicious. I always find it hard to break away from the Chipotle pasta, but when I do, I get the herb crusted salmon with asparagus and mash potatoes! I&#39;m never disappointed in the food, but sometimes the service is a little off(not often, but enough for me to give this place a 4 star.

I hate the fact that there is always a wait. That&#39;s probably why I don&#39;t come as much plus it&#39;s a little pricey sometimes. So for starters I always ask for the brown bread only because it is so delicious! <br>I haven&#39;t ate here to much but out of all the entree&#39;s I have ordered the chicken madeira is by far the best dish. The chicken is very flavorful &amp; juicy, on top of the chicken is some delicious mushrooms, and it comes with a side of mashed potatoes and asparagus. All of it is delicious and honestly one of the best dishes I had. You can&#39;t go wrong with ordering that.<br>For dessert my all time favorite is the red velvet cheesecake. Even though it&#39;s about 1300 calories, it&#39;s worth it sometimes to share a slice with your friends or if you&#39;re having a bad day than &#34;baby you deserve it!&#34; haha it&#39;s ok to indulge in some sweet red velvet cheesecake sometimes. But this is honestly my favorite cheesecake here besides the original strawberry cheesecake. <br>Hope this helps :-)
The staff is great! Not a fan of the food. At first you get bread. The bread was really hard. And The avocado spring rolls were burnt. I don&#39;t understand why they&#39;ll serve burnt food.

The food is definitely not what it used to be. I will pretty much pay any amount for food. It just has to be good. The cheesecake is killer the food is not horrible.  It&#39;s just not what it once was and if your going to bend me over it better be good. I&#39;m sure this place is another victim of corporate bullshit where food quality suffers. Cheesecake only from here on out.<br>Food.....bland<br>Service ......good<br>Coors light.......good

I asked for no onions, no chipotle sauce on my fish tacos and they served with both. So I scraped off each taco, I asked for corn cakes &amp; it was undercooked &amp; soggy.  I told waitress &amp; she just shrugged off. Usually good there but this time the food was just okay tasting. The cook was off tonight even my husband&#39;s food was just okay not yum.
I always enjoy coming here. My favorite dish is the jumbalaya pasta. Their pomegranate mojito is soo good and their avocado egg rolls are  yummy.  Great service (:

This cheesecake factory is the worst. The service and the atmosphere was very uncomfortable because everything was rushed &amp; food was just OK. The servers dont know how annoying it is to check on u every 2 mins..i just want to chill and relax wit my bf( it was his birthday) but here u cant do that. Just swallow your food ,pay &amp; leave<br><br>Anyways I liked the one in San Francisco a lot ..I won&#39;t be coming back to this one here ever even if its free ....<br>Very bad

Not starting off well.  Walk in 1130am on a Monday.  Need a table for 2 and I am told 15-20 minute wait?  The place is empty! Hostess tells me the high tops at the bar is available in a first come first serve.  But of course they were taken. Turned out the server we got was awesome.  We liked our food.  I have an bacon spinach mushroom omelet.  It was great.  The wife had the chicken parm sandwich.  She said it was Delilah.  Overall good food and great service from our waiter.  The hostess could have been a little more polite and courteous.

I got the shepherds pie and it was actually good! My boyfriend got some burger and sweet potato fries and even though we were seated as close to the kitchen as possible, they didnt bring the fries our until 10 minutes later and the food was cold by then! He complained to the manager and he gave us a free piece of cheesecake. My dad ordered the same thing and his regular fries were served with his food on time...? What gives?<br>Atmosphere was VERY loud and so was the bizarre music. Im down for music but this isnt a night club. Lol. Not my style of restaurant.  Thanks for the free cake

I had the chicken Costaletta.  Delicious thin breaded chicken in a lemon burre Blanc with rustic mashed potatoes and asparagus. Perfectly cooked to a golden crisp and oh so delicious. My husband had the Jambalaya with pasta. Both dishes were quite large and I have enough for two more meals. The service was slow but the manager stepped up and took good care of us.

Came for Brunch. Food was decent, but the Hash-browns looked like rocks from a kids playground. Much better locations not in Fresno. Eat at your own risk, avoid heavy dinner times or weekends at it takes forever to get a table and chances are your food will be jacked up , cold, or your waitress will have forgot she had your table.

Had food poisoning TWICE from this place! Chef can not cook chicken to save his life. Only went back second time due to a friends request. <br>Food is not very good. Sloppy, over seasoned and obviously not cooked correctly.<br>There are too many items on the menu, which tells you they specialize is nothing other than cheese cake. <br>Stick to making cheesecake people. <br>Service is good, waitresses there are nice and attentive as expected.

The wait was horrible - well over an hour for our party of 9. No reservations past 4pm (idiotic).  Once we were seated, it took an hour to get our food.   As for the food, the last time I was at a Cheesecake Factory was 20 years   The food was satisfactory then, it is still just satisfactory.  It will probably be another 20 years before I return.

Our first time visit to this particular Cheesecake Factory was a pleasant surprise. The Yelp site says the restaurant takes reservations but found out that this was not true. The service was outstanding. My wife&#39;s signature drink is a Cosmopolitan and I&#39;ve seen her drink many across a wide range of restaurants. She remarked that her Cosmo was one of the best she&#39;s ever had--truly a huge compliment considering her expertise. Our zucchini appetizer was perfectly cooked. The oil was not old and the vegetable had a slight amount of crunch, making it delightful. My wife&#39;s fish and chips were cooked nicely but she found the fish to be cut too small making it feel mealy in her mouth. My shrimp entree had wonderful flavors as the basil, garlic, and lemon were nicely abundant! But the shrimp were overcooked and the dish could have been more properly salted. We will definitely go back!

Your food is great and the portions are generous but please improve your phone system. 3/5 times I&#39;ve called in to place a curbside pick up order and I&#39;ve been placed on 10+ minute holds only to then be hung up on. Apparently it has something to to with the bakery staff being paged for the call- but if they don&#39;t hear the page the customer is left forever in limbo. I was actually advised by the staff to hang up and call again. Please fix this!

I have been going here for a couple of years now. Now I have not been recently I can tell you when I have gone that it is amazing and delicious! Now I normally go with my sister and as a cheaper alternative we do appetizers and just split them. It works for us really well. <br><br>Something we love are the Factory Nachos. Now they have recently change them and added this red sauce and other stuff, we just omit that and keep with the good ole stuff. Now only bad thing is we normally have to get extra toppings over everything because it&#39;s kind of skimpy but if you are okay with just chips and little toppings that&#39;s perfect. We also love the avocado egg rolls and the Mac and Cheese balls. <br><br>We have tried there alcoholic drinks here, they are okay. Super expensive for very little drink. Go to a bar if you want a drink. They do have a wonderful peach smoothie! <br><br>All in all this place really never disappoints. I just wish they wouldn&#39;t have changed there nachos.

I would give this restaurant a zero if I could but I guess a 1 star would suffice. Last night was my son&#39;s 18th birthday and for some odd reason he chose to want to have dinner at Cheesecake Factory. We were a party of 9 (7 adults and 2 preteens.) At this point we have been waiting at least 15 to 20 mins which is not unreasonable so my wife and I chose to head to the bar and get cocktails before we were seated. As we see our party getting escorted to our table we noticed it was a table for a party of 8. So we informed the hostess that we needed a table for 9. Unfortunately, she was insisting that 9 people can fit even though there was only a setting for 8 with no room to put a 9th person anywhere. We insisted that she find us a table for 9. She was walking around for several minutes and with no success she claims she could not find a table for us when it shows it was not a busy night when numerous tables were open. We asked for the manager on duty and my wife spoke to him. After stating our concern he informed us that we can either wait longer because there is no table available for 9 people despite numerous tables being open or we can walk out. This manager&#39;s name is Brian, at least that is what he claims it to be. Very unprofessional. Not a good way to keep customers wanting to come back. Needless to say we ended up celebrating my son&#39;s 18th birthday elsewhere. Cheesecake Factory lost at least 7 repeat customers and for that evening lost over $300 in revenue. If this is how Cheesecake factory chooses to treat its customers consider this individual and family never to return to any cheesecake factory. I hope corporate leaders look at this incident seriously and not just brush it under the rug like what most huge corporations do. Mr. Jose Jimenez, if you truly care about customer service you need to deal with this shift manager and show him how to deal with customers professionally and not be a pompous ass. Also, the front staff need to learn how to pay attention to detail so that there&#39;s no repeat of this egregious behavior with other customers. I seriously hope that you being the general manager of a popular restaurant chain that you discipline this shift manager.

Really fast service and great food! I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecake and this restaurant serves the best in Fresno, always fresh and soooo good!!! Great for dinner dates or parties with friends/family. I go here frequently with my husband and some friends and we always have a great time and good food.

Not only the worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory.  But the worst experience in ANY restaurant PERIOD.  <br><br>On a Tuesday Night at 9:45 with a 3/4 empty Restaurant a 30 minute wait... Kidding Right... Nope. No care or concern from anybody in the place...Especially the &#34;mis-manager&#34; Cameron <br><br>No concern whatsoever.  No I am Sorry, no what can WE do. NOTHING!!!  He is the epitome of who NOT to be a manager.  It&#39;s no wonder why the place Absoutely sucked... Now just for accuracy, I  was there two other times within the last 20 days and all was well great service, smiles and what you would expect. BUT not this time... Poor Management (Manager) o yeah.... I WILL NOT COME BACK and will make sure everyone I know doesn&#39;t either... Shame on You Cameron... Get a grip on reality (not yours)

I cant say anything bad about this place. I have always enjoyed every meal ordered, friendly staff and decent prices...plus they have THE BEST cheesecake selection, I mean hello it&#39;s in their name. This is a great place and I will go back for sure, whether its for a anniversary dinner or just casual dining with friends.

Came here last night w/ a large group and sat in the freezing cold outside in the patio. It was windy and the entire party was uncomfortable and frigid. They do not have enough heat lamps set up. It sucks b/c they don&#39;t take reservations, not even for our large party of 14. So lame. So instead we waited 45 minutes to sit in the freezing cold while my food turned cold in 5 seconds. Grr. I&#39;m pissed just thinking about this meal. <br><br>Overall, the food was as expected for Cheesecake. I ordered from their &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu which is a lame name in my opinion. Or maybe I&#39;m just grumpy b/c did I mention it was friggin cold with insufficent amount of heat lamps? Or did I mention I asked one of the servers to turn UP the heat and she proceeded to turn it DOWN? Goodness gracious, wake up! Anyhow, back to the food. I ordered the mushroom flatbread which was tasty, though small portioned. The cream chicken soup was tasty though I couldn&#39;t really taste any artichoke hearts. I also ordered the pasta w/chicken and basil which was mediocre and huge. The chicken was overcooked.

Had dinner at cheesecake last night. The food was great like normal but the service was outstanding. Tabatha in the bar area was personable , attentive , and while we we not drinking , our meal , appetizers and service were top notch. Sometimes when you try to eat in a bar area of a restaurant the service suffers. Not here ! Great experience. Thank you

I went there tonight for a birthday dinner and had to wait quit awhile to get seated. We got our food and the food was good. Then I ordered the fish and chips to take home for my husband. It took forever for them to give me my take out.  When I got home it was just fish and coleslaw no fries. This is unacceptable!!! I paid 17.99 for fish and coke slaw!!! I won&#39;t ever go back. There are too many other places to eat.

Service was excellent.  Kourtney F did an awesome job.  She refilled our drinks several times and also checked to see how we were doing.  Food was good besides the mashed potatoes being cold.  We will definitely be back just for the awesome service (and cheesecake)!
If you want to eat a days worth of calories in one sitting then your at the right place . Got food poisoning from here

Good experience tonight with Paul as our server. The only reason for a lesser star is that I found it strange that my sons meals came out a good twenty minutes before mine. I would understand if I had asked for them first... But it was odd.  Had a great experience, and he was right on top of anything that we needed. Props to Paul!

Just went to the Cheesecake Factory Fresno for the first time.  It was my second choice after the long line at my first stop BJ&#39;s brewery.  In retrospect it should of been my first choice.   What we ordered.  A bottle of house cab, calamari appetizer.   She had herb encrusted salmon ( came with asparagus and mashed potatoes)  I order steak Diane (mash potatoes only) and we finished sharing a slice of red velvet cheesecake.  Everything was VERY delicious and excellent service too.  Highly  recommend. Enjoy.($118 O.T.D.)

Usually come here on the weekend.<br>The service is always great, my most famous dishes are avocado eggrolls, grilled salmond and chicken salad. <br>I dont like their cheese cake, too sweet.<br>Their drinks are just ok nothing special.

Was not really impressed with food quality. First time will probably be the last time I visit there again. Maybe if someone offered to take out I wouldn&#39;t refuse but other than that would not go. I can say I like the setup and overall appearance of restaurant food just killed it for me.

Absolutely always consistent. We come here all the time I just forget to Yelp in my own city. The ratings surprise me.  We have never had anything bad here. Last night ordered a blackened chicken and shrimp with rice, beans, pineapple and plantains. With a cup of clam chowder. I loved the clam chowder I ended up making that my meal with their incredible bread. It was more herby than I&#39;ve ever had. Yum. And a cup was a bowl. Lol. The blackened dish was also incredible. I only had 3 bites since I was full from chowder. Husband ate it all.  It was very good. Then we wrapped up with singing happy birthday to my mother in law and their birthday presentation which was so nice. And we ordered a slice of our favorite cheesecake ... Banana with a side of hot fudge. The food is always big enough to share. We love it there.

Pretty disappointed with the service and knowledge of menu items. We ordered an appetizer of Thai lettuce wraps. I asked if there were peanuts (I&#39;m allergic), the server said only in the sauce on the side. I said ok that&#39;s fine. The appetizer comes out the same time as our meal and is covered in peanuts  the man who brought out the dish said the sauce on the chicken also has peanuts in it. He said maybe they can bring out a side salad or something instead for me. I told him sure. Well that salad never came and I just ignored everything since our main meal was already there. Then who I assume is a manager, came over (I did not request to speak to one but that was nice of her) she apologized for what happened and offered to bring out a different lettuce wrapped appetizer. I told her no thank you since all the food came out at once. She then offered to bring out plain chicken breast for the lettuce wraps instead of them being covered in sauce and peanuts. I agreed and said sure that would be great. Did the chicken ever come out?? NO. The manager came up to us at the end of our meal and asked if the chicken ever came out and how it was. I said no, it never came out.  I was very disappointed. There is obviously a lack of communication going on here. I told her the main issue was that our waiter had no idea what was on the menu and at least could have checked or verified if he wasn&#39;t sure, ESPECIALLY if it involves food allergies. Also the timing of food coming out and following through with what was promised. To top it off, I was a little irritated that nothing was adjusted on our bill for this inconvenience and I was not about to make a scene. All I wanted was a nice family dinner out which rarely happens these days being busy and having a young child. We will not be back for a while that&#39;s for sure.
One of my favorite places to eat, service was good. Food was great and you can&#39;t leave without having a cheesecake. I recommend this place to everyone.

First time here and Everything we ordered was really really delicious. Im bookmarking this place it is now one of my fave place to eat. Customer service was really nice and always checking up on us if we needed anything.. thumbs up.

Went there for late lunch a couple of weeks ago it was super busy parking isn&#39;t so great we drove around for what felt like forever! But when finally inside the restaurant is tastefully decorated we waited for about 30 min which wasn&#39;t too bad our waiter was great made us laugh a couple of time very comforting our lunch was brought out in a timely manner it was by far some of the best tex-mex egg rolls I&#39;ve had ....I will definitely recommend them!

we recently took out food from the cheesecake factory. My husband had fish and chips the french fries were hardly cooked and the food was cool.I had beef madellions which were 3 small pieces of meat which were not done and were cold. I would not go back there again

I would come here again for the food, but probably not the service. <br>The hostess who greeted us at the door walked away, disappeared and didn&#39;t say anything...While we were standing by the front door waiting to be seated. Five minutes later she appears and apologizes...very strange.<br><br>My favorite item on the menu which was a deep fried ahi tuna roll appetizer was discontinued....We needed extra straws and napkins with our meal and practically had to scream to get them. The waitress was very short and didn&#39;t smile very much...<br>Besides the service, the food was delicious, we ordered the Thai Lettuce Wraps and large &#34;everything&#34; pizza.
I love all in these place; drinks, food and deserts  they have options for all the family.

Everything was perfect! I was seated just about 5 minutes after checking in (it was quite early on a Tuesday morning). We didn&#39;t have to wait very long for our server to offer our beverages, or return for our food order. The lunch special served me a huge portion for just about $13, and everything was correct. Constant (but not too often) check-ins from our server made us feel welcomed. Oh, and the coffee cream cheesecake was phenomenal.

We were in Fresno for a Foo Fighters concert and coming from Los Angeles, we were in a hurry to catch a quick bite before the concert. We sat in the bar area and told the waitress we were in a hurry. To our surprise we were served so quickly we were out of there within 30 minutes. Needless to say service is outstanding and the food is great! Recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a good meal.

My husband, daughter, and two grandkids and I went here for my birthday, and the food was very good; however, I want to compliment our waiter, Joshua J., for his service, which was the finest we&#39;ve had anywhere--even in very fine restaurants.  We had a cranky, hungry, four-year-old, and Joshua was very prompt in bringing us bread, water, and drinks, taking our order, checking up on us periodically without being intrusive, and being very friendly and helpful.  We went on a very busy Saturday night, and we were all very impressed with the attention he gave us.  I usually tip 15% for service, but he got 20%!

Steak Diane and shrimp scampi. Servings on Scampi was stingy only 3 pieces of shrimp. Steak was also overcooked. I ordered medium and my buddy oredered medium rare both were tough. Service was great both waitress, waiters, and host. Order was on time despite of them being busy.

2018-01-01 felt like going to Marie Callendars after they sold out, cut back on portions, quality of food, no cleaning staff but prices the same. Could&#39;ve been a bad day for them but they were uncaring with no remorse, you know the feeling you get. We don&#39;t care what you ordered wasn&#39;t right. Restaurant nearly empty @ 3 pm no waiting etc.  Shouldn&#39;t have stayed didn&#39;t look right. Just wont go back. Forewarned is forearmed. Wonder who they sold to?

I would give it a zero Stars if I could. Ordered a cocktail then watched  the bartender drop the orange garnishes  on the floor, pick them up , wash them off in the sink, and put them in my drink. I called for the manager immediately, told him what happened then left. Nasty ass restaurant.
Great lunch at the bar.  Order from the small plates menu. Ahi tartare was great. Margarita flat bread perfect.  Great atmosphere.  Justin awesome bartender. Thanks

We have come here with groups in the past and never had a problem, but tonight, with a group of 18 (16 high school students and 2 teachers), after being told it would be 1.5h and given a pager, when we returned the MANAGER told us it would be another hour and a half. He had a variety of stories--we didn&#39;t have our whole party there when we checked in, he had to give the tables away, he was working on getting our party in, etc. NO THANK YOU CHEESECAKE FACTORY! This will be remembered by an otherwise loyal customer.

Cheesecake factories usually leave a blah taste in my mouth since they&#39;re so typical in California.  However, what made this place a 4 star to me was <br>1) the staff are fun<br>2) The party of 5 I had with me was easily accommodated with no wait whatsoever<br>3) The food came out quickly<br>4) While the food came out quickly, the drinks were always full and the bread was always aplenty<br>5) There must have been at least a dozen birthdays as Happy Birthdays were sung all around<br>6) But then again I did conspire with the host to  embarrass the server by having her sing for my sister&#39;s fake birthday. (she was compensated with a big tip though, yet I&#39;m sure it must have been unnerving that there was an unusual amount of birthdays that happened to be on her section)<br>7) Yes the bill was astronomical but when you&#39;re stuck in 110 degree weather, are hungry, and grumpy, great customer service will always leave me less resentful of paying the bill.<br>8) Did I mention the staff are fun?<br>9) Did I mention that they have good customer service?<br>10) Did I mention that the staff are nice and attentive?<br>Yup, all of the above make a difference

The Cheesecake Factory can&#39;t seem to get an order correct! I pre-ordered a cheesecake and ordered a plaque that said happy Easter for curbside pickup 24 hours in advance. I&#39;m sitting in curbside pickup for 8 minutes with no cheesecake. I called back and the guy tells me we&#39;re making the plaque now. I walk in and see the guy erasing all the frosting off the plaque and starting over. Remind you it&#39;s 12:30 I have a 12 p.m. pickup. I told him give me my money back for the plaque. Seems like they don&#39;t know what pre-order means and the manager could care less!

Came in today for Lunch, and to Celebrate our 4 year Anniversary. Our waitress was Elisabeth F., she was Wonderful and our steaks were out of this world. I ordered a Coulotte Steak, it&#39;s a spin of filet mignon and a New York strip, it was delicious. Try it out.
Great Food. A bit pricey but not too bad. Only thing I don&#39;t like is the ambience. I can&#39;t decide if I am in a nice restaurant or a cafeteria.

Not a bad place. Was here the other night and it was noisy. If they attempt to seat you in the round room, leave the restaurant as it&#39;s the noisiest place. That&#39;s where they put the screaming kids :/<br>I&#39;m actually about ready to not enjoy my lunch... :( I&#39;m not happy!

Waitress tried to call our table out for being bad tippers, pulling out the cash and waiving it at us. Once our table pointed out how much cash was paid and how poorly our waitresses was at math, she apologized and walked away. I know things are electronic but she didn&#39;t even bring back the correct change after giving her $100. Older lady at bar.... Rude and will having me a steering away from there for now on. She was paid 20% but tips are earned not a guarantee.

Hit or miss with this restaurant.  The staff seems to be very tired and overworked.  The guy at the bar is very nice and attentive though.  The food seems to be declining in freshness over the past few years.

The fact that this place can take on a family of 50+ for dinner on such short notice already makes it worthy of a 5-star review! I&#39;m sure the wait was about 15 mins max... from when I got the call to be there asap, the drive over and as soon as we walked in we were being seated! <br><br>Cheesecake Factory held it down! 10+ to a table, 5 tables in one section and a waiter/waitress per table. Food came in good time considering it was not a prix fixe menu, water glasses filled, and each waiter/waitress was quite attentive and even playful with all the little kiddies with us!

I love, love the Chicken Bellagio. <br>The restaurant is always busy but services is also always good. I had been here several times and customer service has yet to failed. The waitresses are alway attentive. The food is great as well; even their adult alcohol drinks are not bad either. The food portion is huge because I always have enough to pack home for another meal.

I just want to know why is it always cold in there, and why is it always so dark? It&#39;s not like Cheese Cake Factory is a sheik hot spot joint located in a downtown of some city. It&#39;s in a mall! It&#39;s a family restaurant! Lol!

This was my first time eating here. I&#39;m from out of town and we don&#39;t have one in Taft. It wasn&#39;t the best restaurant but it was good. I&#39;m sure if I ordered something other than the Club I would have been more satisfied. The Mozzarella triangles were delicious as an appetizer. Now the cheesecake deserves 5 stars being that it was delicious. It should be since that&#39;s what they are best known for. The service was kind of slow but not too bad.

Went there last night with parents a round 8:30 pm. Ordered pork chops and steak. We got drinks and bead, and waited for more than 25 mins until the food came. My dad found a small rock in his mashed potato came with pork chops. Seriously, it was a small rock, not the bone! <br><br>We were too hungry and too tired  to make it a big deal. But now I come to think about it, I&#39;m a little irritated. :(

They made my group of 18 wait for an hour and a half then gave away our table. Then the manager decided to tell all of us different reasons (of which were lies) for why our table was given away. I suggest not going here! Awful service and others that were leaving there told us that they took forever to serve them and were rude. Don&#39;t come here!
Came in with a friend and Christopher was our server and he was just phenomenal!  Food was excellent and service was fast and yet very professional!  He is great and so is the Cheesecake Factory :)
Nothing to rave home about. The food is somewhat mediocre. Cheesecake is good though.

Not as good as many of the other throughout CA. It took 40 minutes to even get our order taken and an additional 30 minutes to get an appetizer, and 30 more minutes to get entrees. Two out of our four meals were wrong. The waitress, even after repeating our order twice, put the wrong food order into the kitchen. The manager stopped by once to apologize and offer my child the fries she ordered as compensation to having to wait for her food. He didn&#39;t even show his face and avoided us when seeing the order had been so messed up. We weren&#39;t looking for anything free but as paying customers we expected better. This Cheesecake Factory dropped the ball. Not that they care, there&#39;s limited great customer service in Fresno, so why make the effort?
Large menu and great variety of cheesecakes. Pricey but go for their happy hour. We always get the burger and a mojito!

My husband &amp; I came here for a brief get-away lunch...well it ended up as a 2-2 1/2 hour lunch rather than a brief one. We sat ourselves at the bar to get a seat right away, we didn&#39;t care for the 30 minutes wait time for a table (by the way, Sunday after church, lunch time, is the worst time to come in!!). Our tall, dark-haired bartender/waiter was very forth-coming &amp; pleasant. He gave us service right away &amp; served my husband his drink immediately. We ordered lunch specials &amp; had a basket of bread as we waited for our meal. <br>Ok...here is the run down: we arrived around 1:30 p.m. Sat at the bar &amp; placed our order by 1:40 p.m. I was watching the Chicago Bulls vs. LA Clippers game, 3rd quarter in. I&#39;m enjoying the moment with my husband as the time flies, making plans for vacations and so forth.<br>*********<br>So its the end of the game (the Clippers won by the way), we had our second basket of bread &amp; butter. My husband had to limit himself with a second beer, since he was driving and its 3:00 p.m. (-_-) ONE HOUR AND SOMETHING MINUTES FOR OUR FOOD. Wait, let me be honest because I&#39;m rounding off the time, maybe it was 2:58p.m. for our food to actually arrive. <br>I do have to point out that the bartender/waiter was courteous &amp; kept his actions professional, but it doesn&#39;t justify why our food took forever to come out! You would think we would get a discounted price on our meal...nope.<br>*********<br>As for the meal overall: I ordered the &#34;Pasta Shrimp &amp; Sausage&#34; plate, my favorite! My twist into this meal is I prefer angel hair pasta instead of the rigatoni that it comes with. Why you may ask; well I like the texture of the angel hair &amp; I feel like the rigatoni takes away focus of the meal--which I believe the shrimp &amp; sausage should be the main highlight of the plate. And yes, I&#39;ve ordered this before so I know what I am getting myself into. Usually with this plate, the meal is super hot to eat right away &amp; the steam is literally rising from the sauce. Well, it wasn&#39;t--I was able to scarf half of this plate down by 3:15 p.m. Same goes for my husband, he ate his macaroni burger, practically in one gulp. The sweet potato fries wasn&#39;t fresh from the fryer and it didn&#39;t have its usual crisp. So the food, honestly, for the price we paid, was not worth it at all. <br>********<br>Cheesecake: ordered the Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake. This is somewhat of a German chocolate cake wannabe. Not too bad and it was worth the try, but will not order again. Yes, we had our mind set on a cheesecake in the middle of our 1 hr and something minutes wait; so this was ordered right after our meal. From the variety I have had, this cheesecake doesn&#39;t rank up into the top 10 category. <br>********<br>The incident: yes, something happened overall this unsatisfactory visit. So yes we&#39;re human, we all make mistakes. Another waiter assisted us while our tall, dark-haired bartender/waiter stepped away for a few minutes. Well this waiter in particular, attended to us &amp; happened to assist us with boxing away my pasta. He made a light conversation but he didn&#39;t realize he wasn&#39;t placing the pasta into the take-home box, rather than the bar counter top. Let me rephrase that: he was placing the pasta on top of the bar counter-top instead of the take-home box...*****let that sink in*****yes, I know, it was a mistake. My husband and I have a great sense of humor...so we laughed it off--this was not intentional, it was an honest mistake. I felt bad for the waiter, but he did offer a lunch-size special of the pasta to be taken home. I felt he was embarrassed for his actions (since he scooped up the pasta and didn&#39;t clean up the remainder of the sauce on the counter-top, and continued serving the rest of the bar). As soon as our tall, dark-haired bartender/waiter returned, the other waiter disappeared. <br>********<br>The take-home product: yes I received my meal just how I wanted--with angel hair. But as I dug into it the next day, I noticed there was some rigatoni pasta noodles mixed in. No big deal but for such a high class restaurant, you would think something as simple as this shouldn&#39;t happen. <br>********<br>The reasoning behind the two stars: <br>*I didn&#39;t take a star off w/the 2nd waiter who helped us because it was a mistake, even though we waited another 20 mins for the take-home pasta.*<br>1. First star was taken off due to the wait-time of our food. It wasn&#39;t our tall, dark-haired bartender/waiter&#39;s fault because there are other servers that could have caught this. <br>2. Second star was taken off due to the quality of our food. Please see the above details. <br>3. Third star was taken off due to the take-home product. It wasn&#39;t made from the chef&#39;s heart. Going to a restaurant like this and paying the prices we pay for the outcome to be shitty, makes me wonder if the chef&#39;s heart was in the right place to cook this food for me. <br><br>Honestly...we should&#39;ve went to Olive Garden for the overall experience. So literally Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve seen better out of this place!!
Love all of their soups and their bread! The servers are all really nice, the only thing that bothers me is there are no reservations, but other than that the food is really good!

Worst experience we have had at Cheesecake Factory, and possibly any restaurant. We were told it would be a 10-15 min wait. It was over 30 until our pager went off. We went to the host stand and turned in the pager. My wife had our 3 month old in her arms, and they still made us wait almost another 10 minutes. We ordered drinks and an appetizer, which took over 30 minutes to get. We were not given knives to butter our bread with, we asked for them but never got them. It then took over 45 minutes to get our food. Then one of our party members got sick. We told our server we needed to leave immediately. It then took over 30 minutes to get our food boxed up and our credit card back. We talked the night of our experience and spoke with the manager, Amy, who said she would call us back. She never did. We called the next day and talked to Sal, who said Amy would be in in about an hour. Never received a call back again. Horribly disappointing experience, and we have been loyal customers for years. The food was decent, but nothing special.

I&#39;ve been meaning to give this place a rating, now I have the chance to. <br><br>I went for a friend&#39;s birthday and was not impressed with their service. Although we were seated promptly after the birthday girl arrived, our entrees took more than it should have to get to us. Groups that came in at a later time were having their foods before us while we looked around waiting for ours. After an hour and a half wait, we finally see our appetizers and entrees ALL come in at the same time. We were already tired and ready to go home. I&#39;ve lost my appetite by then. <br><br>Overall, food was okay, service needs to be put in check. Will probably give this place another try if another birthday will be happening here, otherwise I will dine elsewhere.
They have awesome customer service and the food is sooooo gooood(: the Steak Diana is so delicious! Props to the cooks!

Beware of curbside food. You don&#39;t always get your complete meal and the quality is inconsistent. I just picked up 2 BBQ ranch chicken salads. When I arrived home, I found that the Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t put the onion ring topping on both of the salads. They also barely put any BBQ sauce in the containers and the salads were much smaller then they usually are. I have ordered this salad many times before and this is the first time that I have had these problems. So I called and spoke to a manager, the only option they gave me was to drive all the way across town back to Cheesecake Factory to have the salads remade. I was unable to drive back, so I am stuck with two small salads that are missing the amazing onion topping. If you order from Cheesecake Factory and pickup curbside, don&#39;t rely on the staff to provide you with an accurate order, you should definitely verify that they provided everything you ordered.

I&#39;ve always liked this place. A huge menu will have you coming back time and time again just to try everything. I love the avocado egg rolls and the crab artichoke dip. Their cheesecake menu is great! Only negative is in the evenings, the light can be too dim which makes the menu hard to see.

This used to be one of my favorite places until I came to this one. The food was terrible and undercooked. I was never once asked how the food was or to have my $3.25 soda refilled.  Had 4 different waiters on a non busy day. I told the manager about my experience and he did not show any sign of genuine concern and laughed at me with his workers as my family and I walked away.
The food was amazing but our server was really rude when we asked for our deserts to go and she never asked us if we wanted refills on our drinks.

Experienced some of the worst service of my life. I&#39;m not from Fresno and I always look forward to dining at Cheesecake Factory as my hometown does not have one. From the moment our server (Jessica D) greeted us, I knew it was going to be a disaster. All she said was &#34;Hi&#34; did not ask my fiance and I how&#39;s it going, or what kind of drink we would like. We had to blurt out our orders. She came back with drinks, I accidentally mispronounced the appetizer we wanted and she corrected me very rudely and annoyed. She took our order, did offer any bread. We waited for a good 25 minutes. Our food arrived. She forgot the appetizer, didn&#39;t apologize and I told her to forget it. Our food was cold. It was very disheartening to see her attend to every other table she had (we were sitting in the bar area). She gave them great service. But not my fiance and I. It seemed like she was purposely trying to avoid us and would turn away when she passed by. I honestly think its because we are young and Hispanic and she made the assumption she was not going to get a decent tip?<br><br>We were not checked up on. Only to bring us the check and refill our drinks AFTER we finished our food. Didn&#39;t bother asking us if we wanted cheesecake (hello how could you NOT, its the freakin Cheesecake Factory). I was extremely fed up and spoke to the manager. He was half ass listening, said he would speak to Jessica. Didn&#39;t apologize. She came to our table and explained we were offered a complementary cheesecake from the manager. Did she apologize? NOPE. <br><br>Overall, this experienced ruined this establishment for me. I will most certainty NOT be coming back to this location, and it will be awhile before I&#39;m up for Cheesecake Factory.

wasn&#39;t what I expected the service was bad!  we sat down and they brought us our drinks flat coke doesn&#39;t taste old and flat the  service sucks ! Food took forever to come out! When it came out my eggplant Parmesan was full of oil it was greasy it tastes gross didn&#39;t look appealing .all around the experience was bad I&#39;m very disappointed I thought this restaurant would be better save your money and your time and go somewhere else.

We enjoyed our dinner here.  Service was good though the server was a little too attentive and kept interrupting us.  Hubbys order was wrong (chicken pasta instead of shrimp) but they corrected it immediately and let us keep both, which was good because the chicken was better he said.  Bread rolls were delicious and cheesecake was magnificent and huge huge portion.  I had chicken BBQ pizza, it was just ok, I wouldn&#39;t get it again, definitely had better pizza.

I have been here numerous times and have always enjoyed my experience. But today&#39;s visit was by far the best. Our waiter Matthew was awesome! We ordered the zucchini sticks, a sausage and ricotta flatbread, and a tomato and mozzarella flatbread. The flatbreads were so flavorful and delicious. Can not wait to order that again! Anytime our bread basket was empty we didn&#39;t have to ask for more, Matthew kept it full. We ordered the red velvet cheesecake and the salted caramel cheesecake. Delicious! We will definitely be requesting Matthew at our next visit. Never have we had such amazing service anywhere as we did with Matthew!

I had a great time. Moderate to no wait for two people when it isn&#39;t busy. Noise level is medium, as expected from a family restaurant. The food was awesome. I recommend the bacon bacon cheeseburger. Good stuff. But best of all was that my friend and I had an amazing waitress named Tara. She was very enthusiastic and great at her job.

What can I say, every single time we&#39;ve gone the service is excellent and the food is fantastic......a little too much to choose from, but still a wonderful place for either a full blown meal or just a snack. FYI, they have the BEST mojitos anywhere in this town!!!!

For starters, you can&#39;t go wrong with the menu! It&#39;s huge, and it&#39;s almost too hard to pick just one thing. The bread is so addictive and you can always ask for more. I was lucky to get a server named Matthew who was the best! Super nice, refilled the bread basket before we even asked, very quick, super friendly, and all around awesome! He even offered to bring us the cheese cake first to try it out (which was perfect since that&#39;s what I wanted to do anyways!) The food was amazing! I have never been disappointed here, and the service is always wonderful
Service has always been excellent here. The food comes out in ample time. The atmosphere is good. I have no complaints about this place. I would definitely come back here.

Came here twice already . We moved here from SLO and we are disappointed with the restaurants around this area - all franchised and don&#39;t care, not healthy either. Anyway the two times I&#39;ve been here I&#39;ve had great service and the food was awesome better than any other place around here. I also like the atmosphere of this place, reminds that you&#39;re not in fresNO !

Went here tonight with my boyfriend and was disappointed . I have been here a couple of times before and it was actually good. I ordered the stuffed chicken tortillas which were okay. The chicken inside was overdone and barely had any flavor. What made it flavorful was the tomatillo sauce on top. My boyfriend ordered the cali cheese steak and it was terrible. Meat had absolutely zero flavor, the cheese was all plopped on one area of the sandwich and the bread was burnt and hard. Needless to say we sent it back and decided to not get anything else. The service was good and the crab and artichoke cheese dip was good. Don&#39;t know if I would come again though. Kind of disappointed with tonight&#39;s quality of the food.

i went in few weeks ago, food was good as well as drinks. though what really got me mad was that i wasn&#39;t given my change back, the waitress decided to keep it as her tip. I looked for her but didn&#39;t find her. it wasn&#39;t much money, but i could&#39;ve used that money for gas. i&#39;m really upset! wish i could remember the waitress name.
Foods overpriced and food takes forever. Me and my firend waited 40 mins for our food that&#39;s ridiculous.

Was here last night and had the salmon kale salad. Not sure if was just poorly prepped, but I wound up sick and had to leave my friends there early. Went home and threw up everything! I&#39;ve been to this restaurant before and haven&#39;t had issues until now. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back anytime soon.

Tamale cakes?! I&#39;m Mexican, and I have never heard of these, freaking Cheesecake Factory showed me?! But is this something like &#34;chalupas&#34; or &#34;enchiritos&#34; something that isn&#39;t truly from Mexico?? Any hoo, IT&#39;S DELICIOUS!!!!!! <br><br>And I only had a bite of those, I had the fried bread chicken sandwich. This too, was mighty mighty good. I even ate it all, (you will realize how big of a piggy I am when you see the size of this thing). $10.99 for sammie and fries.<br><br>We also had the pineapple cheesecake...with whipped cream. I&#39;m just guessing it&#39;s about 80 grams of fat and 2560 calories but it will be damn worth every bite! $6.95 a slice.<br><br>-1 star No lunch specials? Really? I&#39;m poor I need some happy hours!!

The service here (besides once or twice) has been outstanding and accommodating. I enjoy the atmosphere, it is nice and relaxing and a great place for a date.<br><br>I have enjoyed many of the offerings on the menu, besides once. Which was my latest experience.<br><br>I ordered orange chicken (at a white washed place, I hear ya). It was good considering it was the Cheesecake Factory. But I asked extra EXTRA EXTRA spicy.... Yet I saw one (yep, exactly one) chili flake. <br><br>This has happened to me anytime I asked for extra spicy. I&#39;m not even sure if they add any extra spice, or if they ignore the request.<br><br>The cheesecake here is gross, they make it with sour cream which adds an off putting sour taste to the cheesecake. Try needa cheesecake right down the street instead.

Not the best experience, after hearing so many good things we decided to try it out for our sisters birthday, unfortunately it was a little pricey and the food was not the best missing flavor. Also, three of my family members woke up sick the next morning. On a side note the cheesecake was delicious for dessert. Probably won&#39;t be coming here to dine, maybe just for dessert.
This was my first time there and I was very pleased. Our waiter (wish we got his name) was awesome! Food was better than predicted and drinks were really good.  Will be coming here again

So first off let me say, I wish there was a different button for food and one for customer service because sometimes they don&#39;t go hand in hand! <br>So we finally tried this place for the first time, especially after hearing all the hype. Well, let&#39;s start with the food---reason why they got a 3/5 from me. The stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer were delicious, great seasoning. For the lunch pasta price, holy cow that was a huge portion, I had the shrimp and sausage pasta. It was ok, nothing out of this world, and it failed to impress. My husband&#39;s herb-encrusted chicken was alright, he enjoyed it, the mashed potatoes were plain, lacked seasoning, but the asparagus was delicious and very flavorful. I also ordered sweet potato fries with the yummy sauce on the side, and those were so yummy!! For dessert, we got the original cheesecake, and I was really looking forward to that first bite because I fugured it would be magical, but it was disappointing. For being named after cheesecake, I really expected more. Honestly, my mom makes better cheesecake. <br>Now on to customer service, that I give them a 5/5. Super courteous, each step was perfect--from the phone to the pick up. If you don&#39;t want to get out of your car, then use curbside. Super easy and they made sure to accommodate us in every way possible.  Nothing was left out, including bread &amp; butter.

I was there tonight with my family for my birthday dinner. We got drinks in the bar, which were great. We sat down and ate our meals, which were delicious. Unfortunately, the lights were so dim at the tables, we had to use the flashlights in our cell phones to read the menus! I voiced my concern to our waitress, but her excuse was it was &#34;part of the atmosphere&#34;. Bull. We really had to strain our eyes to see what we wanted. I&#39;ve eaten at this restaurant before and at other locations and have never had this issue. They want us to go blind!

the weather was great today so I stopped by here for lunch with the wife and i cant describe how good my meal was, we sat on the patio outside then I ordered the chicken teriyaki w/ brown rice and a peach bellini, the food came back in a timely manner our server was great also, the chicken was awesome i ordered extra teriyaki sauce bcuz i like mine drowning lol the peach bellini was pretty good too it complimented the meal, i will definitely be back

I&#39;m giving them a two star only because I love Cheesecake Factory food! However of the cheesecake factory&#39;s I&#39;ve been to this one has the worst service. I understand on concert nights at savemart center they are going to be busy, however busy doesn&#39;t mean you need to be rude. We were assigned a wait time of an hour when checking in, we waited a while before I asked if it was still going to be around the same time when I got the response &#34;you&#39;ve waited 40 minutes we told you an hour so please don&#39;t ask again&#34; so now I was irritated after waiting another 20 min I then proceeded to ask if we split up a group of 8 into 4 and 4 would that be faster, when I was was rudely interrupted by the manager to say they told me 75 min and it&#39;s only been an hour. I corrected him and said I was told an hour so I am just trying to speed this up, he was flat out rude when helping and lied straight to my face. However after that we had to squeeze into a booth that was to small to make it work, I think I&#39;ll wait till I go out of Fresno to eat Cheesecake Factory and choose somewhere else next time! Sad to say but a rude manager did it for me. Although our waitress was fast and attentive and absolutely amazing, sorry the manager sucked!
Great place for an afternoon out. High ceilings and bright atmosphere. Plenty of food selections. Service is always great. Chocolate cheesecake is a family favorite. Passion Iced Tea can not be beat!
