Between us we had 4 separate tabs. Our server was great, but her shift ended and she came by our table to thank us and introduce us to the male server that would be taking over for her. By this time we were just about wrapped up, and when he came back to check to see if we needed anything else we all decided to order some cheesecake. After bringing our desserts, he brought all of our checks. We all paid with cards, and while everyone else left their tips on their card, my mom and I left $10 in cash on the table, and I wrote &#34;Cash&#34; on the tip line of the receipt and, brought the total of $47.51 down to the total line. Today I go to balance my checkbook and there was a $2.49 discrepancy between my check register and what the bank said my balance was. Upon speaking to a representative about one transaction, that did not match any receipt from the week I had balanced through, it was the debit from my visit to The Cheesecake Factory. It had posted for $50.00. I called and spoke to the manager, and he investigated it. When he called me back he confirmed, that I had indeed written &#34;cash&#34; in the tip line but for some reason the server, who only served our desserts, ran it through for $50.00, when it clearly should have been for the $47.51. He was apologetic, informed me he would credit my card back for the overcharge, and talk to the server about it. But, is that enough? I&#39;m not upset about the $2.49, but the dishonesty the server showed in rounding up my tab. How much extra money does he get away with if he does it to every table he serves? I feel that it was a deliberate act on his part. I&#39;ve never had this happen here, and as long as this server is working there, I want all patrons to know this could happen to them if they pay with card.

My favorite restaurant in fresno by far. Everything on the menu is great and so is the service. Love the strawberry lemonade, and on Sundays you must order the monte cristo breakfast sandwich; to die for!! Fish tacos are fabulous and so is the chicken tortilla soup. I recommend everything on the menu because it&#39;s stellar! Definitely recommend this place!!!
Our server, Pedro was excellent and so was the food!  Spicey Cashew Chicken is the best!

Beware! Beware! Beware! A real warning if you decide to eat here. Whatever you order, if something doesn&#39;t seem right to you - reject it!  It is your hard earned money you are throwing away. We went New Year&#39;s Eve. A lot of people. Dark! You can barely see your food, so do not hesitate to bring a flashlight or use your cell phone. The day prior I had just done a take -out off their Skinny menu and really enjoyed their Chicken lettuce wrap tacos - mexican. This time I ordered the same item but the Asian version. Also, I ordered, off the Skinny menu, Grilled Artichokes and later, the Apple Crisp. The artichokes were way overpriced...$7 and just two tiny halves. I don&#39;t know why...maybe I just don&#39;t eat out very much, but I regret not rejecting that dish outright. The artichoke was tiny...about 3 inches long...both halves of the heart barely made a bite. It would please me very much if any of you reading this, order it and then reject it!  <br><br>Now, the apple crisp. Pathetic! $8 -- it came in a big shallow dish - goopy! I couldn&#39;t tell how it was supposed to be because it was dark! Took a bite or two and decided to just take the whole darn thing home. Well, I just finished taking a closer look at it, and it was raw! It was gooey because they just mixed the entire thing together, apple slices, cinnamon-flavored dough, walnuts. I put the whole thing in my oven and baked it for about 25 mins. It was a little bit better. By the way, the Asian tacos were good, though the chicken was a little dry. Those cooks back there were probably laughing their heads off!  This restaurant needs Gordon Ramsey!!<br><br>So, not only here but any restaurant, if the food is not right, you have the right to reject it! It is your own hard-earned money which should be spent on good quality products!!!

The service was okay.a little slow. My main gripe was the food. My husbands fish and chips were really bland. No seasoning at all. And worse than that,the batter was underdone... The batter was still slimy beneath the outer layer. My penne  pasta was also undercooked. There was a lot of bowtie pasta in my penne,and it was tough and most of the penne was stuck together. A bad experience for both our stomachs.

I go here for lunch frequently. The service is always fast. I usually just sit at the bar since I am in a hurry. The bartenders do an excellent job of getting me my food quickly and are super attentive to any needs I may have. The food being delicious is also a big plus.

Wonderful service!!! The food was great!!! I did not have to wait to be seated!!! I was able to find a parking place and the parking lot was full!!! This was my first visit and I Loved it!!! Thank you The Cheesecake Factory.

Love the food, love the service, love the atmosphere (works with family and romantic evening out). Consistently great!! Everything I&#39;ve ever tried in all the 12 yrs of eating at Cheesecake has been FABULOUS. I know not everyone is a fan (why I will never understand) but this is definitely my go to for a fix!
Love the three cheese pasta. Never had a bad meal here. Service is decent. Cheesecake is to die for. After a hard day a work I stop by for a slice to cheer me up.
Loved it sat at the bar had a great dinner drinks and it was just the right kind of loud burger with.a egg love it

Kudos to Elena and Brian, Managers at the Fresno location.  I was in town with my daughter&#39;s swim team for a weekend meet.  Elena &amp; Brian and their crew very efficiently pulled together 40 To-Go orders for us 2 nights in a row.  Everything was packed correctly, labeled, and exactly as specified...even the gluten free orders!  Friendly and attentive!  I highly recommend them!
I&#39;ve been here twice with the gf and both times was great. Lulu was speedy and very nice. Good food, but expensive!

Pastas and the breads they give you at the beginning are yummy!! Decor is nice too. However a bit pricy for the amount of food. It was weird how their artichokes were in while pieces; I wish they&#39;d have prepared them better.
They forgot to sing happy birthday to my little cousin after I reminded them twice! The bread was cold! Godiva cheesecake is the best!!<br><br>Food is good, service not so much

Can people seriously eat everything they are given? Goodness, that is a lot of food! But oh so good food at that... and then there is the cheesecake, WHOLY CRAP! Great service and wonderful food... oh yeah, and did I mention the cheesecake??!!

When it comes to service and friendliness in this town, Cheesecake Factory takes the top prize! NEVER have  I had a bad experience. They&#39;re always so great. I highly recommend their Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps, the Dynamite Shrimp, and Fried Zucchini. YUM! :) Also, don&#39;t be scared to ask for more bread, they&#39;ll be happy to bring it to you, though they might offer it to you before hand because they&#39;re awesome like that! :)

Went to this location yesterday since our family was in Fresno for my sibling&#39;s graduation and we decided to go celebrate and have dinner here. Of course we did have a big party of 19 people which I totally understand is going to be a long wait. So my mom goes in to put our party&#39;s name on the list and they tell her it would be a 45 minute wait; not too bad for a party as big as ours. An hour goes by and we still haven&#39;t been buzzed to be seated so I walk in and ask the hostess how much longer it would be and she couldn&#39;t give me an exact time and said she&#39;d have to ask her manager. We continue to wait about another 15 minutes and get buzzed in so they can tell us it would be another 30-45 minutes because they were waiting for tables to clear out. At this point I&#39;m irritated because we&#39;ve just waited for over an hour. We walk back outside to wait. A member of our party checks in again with them a while later and the manager had the nerve to tell him &#34;you&#39;ve only been waiting an hour and 15 minutes.&#34; ONLY AN HOUR AND 15 MINUTES???!!!! Really?? like it was nothing. The manager said it would be a 2 hour wait. At this point we all decided to leave and couldn&#39;t believe the wait and service. This location&#39;s customer service is horrible! Worst cheesecake location I&#39;ve been too. I love Cheesecake Factory and won&#39;t take it out on the chain, but this location needs to learn how to be a little more courteous along with estimating their time better. It would&#39;ve been nice to know from the beginning that it would be a 2 hour wait (not 45 minutes) because then we could&#39;ve made our decision to go somewhere else at that moment. Plus, we were a 2 hour drive from home! So horrible. I&#39;ll stick to the so cal locations.

Horrible experience!  My daughter and I stopped to celebrate her having given two speeches today as a &#39;Hero of Hope&#39; for the American Cancer Society.  She is a cancer survivor.  It was nice out so we sat in the patio dining area only to have to endure second-hand smoke from another customer who said she was given &#39;permssion&#39;&#39; to smoke out there.  I checked with the manager, Brian Rodriguez, and he said it was ok.  Really?

The Cheesecake Factory is an exceptional restaurant. Every time I come to Fresno, this is my first stop. The Chicken Madeira is to die for. The cheese and sauce are excellent, matched with delicious asparagus. The mash potatoes were also terrific, accented the chicken. The servers were just as great, and made sure our drinks were always full. Also love their brown bread, not sure what kind of bread it is, but it is delicious.

My first experience with this specific Cheesecake factory location was incredible! I only ordered the lunch pizza, but it was amazing. The salad was tasty and my Hawaiian pizza was SOOOOOOO YUMMMYYYY!!! My waiter was extremely kind to us. I had to breast feed my 10 week old and he was so kind about it and not hovering our table too much. Our food was incredible!<br>My second experience wasn&#39;t as great as the first. I ordered the same dish on my prior visit hoping to get the same taste, but I was wrong. I asked for no onions and once my dish came it was swarmed of onions. The waitress did notice and did tell the kitchen about it. And we ended up not having to pay for my dish! Yay! Overall, I still love this place :)

Very good food here. I had the filet mignon and it came out just the way I wanted it. It was hot, flavorful, juicy and moist. The service was excellent, and the establishment was packed when I was here. One of the best restaurants I&#39;ve eaten in a long time!

It took 2 FREAKIN HOURS to serve the food plus 30 minutes to wait in line. When i finally ordered my So called &#34;Cheesecake&#34; AFTER 3 HOURS it was just crumbled up bits with &#34;Cream Cheese icing&#34; and chocolate chips. And the food was just ok. So, Overall there is no point of ordering this stuff at a crowded place that takes a long time to serve ok food and crappy &#34;cheesecake&#34;.

I was here the other day at 11am and had a wonderful time! Very quiet when they first open, so perfect if you want to have some coffee, a light snack, and maybe get some work done. I totally busted out the laptop. My server, Jacob, was awesome-- attentive, friendly, but left me my space. I&#39;ll totally come here again, and I loved the crab cakes!

this place hasn&#39;t failed me yet<br>not too pricey, big portions, big flavor<br>best thing on the menu hands down is the grilled shrimp and bacon club<br>the chicken and biscuits, kobe burger, ahi tartare and bbq salmon are also very good<br>oh and of course.. what their restaurant is named after... their cheesecake<br>they&#39;re all pretty good but my favorite one would probably be the fresh strawberry<br>simple and not overbearing

Again a mediocre attempt at real food in Fresno.  The cheesecakes are great as I would expect..but for some reason the restaurant is too large and it feels strange.  But the service was acceptable, but I want more..
Everything was great, grill salmond , avocado rolls and new york steak are all yumm

Great lunch experience!  After being dissed by an unnamed brewhouse down the road, my fiancee and I headed to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch.  We were greeted immediately and seated in a giant booth.  Our server was friendly and efficient.  I got the pear endive salad and he got the chicken chipotle pasta.  We enjoyed frequent drink refills.  I thought my salad was huge and tasty.  His pasta was a little too spicy.  Bathrooms are clean and dimly lit, but that was fine.  Lemon raspberry cheesecake was delish!  Just as good as a Cheesecake Factory in the bay.  We will be back!!

I always find myself eating here simply because they have a huge variety and everyone can find something they like which is great when you come with picky eaters.  It can get pretty crowded and loud.  The service is hit or miss.  I&#39;ve had great servers and I&#39;ve had horrible ones here.  The portion sizes are huge!  The drinks are decent as well.

Ordered the pork chop; got a big, juicy chop with sides of finely mashed potatoes, applesauce and parboiled spinach. Delicious, the best I&#39;ve had in a long time. Followed with mango/key lime pie, a coffee and tonic - $36. A little pricey but worth it!
very good food and wait time is normal for a good place. the wait staff are very good and if you like cheese cake they have about two dozen types of cheese cake about $7-8 a slice.

I&#39;ve dined several times at the Cheesecake Factory locations in Santa Clara, Mission Viejo and San Francisco.  Like most reviewers, I appreciate the large, varied menu - everything from sandwiches to elegant dishes - and the very good cheesecake.  The food is consistently above-average to very good.  Most Cheesecake Factory restaurants are crowded and noisy.  I&#39;ve dined at the Fresno location once and felt that the food and surroundings were consistent with the others that I had visited.<br><br>Two weeks before Christmas, I went to the Fresno location - at mid-afternoon - to buy a cheesecake as a gift.  I waited five minutes at the counter while dining orders were filled and the mostly college-aged waitresses exchanged idle chatter.  When finally served, I asked if they had a 7&#34; pumpkin (seasonal) cheesecake.  I was told &#34;absolutely&#34; and the server charged my credit card  for the cheesecake.  Another server went &#34;into the back&#34; to get the cheesecake.  Ten minutes (no exaggeration) later, she returned to tell me they didn&#39;t have what I had ordered.  The first server went &#34;into the back&#34; to double check.  Ten minutes later, she returned to confirm that they only had a 10&#34; cheesecake.<br><br>I reluctantly agreed to purchase the larger cheesecake and handed over my VISA card.  The server charged my card for the full price of the second cake and I asked why she didn&#39;t just charge the difference between the two cheesecakes.  I received the typical &#34;deer in the headlight&#34; look of confusion.  The shift manager was called over to explain that they would cancel the first charge. <br><br>Fast forward two weeks: checked my VISA transactions and, you guessed it, I got charged for both cheesecakes.  Seven phone calls to four different people to get a refund of the first cheesecake.  <br><br>Forty-five minutes to purchase a cheesecake is ridiculous.  Others have told me of similar experience at this location - I know of several patrons that walked out when they were ignored after being seated.   I&#39;ve since eaten at other Cheesecake Factory locations, but the Fresno location really doesn&#39;t need my business.

I love Cheesecake Factory&#39;s happy hour. Tex mex egg rolls and avocado egg rolls are delish but that&#39;s about it. The pasta is so bland. I also hate how their happy hour is from 4-6 not 2-6 now. :(
Hot waitresses, good food, nice looking restaurant.
They have the best cheesecake around and their beef ribs are delicous.

DO NOT GO to this Cheesecake Factory. The Cheescake Factory is my favorite restaurants for many, many years. First, it offers a variety of food choices. Second, there are so many delicious cheescakes to choose from. Finally, the customer service is bar none. However, this is not that restaurant. The manager, PAUL LA SPADA, is the worst manager especially for an establishment like this. My 7 year old daughter wanted an avocado eggroll and rather than giving into her request, he asked that we move to the bar? Seriously, my wife and 7 year old triplets are already eating their dinner after a long drive from Lake Tahoe and then to continue on to Northridge CA only to have my daughter denied an eggroll? This Cheesecake Factory at Fresno is NOT KID FRIENDLY.  I still love TCF and will only frequent the close to my home at Woodland Hills, CA. Shame on you, Mr. La Spada.
Nothing special at all. Typical chain place with too many menu options and huge portions.

Fast and friendly servers. Their waiters and waitress are very knowledgeable about the food they offer their and make great suggestions, but the lighting is very dim and sometimes long wait time. That&#39;s why it makes it a 3 start rating.

I usually hesitate to visit any CF because the wait is notoriously long... but I really wanted to have lunch there today (and cheesecake of course!!), so we did! I&#39;m always looking out for places that are child friendly, since my two toddlers get distracted very easily. We were seated right away (four adults and two children) and they kindly placed our stroller out of the way. Our server Juan was very courteous and attentive. When I placed my order for the Factory Burger he made sure to point out that it was not the traditional burger, but one on a french bread baguette. Though I read it in the description, I appreciated that he took the time to make sure I was going to get what I wanted. We also ordered a kids macaroni and cheese (obviously not from a box! and tasty!!) and chicken tacos. Everything was delicious, and surprisingly fast! I ordered a red velvet cheesecake to come out with the food and it was the first to arrive.. no worries, my son was more than excited to have some &#34;birthday cake&#34; as he called it. My overall lunch experience was great, I was really surprised and how fast everything came out and how nice everyone was. Great example of how a restaurant should be! I hope that all my visits are like this in the future!

Every burger I&#39;ve had here has left me thinking, that was a damn good burger. They might make the best burger out of everybody. I had a few pasta dishes here to and they were delicious. The cheesecake I&#39;ve gotten here was excellent and the only thing I have to say bad about this place is that the parking and wait sucks. But you can always valet and hit the bar while you wait so it&#39;s really all good.

The Barbeque Ranch Chicken Salad was great.  Be sure to order this entree with the dressing on the side. In the past, it has come out over-saturated.  The passion ice-tea was great.  The service was average . . . nice guy, but a little robotic and awkward.  According to our server, they are rolling out a new healthier menu with some vegetarian options. That should be interesting.  Overall, a good night at Cheesecake.

The service was more than 5 star. The food was very good BUT two of us who had the same entree (the special with fish) both became very sick after dinner. We couldn&#39;t have picked up whatever it was anywhere else because we had not seen each other for several days.  It was classic food poisoning. Yuck. I wouldn&#39;t have expected it from The Cheesecake Factory.
YUM! My new fav dish is the wassabi crusted Ahi tuna. Its pretty pricey but once you have it you forget about the price. AH-Mazing!!!!!!

Cheesecake Factory is a chain.  Their decor, menu, and some of their food comes standard.  And yet, this one manages to suck.<br><br>While I can be a bit of a food snob, I do like Cheesecake Factory and have eaten at various locations from DC to LA to San Francisco.  This location somehow managed to mess it up.  I don&#39;t know how, but they made the food bad.  <br><br>AVOID at all costs.

The food was decent both visits. It sucks paying with debit there tho cuz they have AUTOMATIC tipping at the end of the tab that you have to pay and that really annoyed me when the food is already overpriced...  And what&#39;s with the cheap floral airbrushing slash Egyptian slash rustic look?! Eh.

Ok, so I went here with high expectations and left in utter dissapointment. First of all the seating in this place is horrible. It&#39;s as if I was sitting on someones lap next to me. Not to mention I got to sit and listen to the woman next me complain about life.  That alone ruined the experience. That was not the only downfall. You get a menu and it&#39;s huge. Sometimes too many choices is a bad thing. The food was subpar. The service was slow and inconsistant. The only brite spot was the cheesecake, but that alone is not enough for me to make a return visit.

I&#39;ve been here two time, the first time we went because it was new to the area and it was very expensive you can stand to spend close to $50 for two people.  The second time I went here because I had a gift certificate but still had to pay close to $20 out of my own pocket and the bill was close to $70 for two adults and two kids.  This last time we went we ordered the nachos with the fixings, and a sushi appetizer, then we ordered two cheesecakes.  You can&#39;t go here without ordering a Cheesecake.  The problem is deciding which one to have.  That&#39;s the only reason to go here.  But I should also add that the portions on all their dishes are extremely huge.

I love the cheesecake factory. It&#39;s located outside of Fashion Fair Mall. They play toned down jazz music, and have a large selection of all kinds of food which is generally delicious. So is their cheesecake. It is a long wait if there is a large group but for a smaller group it takes about 20 minutes. It is a very relaxing dining experience.

Ive been to multiple cheesecake factorys all over the United States of America and this is the worst one in the United States of America.  The spinach dip was good but the Lau Salad was really small here.  I am fat so I go here for large portions.  The large won ton skins were the usual size but there was no salad.  WTF?  It was an anorexic $20 salad.  Not good.  The flank steak I ordered was over seasoned with salt and pepper.  I had some fatty farts that night.  The manatee still smells like my gas.  I am cheap so I ordered the cheesecakes to go at the take out place.  The only good thing about this place is there isn&#39;t a 2 hour wait for 2 people.  Woot!

Had brunch today at Cheesecake Factory, my first brunch experience here and I have to say I was quite delighted! First of all, we had great service. For our party of seven we were able to order our drinks as we arrived and for the two babies at our table they brought a plate of bread and sliced bananas. I had the eggs benedict with spinach, bacon and tomato which came with a side of sliced tomatoes (or choice of breakfast potatoes). The portion was generous and I can&#39;t get over how good the spinach was. Yummmm yumm.

this is definitely a good place to go if everyone you&#39;re with wants something different.<br>their salmon rolls are so delicious. the dipping sauce it comes with really makes the whole dish.<br>their cuban sandwich is probably one of the best restaurant sandwiches i&#39;ve eaten.<br>another favorite is the garlic noodles with chicken.<br>and their chocolate cake is...omg...so good. but if you want to feel like you&#39;re eating a lighter cheesecake, go for the banana cream cheesecake. i mean i&#39;m sure it has loads of fat in it, but it really feels like you&#39;re eating light.<br><br>one really bad thing about it is the lighting. makes me too sleepy.

Ok, yes, it&#39;s a little cheesy. But WHO CARES? The food here is sooo good and their cheesecake SO delicious. They have GODIVA chocolate and have a gazillion other varieties of cheesecake.If you have never had breakfast there it is just delicious. The breakfast style Monte Cristo sandwich just melts in your mouth, delicious. If there is a chain I ALWAYS make and exception for it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory!

I would give 3 and a half stars if I could. <br>We are regular diners here, usually Sunday late mornings for brunch/lunch. At this time, there is never a wait. We always take our two young children, and the restaurant staff is ALWAYS accomodating. They store our stroller for us, bring out a little plate with sliced bananas and bread slices for them and covered plastic cups. For this, I am grateful, because it keeps them occupied until the food comes out.<br>The drinks are outstanding. Try their mojito. Usually the food is very consistent. We have our few favorites on the menu, including the avocado egg rolls, shrimp bistro pasta, chicken littles, jambalaya. The quality is a bit inconsistent as of late. For example, my husband&#39;s jambalaya noodles were way too soft and my hashbrowns were way overcooked--dark brown and hard. The cheesecakes are always outstanding, however. My current favorites are Red Velvet and White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut. Yes, they&#39;re as good as they sound. Too bad they post the calorie count. We will keep coming back, thanks to the variety on the menu and the family friendly atmosphere. I&#39;m glad that Fresno has the dining option of Cheesecake Factory.
Really good pasta! I also like the Cobb salad and the BBQ chicken ranch salad!

I ate here last night for dinner. Food was nothing special. I think food quality has decreased at this chain over the years. I had Cajun chicken littles....way over cooked. Wife had a chicken avocado sandwich and there was so much tomato on it that the sandwich was mushy and couldn&#39;t stay together. Waitress seemed to serve us as an afterthought like whenever she wasn&#39;t &#34; busy &#34; with her other one customer. So service was a bit lacking. Probably will go back......eventually.

I went there again last week. Over all I have been here 5-7 times this year. Every time we go we try a different plate. The food is really good &amp; reasonably priced. The cheese cake has always been great. I would give it five stars but parking isn&#39;t good, hard to find a spot, &amp; it&#39;s really loud in there. It&#39;s hard to carry on a conversation with your party. Will return again it&#39;s a good place to eat.

Went to Resturaunt on the way to a Zac Brown Concert. Was surprised with the decor. Very elaborate to be on the edge of a Mall. We had great service and food. I had their Stake Diane &amp; Shrimp Scampi combo and my wife had a pasta dish. Plenty of food with excellent flavor. We ordered cheescake but had to take it home with us. We were to full to eat it.

I frequent the Cheesecake Factory about once a week because they have the best drinks and dessert!  I&#39;m totally smitten over their Georgia Peach and Chocolate Banana drinks (although their a bit pricey, starting at about $9.50 each).  Plus, the Red Velvet Cheesecake is a must try for all chocolate lovers :-) As for the food, I hardly ever go for dinner but judging from the times I&#39;ve actually eaten there I can tell you the food is simply mediocre.

The only reason I&#39;m giving this place 2 stars is for the service.  We were seated quick and the waitress was amazing--however, the food had so much to be desired! My son had some pasta with chichen, I had a salad. The salad was better -- but over kill.  Sometimes too much garlic can kill the dish.  BOTH dishes were smoothered in it. Augh!  We left carrying our doggie bags full of leftovers that went in the garbage. The cheese cake isn&#39;t as good as Tahoe Joe&#39;s. Sorry chain food cheese cake place...just don&#39;t live up to the hype!

Cheesecake factory is overrated in my opinion, although the cheesecakes here are very good.  The food however, just doesn&#39;t quite meet my standards for this kind of restaurant.  I once ordered a salad here that by the time it came out to me, it was so drenched in it&#39;s own dressing that the greens were LIMP.  I&#39;ve never returned a meal back to the kitchen and not pay for it but in this case I did.  The server tried telling me that for that particular salad I had ordered, the salad is supposed to be drenched and the greens, soggy.  A SOGGY salad?!  Come on now, it was an Asian salad and I&#39;ve eaten Asian salads all my life!  However, their pasta selections here aren&#39;t too shabby.

Two thumbs way up, the food one of the best in town. I try something knew every time I have gone and it&#39;s taste, never disappoints. <br>Recommendation&#39;s: Chicken Madeira, mmm... so delicious, DaVinci yum, if you like spicy cajan jambalaya pasta the BEST... <br>WE LOVE THE CHEFS AND EMPLOYEES!!!

Love this food! Weird because last night they brought our main dinner before the appetizer salads. No apology, and when I cancelled my salad because I already had my dinner, the waitress acted very strangely the rest of the night. It must be an anomaly though.
I do not come here often, and I don&#39;t k ow why.  The service was great.  Very pleased.  The food was good.  I would definitely come back here.

This is a good choice for family dining, my kids love it more than me (they give it a five star) yes it is always full on a Friday evening and there is a 30-45 min wait but it&#39;s because they are so successful. We spent $75 for family of four with appetizers and kids meals (they are huge!) and two cheesecakes (each slice is good for 2 people or even 3)- this seems reasonable. They have petite appetizers which are anything but petite (beware! you will end up boxing half of your entree if you order one) and suprisingly delicious (recommend the vietnamese tacos) and well presented. It is so hard to find good appetizers in Fresno, tired of the same old cheese fingers, nachos and onion rings. The entrees are nothing great and are enormous- I recommend you feed on appetizers instead, or you can share an entree. I wish they had more lighting at the tables. We bring a flashlight to read through the long menu
Nice place, nice people working there, great food- I always get the same thing, the shrimp and bacon club sandwich, it&#39;s awesome! You should try it next time.
worst cheesecake ive been too. the servers are not up to par to other cheesecakes ive been to. food was ok. they murdered the unsweetened green tea that i love so much.

Get their early and your wait will be short.  Very well run restaurant.  Waiter was friendly and very efficient.  When they wife had a question, he couldn&#39;t answer he went to the kitchen and promptly returned with the answer.  It is a little expensive, but look around at all the people working.  Place is really run well, and the cheese cake - while very expensive is always excellent.

the best cheese cake ever in fresno, unless you make it yourself. buy a slice or take home a whole pie. you can set outside in there patio, right out side the mall, and enjoy the weather or the walk. very beautiful scenery. thumps up for this one.

This cheesecake factory in the Fashion Fair Mall is fine.  The major problem is parking, unless you&#39;re fine with paying $6.00 for valet parking.  We had five people in our party and the hostess&#39; immediately seated us in a booth. The booth may be a challenge for larger size people, but for us, it was fine.  All but one of us had their hamburger which was cooked properly and tasted fine, but paying $10.95 for a basic cheeseburger is a bit irrational.  Their menu touts using only angus or kobe beef, but I can&#39;t taste the difference between their burger and one from McDonald&#39;s.  Their menu is way too extensive and I wonder if they can do justice to all of their dishes.
nice ambiance, great salad, great dessert. good place to hang out.. love it there

This is probably the worst restaurant I&#39;ve ever been to. We waited for about an hour even though there wasn&#39;t even that many people in line. The food was horrible and cold. I ordered the lemon chicken it tasted like boiled chicken with some watered down sauce. We only poked at the food for about five minutes then asked for the check and to-go boxes. The waitress asked if everything was OK and seemed concerned but we didn&#39;t complain (we threw the food away once we got home). Didn&#39;t even get to try dessert but oh well it&#39;s just not worth going back for.

Typical Chain!  Had an Pasta dish that was over seasoned and tasted only of garlic.  Service was non existent.  Ordered our drinks and food and the server was never seen again.  Even the busboy (or some other server) delivered the check at the end.
